Problem is reduced when tripod is in its most stable position with all legs fully extended, but that isn't always an option.

Perfectly serviceable for lightweight cameras or for smartphones with the addition of an inexpensive smartphone mount.Should work well with consumer-level SLRs like the Canon Rebel. Not suitable for heavy professional cameras, and the pros/advanced anateurs who have complained about its unsuitability for this purpose frankly should know better. What were they thinking?

To be fair, I'd like to see this tripod in a 8-20" size. Fittings and adjustments are pretty simple and provide a secure base with smooth operation, with lense-height adjustment from about 25.5-52.5". Weight and folded length (24") are a little much for extended carrying - even though it is probably a lot more manageable than a studio style tripod, and the carrying handle and bag are helpful. This is light enough you might want to sandbag the feet, even though weighting its central hanging hook could be equally effective. Overall, I think I'm going to be happier with this type of head set on a much shorter tripod (or monopod) that I can set on a tree stump or rock, or clamp onto equipment framing...

I didn't want to spend 50+ dollars on a mid-tier or even get a high end tripod. This was the tripod of of choice, and boy it has lasted me for a few years and still going strong. It's very light and I can carry it with one hand. The adjustable strap on the carrying bag helps when I'm riding my bike and have it slung on my back over my shoulder. It's comfortable to have in its bag. The aluminum build is nice and light and surprisingly sturdy thus far. Height adjusts easily and no trouble with setting it up and attaching the base to my camera.It does well at the beach even on sand, I had to use the small leveler indicators which worked well. The only small issue on sand is small amounts tend to get stuck between the legs but that eventually comes out with use. Only main issue was with the plastic piece holding the bag and strap together snapped early on. Easy fix was just to use a metal split key ring and that seems to have done the trick!

I was given an older metal tripod that I have since misplaced.  I got a new iPad for Christmas for videoing my sons hockey games and I would get tired holding my arms up in the air trying to film over the glass.  This makes everything so much simpler!  I love it.  So many little tweaks and adjustments that will ensure it sits just right.  Definitely worth buying!

This is an excellent, inexpensive tripod for small cameras.  The legs are sturdy, it has a handle, and the included carry bag (mine had no Amazon logo) are a good value.  I'm using it to support a 7" LCD monitor for FPV flight, and could also use it to hold my Runcam 2 or Xiomi Yi HD video cameras. The best feature of this tripod is the hook at the bottom of the center tube, which allows you to hang a sandbag or similar weight to keep the tripod from tipping over on windy days.That said, I wouldn't put an expensive DSLR camera on this tripod.  The leg supports that connect the center tube to the legs limits the distance the legs can be spread, which limits use.  For example, you wouldn't be able to spread the legs to an extreme to be able to use the tripod for macro closeups of flowers near the ground.  You also wouldn't be able to spread the tripod legs out as extra insurance against toppling over in a stiff wind, or to adjust for uneven terrain.  My $200 Slik tripod does both.  However, as a second tripod or for a beginner, buy this tripod and don't think twice about it!

After buying this tripod, I definitely have been taking way more photos and videos since it made the whole process much easier. For most using point and shoots or their phone, the tripod will not fall or damage your camera. The tripod is lightweight and is very portable. Furthermore, the carrying case is also super convenient to carry around for anyone on the go taking pictures or timelapses. I used this will the cell phone tripod adapter for my iPhone, and it really helps to shoot long videos where you don't want to be holding your phone for a long time. In addition, family photos have never been easier to shoot, there is no longer the need for another person to take your picture!If you are in need of a tripod for your phone or point and shoot camera, you should definitely consider this one.

Love this. Fits my spotting scope at the outdoor range but much more cheaper and this looks like professional quality use. Great price point and has many features. Many reviews displaying cracking may be caused by user over tightening. It is plastic meeting aluminum parts so treat this a bit fragile and not good for bouncing around or loading heaving things on top. If you treat your camera or spotting scope delicately then this is just an extension of that and has to be used in the same fashion.  I enjoy this at the range and people always ask me where did I get it and for how much

This is a lightweight tripod, good for basic stability. The fittings and hinges are mostly plastic, but it works well if you don't treat it like some heavy duty A/V tripod.  I use mine for a shooting chronograph, and for that application it's perfect, it holds the chronograph in place at the height and position I need it, and it's light weight makes it easy to carry to my gun club's rifle range.  If I were a serious photographer or something, I'd definitely get a better tripod than this, but for the price, and my needs it was a perfect fit.

One of the best products I've ever purchased on Amazon!!!! You can't go wrong especially for the price!!! It is waaaayyy cheaper that buying other identical products for the purpose. I have a Nikon D5200 camera and I have been wanting/needing to get a tripod for it to take videos of my child's band concerts. I hate to pay a lot for something that I'll use maybe 3 or 4x a year. Then I came across this one and read great reviews so I gave it a shot.Yes, it doesn't come with an instructional guide but it is not rocket science to figure out what the little knobs and knick knacks are for!!! It extends on a pretty great height and holds my camera still without worrying it will tip over. The base does not expand too too wide so it fits perfectly on those very tight auditorium seat leg spaces. The base that holds the camera detaches so you can attach the cam and just snap it back on and keep it in place. (Took me 2nd time using it to figure that one out! Lol)

I bought this after owning several tripods for my phone that are advertised as for phones, cameras, and for video cameras. I always end up breaking them because they're either cheaply made or just because I'm very rough on stuff. So after looking for quite a while I ordered this as a replacement for my others as I've broken several in the past few years. This is by far the best built tripod I've ever seen! It's SO much more rugged then everything else, yet it's not really more bulky. The tubing is oblong and squared in some areas which makes this a much stronger design then just about everything else unless you're willing to spend a couple hundred bucks that is. A huge added bonus is the built in telescoping vertical post. It's nice for after you've already set the leg height yet still need to go up or down a little more, yet if you do need to go up alot more it does extend upwards around a foot or so. I bought the extended warranty for this due to the fact I break everything but in reality this'll probably be the only one I don't need it for. Very well made Amazon, thank you! 👍👌

I'm new to photography. I have a Lumix G85, which is what I used on this tripod. The tripod worked great. It is easy to set up and it is reasonably sturdy; I never felt too nervous about my camera even while using the tripod on sand in Lummus Park in South Beach. When folded up, it fit easily into my luggage. It also comes with a nice case. I highly recommend it for its value and quality.Also, I am 5' 10" (which is about the average male height) and it extends high enough for me to be able to take a video or photo of myself or any other person of average height at a straight angle just a few feet in front of the camera. This was a concern I had and I could not find a review addressing it. Indeed, almost every discussion in forums that I have found of a photographer's height in relation to any tripod pertains to whether the tripod extends high enough to make the photographer comfortable while taking the photos, not whether it is tall enough to allow for good photos of people standing in front of it without having to tilt the camera up at an angle.

Update: After making a warranty claim through amazon, AmazonBasics was very quick to respond and sent a replacement within a couple of days. I only gave them four stars because the other tripod broke, but I'm definitely appreciative of their customer service.The basic aluminum stand is sturdy enough, but the head mount and control peice is extremely cheap. Small parts to keep a screw in cracked or fell out under normal use, rendering it useless except for perhaps bashing peoples heads with. I bought this tripod less than a year ago, and expect more quality from an AmazonBasics product. (even if it was dirt cheap...)  To be fair, though, I cannot guarantee that my tripod wasn't a defective one, or this is just the general quality of these products. In any event, I am very disappointed.

Good quality yet a little flimsy due to how light weight it is. For the price though I would not mind it much if it was broken. You will want to pass on this tripod if your rig weighs more than 10lbs though as it feels like the legs would buckle under a good load. So if you have something in the weight range of an old VHS Brick-camcorder I would not trust in this to support it. As for the top clamp not holding the load and swiveling on it's own, get some paper and shove it in between the clamping surfaces. That will add more friction to the clamp and keep it from drooping when tightened.

I bought this tripod so I would have more options for using my Logitech webcam for online interfacing. I was not certain the base of the Logitech 920 would be compatible with this tripod, but it is 100%. The base of the webcam accepts the bolt on the tripod mounting plate perfectly. And there is a quick release feature on the tripod to ensure the webcam won't tip off when you move the unit around. Perhaps the less expensive tripod Amazon sells would also have worked, but I did not try that one - just went for this one because of the high reviews.

Great little tripod for the price. It is definitely lightweight, comes with a carrying case, folds up easily (telescoping legs), and is perfectly sized for travel. However, it does have some issues.  Despite having  levelers built in (mini bubble levels) it has difficulty maintaining position once put in place. I tried to film an interview but the camera very slowly dropped back down out of the level position. It did this very gradually, probably a few mm at a time.  It also seemed to lack functionality.  While it was able to swivel horizontally, it would not tilt more than a few degrees. Removal of the camera from the tripod is a bit cumbersome but not difficult.  It came as part of a package deal so I wasn't expecting much.  If you are purchasing one for professional use, you may want to keep browsing. It is possible that I received a defective one given the number of 5 star reviews.

This tripod has so many features. I use it to take high resolution photos of my paintings, in progress as here and when completed. I'm not a photographer, so this is new to me, but this tripod has many more features than my husband's tripod, and he is an amateur photographer. I love the perpendicular bubble balances for leveling. The height extension is great. The feet of the tripod angle, to rest with stability on even an irregular surface. The tripod is adjustable in many ways to align a camera, and the tighteners are secure. The snap-off camera mount is very convenient. I like the crank for extending the height of the camera, instead of raising it manually. For such a well-constructed product, the price is a great deal. I am so glad I did not buy my tripod at the city photo store.

I love this simple and light-weight tripod and considering the price, it does a really good job. It doesn't feel cheap and has a good amount of adjustments you can do with the tripod. I bought this tripod for a photo shoot I did with my roommate and we did a fairly good amount of walking and this tripod did not feel heavy or burdensome to carry at all. However, when I got the tripod, one of the legs was broken so it was a bit of a struggle to adjust the legs to be the same length. I had the product replaced for a new one and within 2-3 business days I got a brand new one, all legs completely functional and working. Great tripod for beginner photographers like myself and great customer services. 5-Star!

This tripod is very light weight, perfect for birding outings where a heavier tripod would be tiring, awkward and cumbersome. It is sturdy enough for a camera with a 75-300mm telephoto lens, but may not be heavy/sturdy enough, or have enough mass for a very long telephoto lens and camera. It has a carrying handle, adjustments for lateral rotation,  vertical rotation, elevation, and a mount that attaches to the base of the camera or lens and allows for a quick connect/disconnect.  There are three telescoping segments to each of the three legs that lock securely.

I believe when reviewing a product, price has to be a consideration. Given the cost and functionality it’s definitely a five star. I did send the first one back as the locking mechanism for the tilt function did not work.Having said that, the return process was as painless as it could have been. A new one was sent out as soon as the problem was reported and the replacement arrived promptly. It functions perfectly. This is considering a price slightly under $24.00.  Now, if I‘d paid $175.00 for it, I would not be as impressed as I am given what I paid. Also, if I were a professional photographer, I’d no doubt spend a couple of Benjamin’s on a carbon fiber tripod that would be more durable, but this one should last a good long time considering the anticipated use. Well worth it and I would do it again.

I loved this tripod when I first opened it! It's so tall and perfect for what I needed it for. Unfortunately, I went to use it last week I found that I couldn't extend one of the legs anymore because it had came apart for nothing! So evem when I extend it I can't lock it! I'm pissed because I don't want to go through sending it back and getting a replacement but I have no choice because I can't use it. I need to shoot full body shots meaning I need it to extend to it's tallest height. I have been trying to contact the seller 1st but I can't seem to find a way. I need this fixed asap I haven't even had it 3 weeks yet!

It's not the best but for the purpose I bought it for which was aim toward my young kids aged 11 and 9 it's perfect. It provides them the necessary fun factor to use and you don't have to worry about them roughing it up and breaking it. This is a pretty tough tripod from the tripods that I have used. I have another one which I have my older kids using which is a little bit more delicate and expensive. This one provides just enough that I don't have to worry and I have piece of mind. I'm so satisfied this did not cost a fortune.

For those questioning this tripod, it is what it is, which is a pretty sturdy, VERY light, easy to use tripod, especially for a beginner, or a back up, or just something to put your camera on. I don't use the thin extention legs because it gets less stable when using those, and I don't eed it to go that high. I extend the center pole to it's highest point, and extend the thicker legs all the way and that's it. The only thing I would improve on would be the left to right swivel. It's kind of tight and jerky and not good for a really smooth pan. That said, it is plastic, and for $25, it's not to be expected. For the price, though, it is perfectly fine and quite sturdy for any camera you can put on it. PS - the detachable plate is the best part of it as I go back and forth between tripod shots and hand held. Thanks Amazon!! : )

I was very pleased with this tripod. Extends easily and stable once locked down. Not for heavy cameras with mega lenses, or meant for heavy work, not a top of the line pro tripod, but it's 25 bucks, not 700.  Very usable for the average enthusiasts,  or as a light stand etc. It holds my pentax k3, with a tamron 70-200 lens quite well, wouldn't  push it much farther. Buy it for what it is, and you'll be happy, might get another just to toss in the trunk in case. Pleased. PS: the removable base can be put on in any direction, helps avoid confusion.

I was debating to purchase this product due to some negative reviews on YouTube. I bought many tripods from eBay and other online retailers. They all look great and even work great for a few weeks and then everything starts falling apart. I was a little skeptical about buying this however I decided to give it a shot and it was a great decision. I would recommend this to anyone.

Wow. I've bought many tripods in the past but this is probably the best you'll get at this price point. The legs of the tripod feel sturdy, and the grips feel durable. It doesn't wobble at all! The screw that attaches to your camera/microphone has a removable mount for easy access. Everything on this tripod feels well thought out and carefully engineered. The plastic parts don't feel cheap and amazon uses metal pieces where its needed. It doesn't feel too heavy when carrying around! (Although I'm not really going anywhere)

Very convenient tripod at a good price. It sets up nicely and is fairly straightforward, though it's not always clear what does what when you first start out. I got this to hold an iphone for recording and it does this rather well when you purchase an additional mount.My main gripe is that the tripod wobbles if you try to change the angle. This basically means that for quality recordings, you can't move it without messing up the footage. I tried using this to record a dance performance, but when I changed the angle using the handle, the picture wobbled, and the audio picked up on the noise.

I really like this tripod, but would like to see a little more rigidity, the hook for a weight is a must and a good feature.Used it a lot over the forth of July, sighting several firearms and it worked well as long as we were careful not to bump any part of it.

I have a plein air easel that I purchased that came with a tripod to support it.  The original tripod broke so I replaced it with this one.  This tripod is more sturdy than the original and more stable.  Once the easel angles and height is set, it stays put.  I like the addition of the hook on the center post that allows me to put some weight in the carry bag to keep it standing in wind.  I have not yet tested it outside, but it has been great for working on small paintings in the studio.

Very nice tripod for the price. Folds up easily and is very compact. The locking mechanisms for the legs wont handle rough use and seem to be a little on the cheap side, but at this price point its more than adequate.The adjustability is very nice and will easily stay in any position. It comes with a nylon carrying case with large zippers that seems well constructed. There were no instructions included, at least in my package, so it took a little bit to discover some adjustments.

Clean lines, item nicer looking than pic and seems sturdy enough for all my needs. Like the twin bubbles (a selling point for me) and I imagine it will break in nicely with some use-would rather have some stiff at start than slop 'n flop. Fits my FZ30 and the 35mm just fine and should go all the way w/my med. format S1000. The weight hook's a handy touch I WILL need it at times due to some of the locales I shoot (beaches, wilderness &  mtns.). It will be tested at these times of need. Great for the price. Works so far with the testing shots around here. Arrived as promised as usual. I like it.

Only problem is the screw to attach the camera is too short.  Looking for a different mount for this.  I ended up making a bracket to compensate for the short screw.  Device has to be offset from center a bit but it works.  Manufacturer really needs to address this issue.  Would be simple to make it so the screw is NOT captured or to provide a an additional mount to account for devices which may require the longer screw.  This product would have received 5 stars from me if not for that simple issue.

I have bought other amazon basics product before mostly HDMI cables and what not but decided to buy this for a friend as he is learning photography and needed a tripod for those cool steady shoots that he needed. He loves it! He told me this feels like a product that is a lot more expensive than what it actually is and I agree with himPros

Seems like a sturdy tripod and the reviews are great so I spent more than I planned on this tripod. It's easy to set up and the level is a plus but it's hard to see it with the camera attached. The camera covers the level. The legs slip and retract after you expand and tighten them so you have to keep your eye on it. I have only used it a handful of times. A year later now: I forget each time about the legs. I used it last week. I walked about 4 feet away to get something, a leg slipped and there went my camera to the floor and my upgraded lens broke. Now it's no longer just a time sucking pain to keep pulling the legs back out; it cost me $600.

Felt sturdy and stable yet lightweight for a full-sized tripod. I got it because of the two levels on the tripod head, but ultimately decided to return it because it is still too big and heavy for my purposes of traveling and hiking to take long-exposure landscape or astrophotography. It would be too much for me to carry even with my camera backpack having a specific design for carrying tripods. I got the smaller 50-in tripod instead and that one is much lighter and easier to carry.

Bought these to mount my VR headset sensors on. They would work great for a camera too. They fold up very compactly, come with a carrying case, and are easy to set up. There are two adjustable leg lengths, as well as a crank to get the tripod up to the 60". There is a quick release mount so you can mount the camera or device without having to maneuver around with the tripod. Great buy!

I recently purchased this tripod to use with a Canon Rebel T3i DSLR. Setting the tripod up is extremely easy and offers a lot of tweaking potential. Additionally, it's extremely light and packs up very tightly, so I would definitely recommend it as a cheap travel tripod. The ball joints on the feet allow it to stand on uneven ground and the hook allows you to hang a weight and stabilize it. If you're shooting pictures on Auto or in normal lighting, you won't have any issues. However, while photographing slightly longer exposures (roughly 1/30s or longer) it's actually not very stable - even hitting the shutter button leads to some vibration, so you can't get a solid long exposure. As a result, I had to set my camera to a 10 second timer so that it can stabilize. I don't think it's reasonable to expect perfect stability from a cheap aluminum tripod, though, so this is still a good deal for the price.

What I definitely needs was a LIGHT tripod. And it's definitely light. Won;t hurt my back if I carry it out into the wilderness.Unfortunately, I was looking for a video tripod, which Amazon tricked me and told me this was... it isn't tho'. You can't really pan on this without looking jerky.

Love it. I use it with my phone + mobile adapter (bought separately). Very easy to set up and move around. I will admit there are some finer adjustment nobs that go over my head as a casual user, but it was worth it for me to buy the more expensive model to make sure it was sturdy. When it's all adjusted and tightened, it does not budge. I think it would do well with larger/heavier cameras. I wish it had come with a phone adapter, but the one I bought fits on fine. The carrying bag fits perfectly snug, so the only way I can fit the phone adapter in the bag with it is to put the tripod in the bag upside down. It's a tight fit, but it works.

This tripod is full of features that are present on much more expensive tripods. A removable shoe, which at first seemed a bit large, but it allows my camera to sit balanced on it above the surface that it's sitting on when not on the tripod. It's amazing that they can even manufacture and sell a tripod for under $25 that has everything you need including bubble levels, a removable shoe, nice handles and knobs, flexible feet at the bottom, a crank handle that will raise and lower the center post, and a hook below the post for a counterweight. Unless you are professional making money with your camera and can easily afford a more expensive tripod I would highly recommend this one for any recreational photographer.

I think you get what you pay for with this product, it broke after less than half a dozen uses in 2 months. This was a gamble because the tripod was affordable and generally had good reviews.Right of the bat there is nothing "wrong" with this tripod. My first use was for a still shot with lots of time for composition.  It has a smooth extension and felt pretty sturdy even with its plastic components, but after the initial thoughts it went downhill.

I was not sure how this would hold up since other photographers spend way more on their tripods, as someone starting out this seems to get the job done, although with all of the legs out it does seem to be a bit uneven so I slightly have to make 2 of the other legs lower for it to be balanced which may just be a slight flaw in mine. I use this for real estate photography and have not had any issues other than the above, I like that it has a center column so I can adjust the height without having to adjust the legs of the tripod.

This thing surprised me considering how cheap it was. I had my expectations low, but was rather surprised at it when I set it up. All the adjustments you need and quality hardware. Typically things like this the lock mechanisms/switches etc are junk, but this thing is solid. Really nice sturdy tripod!

Very nice tripod. It has a good, wide base when the legs are extended to make it a very sturdy, stable tripod. It has a level on it so you can make sure your camera or smart phone is taking a very level video. It's got a nice carrying case that is very light weight for easy storage and carrying it to those hard to get to places. I like it.I can't wait to put this tripod to use in making my YouTube videos for The Fitness Experiment.

The tripod was a bulkier than I expected but it was still lightweight enough to carry around without much effort. The legs can easily be extended to make the stand higher. The handle allows for easy rotation. It feels very durable and long-lasting. Lastly, it works just fine with my Vastar Universal Smartphone Tripod Adapter.PROS:

I bought this tripod for my second digital camera, which is about half the size of my first one. I know there are brackets available that let you use the camera in your cell phone or tablet. You can mount spotter scopes or binoculars too. Who knows what cameras will look like 5 years from now, but I bet they will have a screw mount in the bottom and a tripod will still be a good idea.I was surprised to learn how affordable such a useful accessory can be so before spent my 27 bucks I watched some utoob videos on how to select and use a tripod (I think I might need a monopod too!). And, of course I read the Amazon user reviews.The few bad reviews seemed to concern the tripod being shaky when the center tube extension was cranked up and/or the total lack of instructions.I think the two issues are related and Amazon could eliminate 5 of the 7 bad reviews by including instructions. The center tube IS shaky, even when it's all the way down, until you tighten the collar.

This is my third tripod, and the cheapest tripod I've ever bought... and probably the best for what I use it for!  It weighs, to a first approximation, nothing.  The details are there: bubble levels to level your tripod and your camera, quick releasing leg clamps, swiveling feet that are easy on floors, a quick-release plate, and a hook to hang things from the center of the tripod for stability.  I would have preferred a metal (or at least removable) hook, but if that's the only problem I have with it, we're doing well.  It's a bit light for some things, like time lapses on windy days or video work, and is very easy to accidentally move around, but for something that feels like I'm carrying a small bottle of water, I'll deal.

I was shocked to see that Amazon Basics sells a tripod.  I ordered it without hesitation, as I've been impressed by Amazon Basics before.  This does not disappoint.  It is super lightweight.  The tabs to extend the legs are easy to flip open and closed.  The head pivots any direction that you could want, and is easy to adjust.  All of the knobs feel tight and secure.My favorite feature of the tripod is the quick disconnect for the camera.  The biggest pain with my old tripod was repeatedly screwing the camera body on and off of the tripod.  This totally eliminates that problem, as you can pop it off in 2 seconds to get a better view of the lcd.

Very impressed with the quality of this item.  I was expecting something cheaply made, to use in the interim only to have to be replaced with a more expensive item later, but was pleased when it came in.  No replacement needed.  Used several times already, all the mechanisms work seamlessly so far.  May have to lubricate some the telescoping mechanics later, but user maintenance is expected. Easily attached my cannon, and my recently purchased movo smart phone video kit. Will be looking for more amazon basics if this is the kind of product they are going to put out.

I'm starting to really like Amazon Basics! My husband bought me this tripod for my camera and it is incredibly easy to assemble and disassemble. It also has many different settings and has the ability to be as tall or as short as you need it to be. It is made of very sturdy and durable material and comes with a very convenient carrying case for you to pack it up and carry it with you! I ended up buying one for my mom and one for my sister after receiving mine! Would definitely recommend!!!

This was supposed to be a momentous occasion for me, my first ever tripod, and yet, it's not what I expected.My initial search in Amazon was travel tripod so I assumed that the tripod would be travel size, thin, light and sturdy; the high reviews were also a factor in my purchase but this product was a bit bulky and heavy for my taste. I don't doubt the reviews, it is an awesome product, it's sturdy, and very versatile in terms of manipulating its parts for different purposes, its packaging was also executed well, you can really feel it's a premium product but it's just not what I was expecting since my camera doesn't need all that quality. It's like laying out a foundation for a skyscraper but only building a 3-story house on it.

So I found myself wanting to take family Christmas photos.  I have a Canon Rebel T3i camera (also purchased on Amazon) which is great and I saw can take a tripod and remote control.  I went out looking for a Manfrotto since that's what I used in school and they are great.  But then I saw this stand for like 1/10 of the price.  Yeah you read that right.  Move the decimal place to the left digit.  It's an "AmazonBasics" which I was not familiar with, but I assumed it was rebranded leftovers.  The reviews on this were good, so I took a chance at saving some cash since I honestly won't use the tripod more than a couple times a year.  And I must say that I was pleasantly surprised.  This is a solid little tripod that does the job.  It's not as well-made as a Manfrotto, but at the price I can replace it 9 times for the price of one of those.It's light and pretty easy to figure out.  It has a levelling bubble so you know it's straight.  The legs are easily individually height adjustable so you can level it on a small grade (which I had to do).

I purchased this for my best friend who needed a tripod for his iPad and recording equipment. He let me borrow it for my Nikon D7100. This is a great tripod for the price. I love that it has a removable platform to allow you to easily remove and replace your camera on the tripod. It easily rotates with 360 degree turns. It is lightweight and when I add it to my camera bag it is not uncomfortable to travel with. The middle hook allows for a sandbag to be place to prevent wobbling. I would recommend this for anyone looking for an affordable tripod that can do what the more expensive ones are capable of doing.

This is an excellent tripod, don't get me wrong here.  Great features, height, easy to use.  I shoot video and it's NOT good for panning (left and right).  It will give you a jerky inconsistent motion.Pros = Great for photography

The description describes it perfectly. It comes in a durable cloth-like carry bag that makes it easy to store. As of now it absolutely fits all of my current needs as an amateur photographer. As I learn more advanced techniques or use heavier cameras, I may upgrade. As for now, this is perfect for my current camera which weighs around 1.8 pounds and phone. It is my first tripod. I do not remember using any instructions, but it was effortless to figure out and incredibly sturdy.

This light-weight tripod soon became useless after being used perhaps a dozen times. One lower leg latch loosened, and, after a couple of hours of trying to repair it, can only be held together with something like duct tape. This necessitates keeping that one leg permanently opened; the storage bag is now useless, too. Yuck.

I bought this tripod because I didn't have one and I don't have a lot of money to spend on one.  I like that it came with a carrying case and is light weight.  It's simple to mount the camera to, but it's kind of cumbersome with the movements.  I have used it for quick and simple backyard shots and it was fine.  However, when I took it on a wildflower shoot with my photography club, I realized that I will need to invest in something much better.  I had issues with it panning down and staying in place.  It kept wanting to jump up just enough to mess up my shot.  I had to force it down while I hit the shutter button.  A couple of times when I would try to pan a certain way, the plate would pull off.  I would loosen it up and it would be too loose or tighten it and would obviously be too tight!  It was hard to find the just right spot.  For now, it's ok.  I'll continue to use it until I can get a nicer one.

Lightweight and fully adjustable.  Easily attaches to my backpack when hiking and light enough that it hardly seems like it is there.  Comes with a quick release plate that attaches to the camera body (or lens mount) and makes it quicker to set-up on the tri-pod.  The down side to this set-up is if you change between the camera body and a lens mount, you will need to remove the plate from the camera body and install it on the lens.  If you use you camera with multiple lenses (that use a mount), go ahead save yourself the headache and order extra quick release plates  to use on each of these items.

I've used mine to hold a small camera (no surprise it is great for that) and also to hold a large Square netted Brass Catcher when I am at the Pistol Range. The adjustability of the tripod allows me to use it on the Range Bench or when I go to an outdoor range, I can extend the legs and crank up the pedestal and use it while standing. It comes with a hook on the bottom that allows for adding stabilizing weight for the windy days we get here in the Texas Panhandle.

Like a lot of reviewers here, I was pleased with the functionality of this tripod at first, especially for the price. Right away, however, I noticed two issues. First, the rubber feet would come off while the tripod was just riding around in the case in the car. Not too big of a problem. Just find the foot and put it back on. Of course, eventually one of the feet came off and could not be found, which makes the tripod useless. The other issue I had was that the tripod was so light that even a light breeze could knock it down. So in certain conditions, you had to keep one hand on it at all times. It's a lesson in getting what you pay for.

I give it five stars because of the price. So inexpensive.Important facts about it: the legs don't go very wide. It's more about being tall than about being stable. Good for use in cramped studios. There's a hook to hang a weight on, which will lower the center of gravity, to make it more stable.

WOW man these things rock. I had my Canon t2i attached i had a light and mic on it. Then i had my bag underneath with 2 cameras 10 batteries and other misc items and the handle and tripod was perfect no bending or flexing ONLY ONE minor flaw the pan and tilt IS NOT SMOOTH at all even with my sony handy cam it was not fluid in anyway even when completely lose it was stuttering while moving it. Maybe some lube would help but still for the price a nice tripod.

Works perfectly with my Nikon D750. I don't understand many reviewers being high and mighty and saying that you need to spend a lot of money on a tripod if you spent a lot of money on your camera. I took this thing backpacking Europe and used it many times on rough, uneven, wet terrain. It was perfect. It's very light, which is perfect for travel, so I'd just be cautious if you're ever using it in windy conditions because it could be at risk of blowing over when you've got your camera mounted on it.

This just arrived and it looks scratch up like somebody had used it and returned it but amazon insist it was brand new. Pretty sure new stuff don’t come all scratch up in obvious spots.With that being said, if you are a amateur photographer hobbyist like myself, this tripod works great. It is affordable, have 2 fluid leveler built in so you won’t get crooked pictures. Materials seems to be steady and as well built as it can be for twenty something dollars. Not as lightweight as it is saying but then again it is not made of carbon fiber so expect it to have some weight. Overall, would recommend if you are just starting to take pictures with your new DSLR camera.

You get what you pay for. It's fine for casual use but it's not sturdy enough to withstand travel. The plastic grip broke before even the first use - no big deal since its really light and you dont need it. Then the wind knocked the tripod over (which is a really possibility considering how light it is) and one of the leg extensions broke. Finally, its really prone to dust and after a week the legs and center arm would not collapse or extend smoothly. Bottom line - if you need it once in a while for family events and indoor functions, no problem. If you need a rugged travel companion, look elsewhere.

Honestly, I have a tripod and accidentally ordered this. I was going to just return it when it arrived, but I opened it to take a look. Wow! I'm tossing my old cheap tripod! This on is so incredibly adjustable, even has a built-in level, a carrying bag, and works with both my iphone and my Nikon! It's so light and portable! Maybe not great if you shot in wind storms or war, but it really does the trick for talking heads and volleyball games. I'm so happy with this purchase. I will update if it falls apart, but for now, I am in love. Tripods have come a long way.

The AmazonBasics 60-inch LightWeight Tripod broke within three month of very light use.  One of the rivets that holds one of the leg supports in place sheared off.  I did not use the tripod very much in three months.  You can only return this product for one month.  I will have to contact customer service under the one year warranty to see what it will entail to fix this thing. What a pain.  I temporarily installed a cotter pin to substitute for the lost rivet.  The tripod was fine for three months.

Very nice for the price. I like the levels and ball bearing feet. Everything locks positively into place and eliminates any wiggle. Quick release so you can keep the mount on your camera and slip it on the the tripod very quickly. Carrying case included. It's lightweight and exactly what I was looking for. Even if I only use this a couple times a year it's paid for.

For the price, I was expecting something like my dad had gave me for a camera tripod decades ago. An annoying screw by screw adjustment followed by trying to adjust the height to level out. I did not read the details of this tripod review because it was cheap and I needed one quickly. Upon getting it I was more than impressed by its features. It has snaps to adjust, and you really only have to screw the camera in once as the base of the tripod where the camera goes can be clipped off. The tripod even has a level on it to affirm you're straight. I love this thing. I thought I might invest in a better one later on, but I am more than satisfied with this one.

I previously reviewed the AmazonBasics Wireless Remote for Canon cameras, and I am giving the tripod a similar rating. You definitely get what you pay for, a solid, functional tripod with no frills, no fuss, and at a great price. If you have heavy professional camera equipment, you're probably not reading this review, but if you are, just stop now and buy a Manfrotto. This tripod is not intended to compete with higher end carbon fiber designs, it is designed for people who want the utility of a tripod, but don't feel like breaking the bank. Honestly, for the price of a higher end tripod, you can buy the AmazonBasics model and a brand new Canon "nifty fifty" lens. If you shoot a ton of long range, still, or landscape photography, then you may just need to get something a bit sturdier. But if you're a hobbiest, or if you only plan to shoot from the tripod occasionally, this product is right in your wheelhouse. The packaging is AmazonBasic, but who cares if it doesn't come with a bow on top or a free sticker inside. There is a very cheap nylon carry bag, which is plenty capable of storing the tripod. I've used this thing to shoot family photos during Christmas, late night shots of the moon, and it is also a convenient way to store your camera at home without putting it away in its case, I just throw my camera on the tripod, and when I need it, it's there. This may change, of course, when I have a baby running around...

I am absolutely in love with this tripod. It does everything that I wanted from it and more. It allows me to take perfectly stable pictures and videos from my iPhone. I bought a universal mount and it fits right on here. The height is adjustable and it locks into place. You do not have to worry at all about it falling out of place. There are actual locks on the sides of the tripod so tht you can love it at 3 levels. Short, medium, and tall. You can easily maneuver your phone or camera. I used this with my phone and it works great. It is pretty stable for a lightweight tripod. It arrived in perfect condition and I have experienced no problems with it. It is easy to work and you are getting a truly quality product for a low price.

I can't say if the bad reviews are from people who just don't understand how to work the tripod or if I just got lucky. However, I have found this tripod to be very light and sturdy. I have had no issues with it supporting the weight of my camera and lens with no wobble.

Bought this to use with a Leupold spotting scope I had. The scope came with a tripod in a 'kit', but the Leupold tripod is junk compared to this thing. This thing is fully customizable with adjustments for just about everything. I've used it on my back porch with the scope to check out the mountains about 5 miles away. Super easy to use and seems well made for the price. I haven't taken this on any elk hunts so I don't know how it will stand up to the backcountry, but if you're just looking for a tripod for a camera or something like that, this thing is outstanding. I do expect this will hold up well in the backcountry as it comes with a decent black zippered base to protect it when it's on my pack. I wouldn't hesitate to buy this thing again.

Sure there are better tripods out there but you won't beat this one for construction and features for what I paid. I hung a 3 lb weight plate from the bottom hook for added stability and I couldn't be more pleased. I use it for taking pictures of merchandise to sell on ebay and it's perfect for that purpose. BTW the Velbon QB-4W Quick Release Platforms that fit this tripod can be had from ebay for $1.79 each.  Top measurement is 66mm X 52mm, slightly larger than the original Amazon one but the measurement that counts is the bottom one which is an exact match of 44mm X 44mm.

As others have said, better than any ~$20-something dollar item has any right to be.Others have gone into exhaustive reviews, so really just here to pad the stats: sturdy/well constructed (i.e. pieces fit together well), very adjustable, lots of small "nice" features (directional feet with rubber boots to dampen vibrations, weight hook, etc).  It's north of 3 pounds, so at least 1-1.5 pounds heavier than "ultralight" tripods that are literally 10x the price (~$200+).  Will update the review if this happens to break at some point, but I'd be very surprised.

Make no mistake, this is not a high end product.  However it is a fantastic value.  It is light enough to pack around anywhere you go and if something happens to it you're not out a fortune.  It is surprisingly durable for its cost and weight.  It does have a bit of wiggle to it so you will want to use a remote shutter release and lock things down as well as you can.  Its hard to control the movement, it doesn't pan as smoothly as a tripod that costs 4-20 times as much (imagine that) but I view it as a disposable tripod.  I take it places where I wouldn't want to bring a more expensive tripod in case it gets stolen or falls over a ledge.  I also always keep it in my vehicle with a binocular mount in the bag so I can use it anytime for viewing birds or whales, etc.  If you don't take a lot of pictures and just need an occasional tripod, this is a good product.  If your camera is a point and click, this is your tripod.  If you just want a tripod to steady your binoculars this should serve your needs.  If you are an amateur photographer and need your first tripod, you will not regret buying this.Professional photographers shouldn't even be looking at this product though.

I am actually really impressed with this tripod. This is my second tripod I’ve owned so I haven’t been through a bunch but I can honestly say so far I’m impressed. The material doesn’t feel cheap, it’s not too heavy and not too light so you can carry it around without feeling like you’re working out and it can hold up a DSLR without feeling like the tripod will give out. So far I’m having no issues with anything. The legs stay in place and I feel comfortable with it holding my $3000 camera. I’d definitely recommend to anyone needing a tripod.

This product is very lightweight, but it’s also seems very fragile. I’m using it for an indoor setup so it’ll be hiding for what I need. If there’s a potential chance that something could knock into it, I wouldn’t purchase this tripod. The only other thing that is kind of a pain is the plate is difficult to put in if you want to switch the direction of the retention pin.Overall, this product is great for what I need it for. I just caution those who plan on beating up the tripod a bit.

Almost all 4 and 5 star reviews speak for themselves. Amazon did good here. I actually got out of the car with mine attached to a ronin-s with a d3500 and a Milvus 1.4 50mm and it like was juuuuust the tipping point to how much leveraging the hinge could take. Scared me half to death. That's also what I get for not carrying it by the Ronin, rather than trying to be a cool guy, or even being aware of which way I had the hinge facing lol Thing is, it only dropped a little tiny bit, and now there is just a small bit of play on that hinge. So I'll need a new one, but this one is not only usable still, but it was crazy amount of weight that only damaged it a tiny bit.

This little tripod lasted me about a year. Worked really great for my Cannon with standard sized lens attachments. Was comfortable to lug around when hiking out in the woods or in the city. Easy to use. Recently bought a large ef 300 mm lens that may have been to heavy for it. The tripod attached directly to the lens and the plastic nobs that tighten down the unit wore out quickly soon after.. I could have over tightened but better safe than sorry with this lens!!

I purchased the APEMAN NM4 Portable Video DLP Pocket/Mini Projector which says it has a standard trip pod hole. I was hopeful that this tripod would fit and it did. The tripod itself is fairly easy to adjust. The quality looks good and I love that it comes with a carry case that has a handle. I haven't had it long so not sure how well it will stand up to constant travel to site locations but so far so good. Very light wait which is a must.

This is a very lightweight and extremely easy to adjust tripod. Simply flip the clips to adjust--even on uneven terrain. It's easy to carry with the handle and adjusts up and down in a half dozen ways. I love that it has two levels built in as well as a quick-disconnect shoe, which is invaluable. The last tripod I bought and used for magazine articles and pictures was heavy and clumsy to handle. I purchased this one for pictures for a craft book. It is so easy to use and adjust!

I first purchased this tripod three years ago for casual use as a photo hobbiest. Since the pandemic it has come into much more vigorous use. Every day it seems I am finding something else the tripod is able to do. I have a couple other tripods that are gathering dust. This one is my go to tool for taking pictures, and virtual meetings as well. It easily accepts tablet and phone holders too. I don’t think I will ever need another one as it is so adaptable to any situation indoors or out!

My son just received and put it together yesterday. TODAY the part holding the webcam popped off and broke. I wanted to send it back but he said it wasn’t worth the effort as it was cheap — well buyer beware when something is cheap — and he could “make it work”. So he just switched out webcams and used tape. Completely disappointed in this piece of equipment.  He does streaming online so it was in one place so it wasn’t like it was being moved around even.

The tripod value is not terrible for the price. I took a few stars off because the quick release mounting plate isn't the best quality (it was stuck on too tight to my camera even though I hadn't tightened it and could only get it off using pliers) and because somewhere along the line, I found a tiny spring and piece of plastic on the floor. I have no idea where they came from or if they're an important part of the tripod.I have a Nikon D3100 and with the 18-55mm lens, I wasn't concerned at all about weight distribution. The pan head is smooth and I like that the tripod legs lock and release with the clamps rather than twisting them locked.

Product was received damaged. The handle is bend but still does work. I also did not receive the adapter plate with the 1/4 stud out of the top. Was using on a cabinet project and needed alittle taller stand, well im out $$$ and i dont feel like driving 30 miles back to town to return this tripod. Legs work great but the top assembly is complete garbage. Im honest not worried about returning just wish it come with the parts i ordered it for:/.

I purchased this tripod as I needed slightly more height than the tripod I had been using.  First off the quality and features are first rate.  The double built in levels are a nice touch and the parts fit, handles, gears, plate lever are really nice.The best feature for me however, is the nice small footprint.  I use this to hold my video camera for bench work and the distance between legs when they are full extended is 30" (my old tripod was (43").  This means I can tuck the tripod up closed to the bench which I love.  I am TOTALLY pleased with this purchase.

This is a decent tripod considering its rock bottom price. Obviously, it is far from professional quality. I bought this unit to replace a nearly identical one that is many years old with a failing leg lock.After unboxing, I immediately mounted my Sony a6000 with my 18-200mm lens. I had to tighten the tilt mechanism quite a bit in order to prevent the weight of the lens from tilting the head downwards, but that was no big deal. For panning, I loosened the adjustment all the way. I film a lot of video, and therefore want my panning to be a smooth as possible. It is still somewhat jerky, but we are dealing with a sub $25 tripod, not $50+ fluid head.

The good: like it, gets the job done, everything works just fine, all types of dimensional changes possible, even has a hook to hang weights, the camera snaps in and out very quickly,.The bad: not a lot, it feels a little flimsy, not really the best quality, so I wouldn't rely on it for heavy duty use.

Has a number of good features including the price, but unfortunately the swivel from left to right is sticky & as I bought this to film boxing matches I have found it incredibly frustrating to use.I have tried to free up the action unsuccessfuly, does anybody out there know how to fix this? The other compaint I have is that Amazon gave the packaging size accurately but then put the box inside a larger box & as I live in New Zealand the freight cost me an arm & leg, far far higher than I expected

This tripod is the replacement for a much more expensive tripod purchased at a camera store several years ago. It's lighter & easier to carry, extends much higher, has more axes of motion for the head, and is rock-steady when set up. The quick-release camera mount has turned out to be an unexpected but big "plus" on several occasions, and one of my friends who's a much more serious photographer (with much more expensive equipment) said he wanted one the first time he saw me using mine.Since it was delivered, I've used this tripod for shooting long time-lapse sequences, fireworks displays, group photos, portraits, and timer pictures and the results (using the same camera) have been at least as good as those gotten with a heavier tripod costing more than twice as much. The ability to hang a weight from the bottom hook for added stability in windy weather has been helpful, and the extra-high extension (along with the smooth crank control) has allowed me to shoot through high windows with ease.

Why 5 Star: Sturdy; the leg quick clips work perfect; quick release works as promisedJust can't beat Amazon Basics products. Not much to say here. It arrived packaged perfect. No damage. Works as needed. Both my Son and have one of these. We use it for our Canon DSLR with ASP-C telephoto lenses. These are heavier lenses and it handles them fine. We have set them up for long exposures at night and there is no head creep. It holds sold. Understand it does not have that liquid smooth head a more expensive tripod has, but I figure if you need that, you will not be looking at something in this price range anyway.

For the money, this is an adequate tripod and yes, I'd buy it again.  You have to set your expectations correctly, given the price point  This tripod is easy to set up and has the adjustments you need for getting it level.  The legs are light weight metal but a lot of the other pieces are plastic.  You get what you pay for and, if you want a really heavy duty workhorse, this isn't the product for you.  It does do the job for occasional use, which is what I bought it for.

Many years ago, I had a similar model to this branded by a different manufacturer but probably made in the same factory somewhere and I loved it. I know that there are some purists who would never consider using this for their camera of choice, but I have no qualms about using it as long as I feel comfortable with the weight of the camera vs which tripod I use. I have found no difference between this tripod and the old "Ray-O-Vac" model I used before. So, I use this whenever I don't need to bring out my heavy professional Calumet model or if I know for sure I won't be doing any work that requires pans and tilts since this tripod cannot do those smoothly. There are always workarounds to most situations and I did use a tripod similar to this as my only tripod for years before I got a better one. It forces you to find ways to make it work for your needs. I also have no doubt that in time, this tripod will also break down just as the Ray-O-Vac one did since these tripods are rarely meant to last. But for myself, I feel that it's a good trade-off vs what I can use it for before that time. So I do recommend it as long as you keep in mind what it's limitations are.

I have 2 of these, 1 ostensibly for home and one for travel.  Unfortunately, my travel one has broken after just 3 weeks or so of light use.  My home one, which I got over a year ago is still fine, but it gets gentler use I suppose, less putting it up and taking it down and shifting it around and bumps and such.  This is a nice sized tripod with good adjustments and its very cheap, but it seems like it just wont hold up to much use.

Got this tripod to video 360 real estate tours. It is very stable, easy to set up and level.  It works perfectly for what I needed. Ordered an extra quick release plate to keep from having to switch it to different cameras. There was much debate over which one. I ordered this one and it fits great!https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B072YQDW78/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_asin_title_o02_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=1

This is an ok tripod for the price. A couple weeks after getting it, one of the legs fell apart. Amazon replaced it right away. Also, the part that connects the camera to the tripod, it is detachable but has a drawback. It is tricky to screw onto the bottom of your camera and has a second little metal piece that sticks out which you have to try to tuck in while screwing it on. If your camera loads batteries and memory cards on the bottom, this is especially a pain. However the price was great and it is nice and tall so I can make videos standing up close to the camera

I am stepping up my game so to speak and needed a tripod for night photography. I reaserched this particular model extensively. There are several reviews of this model on YouTube. Most of the reviews were positive, so I decided to go for it. This is exactly what I was looking for. It works great with my Nikon D5200 and as a beginning videographer, I needed a tripod that would get the job done at an afforadable price. I did not come with an insruction manual, but as I've mentioned there are several videos that show how to set up and use. For the price, it can't be beat. A must have if your serious about photography.
I bought this because I needed a cheap tripod.If I had to do it again I'd pay another $20 or more for something that doesn't feel like it's going to fall apart.
Here's a short version of my review:Pros:

Purchased this from my wife has her first tripod. The legs are metal they had this plastic. It is a nice big dinner repeat beginner tripod. It does not the same quality as a man Frodo. But this gets the job done and it does it well. The head is not replaceable. It is very light weight and compact I have used it on occasion for time lapse photography with my medium format camera and I felt my medium format camera was secure.

I'm not looking for something that has all the fancy bells and whistles, especially since at the moment I don't know what I'll be using it for specifically.  This is a great solution!  Easy enough to unpack when I need it and pack it back up when I'm finished.  Keeps my Canon 80 DSLR stable and everything is easy enough to adjust.  Glad it has the hook below too because it isn't the most sturdy due to how lightweight it is, which is why I put my camera backpack on it!

The metal thread for the screw of t adjustment knob for tilt position is misaligned with the plastic housing. The plastic piece for where the screw goes in is already broken and now the tilt position won't hold making the tripod completely useless. So disappointed. You do get what you pay for. Amazon makes money on volume, not quality. You think you're winning by spending less but in the end you actually spend twice as much.

I was not expecting much from an amazonbasics tripod, but I have to say that I was pleasantly surprised.  The tripod is very lightweight, of high build quality and comes with some fantastic features for an entry level economy tripod.  The unit is easy to set up, has a hanging hook, comes with a quick connect for a DSLR camera and comes with a carrying case.  There are two levels to assure proper set up of your imaging device and the handle and locks for the handle are well done. I would highly recommend this tripod

This is the first tripod I have ever bought and needless to say, I am greatly impressed! While some of the plastic materials look like they could break fairly easily, for what you're paying for it's a very good bargain. All of the knobs and dials are easy to adjust and the height adjustment lever is very handy as it allows you to fine tune your settings. My only concern at this point is that the base is really small so stability might be a future issue. Will update in the future if needed.

Let me start by saying I like Amazon; order from them multiple times per week. So I am a fan.But this tripod was a fail for me. For a kid, or someone on a major budget this would be fine, but for anyone remotely serious or particular this photography product won't work.

I am a newbie photographer and didn't want to spend hundreds on a fancy tripod, so this was perfect for me.  It is light, and I am a small 19-year-old girl who can't lift very much weight, so that was nice; also, the shoulder strap used to carry it is plenty comfortable.It is easy to collapse and set-up, and has a convenient easy-release on the top so you don't have to twist your camera off every time.

I was sceptical about ordering this as it only has review's for a camera . I purchased this for our new spotting scope and it does work . The only downside was getting the screw to tighten and hold it securely.  It was very easy to set and easy to move for different heights.  Highly recommend especially for the price .

Everything works acceptably except the swivel that allows rotation in a horizontal plane.  The swivel is so tight it takes two hands to rotate the head without putting excessive torque on the center post and tilting the entire tripod.  The torque required is about 0.8 foot lbs, requiring a force on the lever of about 1.7 lbs to overcome the swivel friction.A plastic bolt holds the swivel head to the center post.  A wrench can be made from a two inch section of 1/2 inch dowel rod.  Saw a slot in the center of one end about 0.13 inch wide and 0.2 inch deep.  Using this wrench to slightly loosen this bolt solves the friction problem.

I am satisfied with this tripod. It is light and easy to carry, yet sturdy enough when my camera is fastened on. I like having a handle to turn because sometimes all I need is an inch higher or an inch lower and I can do that with this tripod. I was also pleased to see that it came with a case. My only complaint would be that it is not a quick procedure to put my camera unto the tripod and later to remove it. The small compartment that holds the camera has to be removed by a latch.

Looked at several comparable tripods but decided on the Amazon Basics for price.  It has the same features but for ten dollars less.  I has been using my sons tripod and one that I was comparing with and this one is almost exactly the same tripod.  The only real difference is that this has a nice handle to use while carrying tripod folded up.  Came with a lightweight case but have not needed to use it.  Overall, great product and a great value.

One of the major attractions of this is the price. I think some of the negative reviews about quality are thus unfair. For $22.67 you can't expect top of the line, but at the same time, this is a great value.  At least for me, this is just fine for my non-professional use.  It does NOT have ANY instructions, but there are several Youtube videos on how it works, which I found very helpful.  Being instructionally challenged, I never would have figured out how to extend the legs without such help. Here's the url of what I found to be the most helpful video:  [...] Check it out, and it may help you evaluate it better if you're considering purchasing it. I've used it indoors and out, with two different cameras, and a cell phone (I got my screw on cell phone mount from Amazon, too, and it's worked fine on my Galaxy S5 with a very thick sturdy case), and have been happy with it. My Dad was a professional photographer, and I've found this to be more versatile than his 40 year old portable tripod which I have been using up to this point. Perhaps my expectations were not as high as some other purchasers, but so far it has done everything I've asked of it.

I bought this so I could shoot some videos and have a good stable tripod for my camera/spotting scope.  It works great.  Easy to use, easy to set up.  Seems really well constructed, surprisingly solid.  You can adjust the height, the inclination, the level, the pivot, all sorts of stuff.

I bough this tripod for my daughter to use to do college projects using both a digital camcorder and a 35mm camera.  It worked perfectly with both cameras.  It arrived quickly and well packaged.  This is a sturdy tripod that even survived being left out overnight in  the rain (OOOOOPS!!!!). It took minutes to set up and is fully adjustable.  I am very pleased with this purchase as it helped her to continue her work during COVD19.

For a simple tripod this is the best tripod we've used. The tripod is sturdy and offers intuitive simplicity even for a novice photographer. We use this mostly for family photo shoots. All of the knobs and grips tighten and snap into place accordingly. We've had this tripod for a few months now and we use it at least once a week and everything still works like the day we bought it. The telescoping legs aren't flimsy and slide in and out with ease. We've had issues in the past with the swivels and knobs loosening over time, or aluminum legs bending easily but so far this one has held up better than others. The bag is pretty standard but it fits the tripod accordingly, and is sturdy enough to be lugged around in the back of our car for the past few months without tearing. There are obviously better and more expensive tripods available that have more features and perhaps a better build quality, but overall if you're not doing any upper echelon level photograph (or even if you are) I'd recommend this tripod based on price point and build quality. You won't find a better bargain for a quality tripod than this one

It works for being a tripod, but had a lot of sloppiness in the top mount side for any video pan/tilt. This can also be an issue with photos, since you'll struggle to get it to stay in one place, when zoomed in. As you tighten the adjustments it'll move on you. The clamp down adjustments will never fully tighten to really keep things locked down tight. I won't use it for photos or pan/tilt video because it's a struggle to adjust it and upgraded to a better tripod. This one is only used for setting an action camera on and filming time lapse etc. Can't expect too much for $25

I don't trust this tripod. Build quality is horrible. The neck where it extends upward wobbles all over the place, no matter how tight you tighten the collar. The brace that holds all 3 legs slipped off the shaft.The all-plastic construction doesn't suit my needs. It feels really cheap. I recently got a new lens and I'm worried about my camera either falling off the mount or falling over. I see this good for holding a flash or a light source but not a DSLR.

I was looking for an inexpensive tripod for my DSLR camera for general use and astro photography. Seeing that amazon came out with their own line of products, I decided to give this a try. While it is "lightweight" it does not necessarily feel cheap. The carry bag is a typical thinish light weight zippered bag. The legs lock in pretty good and I have not had any slippage issues.  The carry handle on the tripod works well and is big enough for all size hands (even gloved). I also use it to run my camera strap through for drop protection. The leveling bubbles are nice and easy to see. The rotating and tilting controls are a bit "sticky" if you will. Reasonable expectations here. I was not expecting it to be a professional grade mount. In order to get "smooth" operation, I feel like I like I have to unscrew it a bit too much. One thing i will do, as I believe another reviewer suggested, is take the head apart and sand down any rough areas and apply some sort of lubricant to the bits that contact each other. That should help smooth out operation quite a bit. The quick release base is ok. The retaining button that locks the lever open seems like it may wear quickly. The base fits in fairly snug with just a bit of wiggle. I am happy with it and I am sure I will get lots of use out of it.

I use this tripod to record video.  The pros are:  inexpensive, gets the job done, has multiple adjustments, has 2 bubble levels built in, and is lightweight.  I find it hard to beat for the price.  However, having said that, this is not a tripod for professional use.The cons:  flimsy material and not solidly/tightly built.  I've only had this tripod for a few weeks so I can't speak to its durability.  However, the flimsiness of the material concerns me in this regard, but you get what you pay for.  I've used the tripod in light to moderate wind, and have gotten footage that was shaky.

for anyone who is looking for a product to last, this is not it.  one of the locking clamps broke the first time we used it.  My husband took it apart to fix it at a volleyball tournament and all of the internal parts of the locking system on the arm are cheap plastic and rely on bent metal to hold in place.  i would not recommend this product to anyone who actually want to use a tripod for any purpose, especially not for filming sports events.  Totally disappointing.  I guess it's true, you get what you pay for.  It is in this case.

I was looking for a tripod for my Nikon D3200.  I wanted something that would be good for landscapes and the occasional portrait.  I wanted something easily portable, so lightweight was key.  My fear was that my camera along with the lens weight might impact functionality of an inexpensive tripod, but I decided to try this one.It comes with a carrying bag, and is pretty compact.  The legs pull out with minimal effort and lock in to place.  You do not have to pull them out all of the way to lock them, so you can adjust the height.  The legs feel like they're plastic and not very strong.  I wouldn't recommend using it around kids who would bump into it, or with a very heavy camera (obviously, if you're a professional, this isn't for you.)

I really do like this tripod, especially compared to my original one that I lost because it collapsed too small.  This one comes with a bag and has thicker legs to it which automatically make it better than my first one. There ARE some downfalls for anyone that is a first time user for a tripod.  There are a LOT of pieces that can be adjusted on this thing.  So, I had read about someone not being able to adjust the top piece and I was a little worried because I thought the same thing happened to me, but I had to adjust another piece to get it to hold.  Once I got it down, it was super easy.The other thing that is kind of different is that the piece that attaches to the camera needs to be removed in order to attach to the camera, then you can lock it into place.  VERY nice design but you have to be able to figure it out for it to be helpful.  There are no instructions in the bag... you only get the tripod and the bag.

First let me say that this is my first tripod so I don't really have anything to compare it to.  That being said I'm not sure how much weight you should put into my opinion.My opinion is based on the sturdiness and easy functionality of this product.  It looks like it would cost more and the bag is a plus.  It didn't come with instructions so that was a disappointment but, I was able to figure things out within 5-10 minutes.

This tripod is fine for the basics, but I'm not the biggest fan. I use it for my webcam when recording, and the webcam does not fit very will- it is a pain to put it on and off properly.The material of the tripod feels cheap and flimsy.

Gave it four stars because of how cheap it is vs how good it is. My major complaint with this tripod is the part that elevates the camera head when tightened still move left and right. If taking repeated shots of a stationary object, it will migrate one way then the next. No amount of tightening will correct this. I shoot mainly stationary objects and time lapse so I need something more stable than this but for the price is a great tripod. Will still use it for general photography when remaining competely still is less important.

Very nice lightweight Tripod.  It is quite strong and steady given it's light construction.  I am using it with a Panasonic DMC-FZ1000, which is relatively heavy, and it handles it with no problem.  I do use a remote shutter release when shooting at slower speeds because I can get camera movement when pressing the shutter release by hand.It is well made and has all the necessary features, including a quick release mount, for positioning a camera in any position.

I was looking for a basic, lightweight, stable, solid, inexpensive, won't-cry-if-I-lose/break-it tripod for still shots and non-critical video and this was just the ticket.  I tried one from Walmart, about the same price but it may as well have been made out of stiff rubber.  I invested in a midrange video tripod with a fluid head that does a beautiful job shooting video with truly beautiful pans and tilts, but it's large and heavy.  This little guy really fits the bill.I'm growing in my confidence in the AmazonBasics brand.  Most of the time what we need is reasonably priced meat and potatoes functionality and they're really doing well at that.  Thanks Amazon

i really like this tripod stand. It grows to be really tall, a lot taller than i expected. it has a lock on it so the camera will not fall off if it. it can move the camera three sixty which is really awesome. the stand itself is extremely sturdy!  when it is as tall as it can go and short theres no way it is falling unless you knock it over. it holds my Nikon d3200 perfectly. it is easy to put up and fold down. This came with a carrying case which is great when i am going outside somewhere to do a photo shoot. it is made out of good quality material. This has already weather the storm! so suggest it it was a great price and i purchased it at regular price off amazon.

I'm glad I get to write my 200th review on such a wonderful product!I purchased this tripod to support a Canon Digital Rebel XT with a lens as large as the 75-300mm canon telephoto to take night sky pictures. Where any slight movement would affect the quality of the image a sturdy tripod was a must. This tripod does a great job of holding the camera steady during long exposure times though if you are zoomed in close with a lense I would recommend letting it settle for a half second before hitting the shutter as it is subject to noticeable (when zoomed) vibrations right after you stop adjusting the camera.

When it wasn't broken, it was an ok tripod. This tripod is mainly for photography. If you want to film while using it, you can't do panning shots. They have to be static because the tripod head jitters when panning, no matter how loose the controls were. Other than that, it has all the things you'd expect. 3-pan head, two levels, etc.Why it broke is because the leg parts are made of cheap plastic. If you like run & gun photography like me, STAY AWAY from this product. This is a cheap, consumer tripod. It won't last 6 months with run & guning.
For the most part, I really like this tripod.It's very sturdy, easy to open up and close up for storage.

Other reviewers posted that it's so lightweight that it blows away, but I did not have that issue AT ALL. I used this tripod for a shoot on top of the Blue Ridge Parkway in icy temperatures with a very strong wind blowing, and it did not even budge a little bit. It's extremely portable, easy to assemble for quick shots, and significantly sturdier than I expected. If you are on the fence about buying it, just add it to your cart. You won't be disappointed.

I was totally expecting a cheap tripod, but this one here exceeded my expectations.  As a photographer you want a nice and sturdy tripod to hold your equipment.  I was pleasantly surprised at the weight of this tripod.  It feels like a quality product.  It's heavy and well built for a quality product.  The shoe is compatible with my other tripod of a different brand.  When you pick up the tripod with a DSLR camera, the camera does not make the tripod topheavy at all.  This thing is well built, and well balanced, and well worth the price I paid.  I would recommend, and would definitely buy this again should I ever need to.  My only complaint?  The carrying bag seems to be a bit thin for my liking.  But we'll see how it works out.

I had high hopes that this tripod would get me through my introductory photography class before I invested in something sturdier, but it didn't even last two months before one of the legs came off! I only used it a handful of times, mostly inside, so it's not like was trekking around in the outback or anything. Super big bummer, since I only have a month left of class, and I really needed it. I'm going to see what Amazon might do to exchange it?

I like this tripod a lot.It has every adjustment you could possibly want.  It has a detachable mount which is really helpful.  The legs fully extend with ease and the leveling bubbles work great to help keep the camera straight.  It has a hook as well so you can hang this tripod upside down.  This is truly lightweight which is nice but it also feels a bit overwhelmed when using a bigger camera so watch when using a longer lens.

I didn't want to spend a fortune on a 60" tripod, but wish I would have spent a little more.  If lightweight is more of a requirement than sturdiness, this is the product for you.  Very light, but I would not rate this a sturdy product.  This is a nice enough tripod for the money as long as you're on a flat surface with no requirement to use the swivel function.  I don't like leaving my cameras unattended on this tripod - not very sturdy and I feel like a small bump would cause this tripod to collapse.  Also the swivel joints do not work well - they are very rigid and not very fluid.
