Even after I lubricated these joints they still don't function as well as I'd like.If you're looking for a lightweight tripod to hold a point and shoot or DSLR steady with you standing behind it, guarding it, it's a good product.  If you're looking for a stable tripod to use with a video camera (to swivel) or a heavier DSLR on uneven surfaces, spend a little more.

So this is not a pro tripod. But you knew that already. That said, it's a good, full-featured tripod that will make 99% of users happy. If you want to mount a point-and-shoot or mirrorless camera, this is your go-to apparatus. It's simple, well-designed, and does exactly what you want it to do. If you want to mount anything heavier--say, an SLR with a largish lens or medium-format film camera, look to something more substantial and more costly. This tripod is fine for my mirrorless system and lighter SLR, but when I mounted my medium-format film camera to it, the limitations were quite obvious. It simply doesn't have the heft or tension required to keep a heavy camera stable for a long shoot. That said, you can certainly use it for heavier cameras, but don't leave it unattended; the weight of heavier cameras will cause the mount to tilt. All in all, a wonderful device for amateurs or as a back-up for pros. You certainly can't beat the price, and honestly, I'm impressed by its ergonomics and ease of use. (I also like that it comes with a case, which is no small thing.) Really, unless you're a pro with a heavy rig (five pounds plus) this things is a no-brainer.

Its easy to setup and put away, and hard to find a decent tripod for this price range, but its a little heavy, its a little bulky, and not all that sturdy. In the price point, its probably hard to beat, but its not an amazing tripod or anything.

I believe the construction is fairly weak because when I got it one leg was bent and another was broken. I un-bent the one leg and spent a hour fixing the other one. Only to fin out later that it was missing the attachment for the camera at the top. Also the carrying bag was missing. Maybe it was a shipping issue, or maybe Amazon. But something shouldn't fall apart like that.
Very good unit.This is used for almost all the videos I create because it has very good stability and can be used in a number of configurations..

I got this tripod thinking it was going to be basic like in the title, turns out it works perfectly. I use this all the time, I haven't had any issues with it, my camera  feels great on it. It definitely has its versatile use, it has many knobs to switch to your liking. My favorite part about it is you can rotate the camera vertically with the small switch, it is super convenient. As well as the slider piece you don't have to keep unscrewing and screwing it back into the tripod which has to be my favorite part of the whole tripod. Overall, great price for the money. If you are the type to have more money, buy a different one since this one is on the cheaper side. Happy Spending!

This is awesome! I've owned 2 tripods before both were less than $20 on eBay. My last one broke so I thought I would just buy another. I had an amazing gift card so I decided to try amazon instead of eBay. This was about the same price as my last one and wow. The quality was a huge difference. I miss not profesional and just occasionally film videos so I didn't need an expensive profesional one but this one is SO nice. I just assumed it was going to be the same as the eBay one and this one is much sturdier and actually feels profesional. I absolutely love it. If it every breaks I would definitely re buy the same one.

Mounted a spotting scope, could not get scope pointed at what I wanted.  Tripod head is garbage. It sags after tightening so you have to aim higher than the desired point and hope it droops the necessary amount. Very frustrating.The keeper on the bottom segment of one of the legs pops out. I have to stuff it back in for that segment to lock in extension.

First of all, I bought the Velbon QB-4W quick release plate as a spare an it fit exactly - https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B000S5N3M4/ref=oh_aui_detailpage_o01_s01?ie=UTF8&psc=1  As for the tripod I gave it a test spin and it seemed to be fine - I am taking the pair of them to Churchill Northern Studies Centre this Feb/Mar as replacements for their tripods (old and broken) for photographing the northern lights. This will be the real acid test as temps reach -20 to -40F during those months. Will update this review on how they stood up - although most of you won't be using in such harsh conditions.

This is the cheapest tripod you can imagine: it's made of extremely junky plastic of the caliber that toys are made with.There are no ball bearings and so panning with this tripod while shooting video is not advisable; it will not be smooth.  You're better off to use something else if you expect to be able to pan while shooting.  This may be the worst item I've purchased on Amazon.  If you just want something to hold your camera up and you don't expect to move it once it's in-place, then this may work for you.

Don't let the price fool you. This tripod is absolutely first rate. I use it to make my own training videos for my job and I couldn't be more pleased! It extends to heights so that I can even shoot downward angles of what I'm doing. No need to be in the shot anymore, I can just show my hands. Love it!

I took a chance on this based on the price and the pages upon pages of glowing reviews.  This is a sturdy tripod considering its $18 price. I got it for my Ipad pro 10.5. The gray legs match the space gray color of my Ipad. It works cool for photos. The only gripe I've got is its not any good for fluid videography. The panning from left to right, side to side isn't smooth. It chops/jerks too much no matter what lubricant I put on or how slack the knob tension is I think its because these are plastic pieces linked together as opposed to metal of the heavy weight tripods. At the end of the day you get what you pay for.

I love this thing!!!!!! It attaches to my camera easily and it’s awesome being able to get the picture I need now that my young hands are shaking easily now.I love that you can adjust the legs on the tripod to get the level ground you need In case the surface is uneven. There are little bubbles to indicate flat surface. I have fun using this.
This product broke after a few indoor recording uses.  We only hooked up smart phones.  You cannot pan or tilt without heavy vibration that distorts the video.

It's a really basic tripod for a beginner in photography, not much else to say. So far it shifts pretty easy, and will swivel quite nicely, however none of the knobs really lock into place, and can be move with some force. The levels for the mount and the legs are a surprising addition but definitely help with set-up. The 6 ft maximum height was shocking but will never likely be used due to stability concerns. Overall if you are just starting out and don't know if you intend to make photography a hobby, or you just want something to hold your smart phone steady, this'll do. But if you actually intend on getting a DSLR and multiple lenses that will end up weighing around 15+ pounds then get a higher quality tripod. I've only used this for a few days and already I'm having trouble keeping my Pentax K50 truly stable.

This tripod is easy to use, lightweight, and sturdy. I like it! I will be buying another one next month for my backup camera! I don't have anything bad to say about it. I mean, for the price and all, this thing is great!Attention reader: this is all filler now. The review is over, and I felt this was necessary, simply to add weight to my review. Regardless, it IS an excellent tripod.

I didn't expect much due to the price. I'm impressed but it's still probably not near as good of quality as the $200+ tripods. It'll do the job for now though. It's a great starter tripod for sure.Pros:

It's handy that the plate for the camera slides out. It's much easier to attach the cemera to the plate and slide it back on.  Lots of adjustability. Leg adjusters are easy to use. The camera base has a bubble level.  The tripod is light weight and has an easy carry handle for when it is folded.  The bag included is nice but I'm not sure how long it would last with lots of use. Overall I am very satisfied with this tripod.

While not a bad tripod, this is still a cheap tripod. You get what you pay for. Please don't misconstrue this review - if you are planning to use this to set up in your backyard for family pictures and a small camera, then by all means, go for it. But if you're taking it on any sort of trip or have a DSLR I would highly recommend making the jump and buying a more expensive tripod, as that will offer you a much better experience and more safety for your equipment.

I ordered this tripod to use with camcorders when I record video of live music concerts.  The tripod arrived broken but I did not notice it until I used it the first time.  One of the legs kept slipping back up because the quick release did not securely hold the leg at the length it was set to.  By the time I used it, I realized it was broken and went to return it (I have never returned anything back to Amazon before) and Amazon says that I missed the return window by 4 days.  Return window is too short.
If you try to move your camera around it is jerky and makes noise which your mic pics up.If you want something that will hold your camera in one spot, this thing is great.
Who would have thought $20 bought such an amazing tripod?!Bubble level.

*Warning*  Do not mount any medium or large format camera to this tripod. Most of the attachment pieces are flimsy plastic, and the screws are made of cheap metal.My son ruined a very expensive Intrepid 4x5 camera when the thumb screw holding the head tilt attachment completely sheared off, and the camera crashed to the ground. This was not a very heavy camera at all (made of wood, with paper bellows), so I would be very worried that any larger camera is greatly at risk.
I love this tripod. I cannot say enough good things about it.Pros:

Worked great the first two or three times I used it, but I just pulled it out again to take photos of artwork and the joint that connects the camera platform to the body of the tripod is so loose that it’s useless. I have to be constantly holding the camera or else it flops straight down so it’s looking at the floor. The knob is as tight as it will go and has no effect, I think some plastic component must be stripped. Not worth wasting money on since you’ll need to buy something sturdier after a month or two!

This is a great tripod and it's most definitely better than having nothing. I quickly got into photography and learned a lot and eventually I came across one problem - it's not very stable when nearing its maximum height.I'm about six feet tall, and in order for me to comfortably look through the tripod without uncomfortably hunching over, I need to extend all three legs and crank up a straight pole that brings the camera nearly to my face. If I don't crank up the pole, the tripod is much more stable but it goes up to my chest. When I do crank up the pole, it feels a little less stable than I wish it was. I'm no professional, and I repeat - I am no pro so please spare me my ignorance - but I found myself struggling a bit to take some images. I had to learn the hard way to use the two second timer prevent the camera from moving when I let go / press the shutter button.

I believe this is an excellent tripod for a beginner photographer such as myself. I was a little skeptical after some reviews stated that it seems flimsy and perhaps in terms of high end tripod standards it may be. However for my uses it has been a great, lightweight and sturdy tripod.In the past couple months I have used it for long exposures and star trails up in the mountains, and in the streets from moderately windy (with weights) to calm conditions. I have used it for some slight macro photography, portraits and taken it hiking twice. I am very happy with the results. All the screws and legs used to hold the tripod and camera steady, lock up and loosen up consistently and well.

So, this is a good value for what you get; however, I when you tighten the large knob to the left, it not only prevents you from moving up and down, but also left and right.  I find this to be a huge design flaw.  When I am recording lectures I need to be able to move back and forth constantly, but if it is not tightened to move up and down, when I let go of the thing, it will fall forwards or backwards.  Maybe I'm missing something, and would be very interested to know if I'm doing something wrong (I hope I am wrong, but have tried everything to think of!)PROS: it is lightweight and otherwise easy to use.  And it is not expensive.

Am using for a video slider set up and needed tripods to be heavy and stable. These fit the bill perfectly.As tripods they are pretty good and pretty basic which isn't a bad thing as they do have what you need in a tripod; smooth head, plate lock and safety release, easily adjustable and stable legs.. The only draw back is the non standard slider plate but 2 are included.

I got tired of having to sit my camera on boxes or tables at family reunion, holidays, or even taking photos with my family at home. I wanted an affordable tripod for indoor use. This serves the purpose but it's very basic. I wouldn't trust my camera on this stand outdoor. Also, where the camera attaches it takes quite a bit of time to get it leveled. But again, for the price this is a reasonable stand for light indoor use.

I really like it. I think it's perfect for indoor filming. You can do outdoor too, but I wouldn't recommend it if it's a windy day or you don't have anything to weigh it down. Other than that is perfect for what I'm using it for and worth the money. Definitely great for beginners as well.

I used the four tripods I purchased for as static location ambient air sample stations. Each tripod was set up in the area of concern, generally in the middle of a room, upon which I placed a low volume sample pump. The tripod handle was extended vertically to hold each of the respected samplers, which in this case was used to evaluate occupant exposure to PAHs (known carcinogens). Each sample in each location ran for eight hours, and the tripod needed to be necessarily stable for the duration of the sample period, and be lightweight to change location, as and when required.

For those of us who actually purchased this item, I can't imagine anyone expecting more for the money. I'm not big into photography, if I was then I'm sure I would want something of higher quality. As it is, I simply wanted something to hold the camera steady for me because my disability prevents me from being able to hold steady myself. Actually, I thought that for a little over twenty dollars this tripod was pretty outstanding, some people seem to have unreasonably high expectations though. I see all the features you would expect from any tripod in an INEXPENSIVE - NOT CHEAP form, I was kind of expecting it to be a little lighter after reading some of these but, it has a nice heft to it, not heavy but, it certainly doesn't feel lightweight and flimsy. I tried running through all of the features/adjustments and I thought everything operated smoothly and as you would expect, if you're someone who is used to something better your opinion may differ but, that doesn't mean this isn't a good buy, quite the contrary actually. This tripod is perfect for my needs.

If you are looking for a tripod for stable snapshot pictures I suppose this will do. But if you’re looking for a more professional set up, and or you are shooting videos, run from this! Not very sturdy and the paneling sticks and is not smooth at all causing  if you are looking for a tripod for stable snapshot pictures I suppose this will do. But if you’re looking for a van and more professional set up, and or you are shooting videos, run from this! Not very sturdy and the paneling sticks and is not smooth at all causing video To come across choppy

I wasn't really expecting a great tripod for such a low price, but this is probably the most sturdy and sleek tripod I have ever seen. It has a convenient clip to screw the camera into that can be removed, that way it's easier to get the camera on and off. It has a handle, two bubble levels, a hook to hang stuff, and super nice grips on the bottom. This thing is really amazing, and I absolutely love it. I highly recommend it. Oh, it's also pretty tall. I'm 5'6", and with the camera on (Nikon D90) it was as tall as me. Totally worth it.

I've been using this as a back up travel tripod. It serves its purpose and has solid locking kegs and a telescoping base/ mount. But i have to say that it is flimsy, not in a its fragile kind if way but it feels cheap. You're definitely getting what you pay for here. Functionality, not heirloom quality or professional quality. The legs lock solid and the head swivels and tilts as it should and is light weight.

This is the best tripod I have used with my Canon T6 camera and it is by far the cheapest. This is made very well and it is lightweight enough to take with on hikes! I bring this everywhere with me and it is amazing! It even has a hook in the middle of it to weight it down if it is too windy. Very well thought out design!

I bought this thinking it would be light weight and durable.  NOT light weight, and not durable.  I haven't used it many times, but I'm sure the mount will break first, and probably soon.  Feels like if you make one wrong move it'll snap.  It's not heavy, but it weights just as much as my manfrotto fluid head tripod that is far sturdier.  Buy this only if you don't have money for a better tripod.

I really love this tripod. It's so easy to use and really versatile. It has features that I didn't even know I needed or wanted. Very easy to set up and put away. It does exactly as it says. Very sturdy. I would buy this many times over. The only reason I won't give it a full five stars is that I have a Sony NEX 5T camera and when mounting it on the mount the peg to screw it on doesn't rise out of the mount head enough for me  so my camera is a little wobbly and I'm afraid it may fall off if I were to rotate it to the floor or up at the ceiling for any reason. I'm sure there is a quick fix or even I could be putting it up there wrong but overall this tripod is a solid 4.9 for me.

I looked at other options for stands and am very happy with this choice. Fact is, I could have spent more. For what I need (n-studio, indoor usage, with little moving around), these are going to be perfect for me at a fraction of the cost of a more capable stand. If I were looking to do a lot of mobile shooting, then I'd probably look for a more rugged rig. The stands also include a small level, which I thought was a nice touch.

The handle for vertical panning immediately fell off along with the nut and bolt when I unpacked it. The hole cutouts for the square bolt were misaligned in the plastic, thus making the handle unable to screw in properly. Extremely disappointed with Amazon. Will not get “basic” products again.

I found the tripod of very good quality for the price with couple of extras. It comes with a handy soft carry case, a carry handle on the tripod, swiveling feet and a hook on the bottom of the center portion to hang weight from it to stabilize it.I bought the tripod to use with a shooting chronograph. It's perfect to use with the chronograph.

Okay, so I'm an idiot and thought my tripod was broken because I couldn't figure out how to tighten the top, so anytime I'd put a camera with ANY weight on it, the cam were immediately tip forward or back. So I got my replacement today and was fiddling with it and thought "damn this one is busted too! The reviews must've been true" but then I sat there fiddling with the nozzles thinking "why would they make a tripod that's literally great except for the most important part (where the cam goes) so I keep fiddling with the nozzles tightning and loosening still not fixing the problem,,, until I thought to tighten the actual handle and sure enough it was for the loose top! I feel like an idiot sitting here with two NOT BROKEN excellent tripods. To anyone else who experienced this issue and left a bad review just twist the handle lol...

I live in a mountain valley, am confined to a wheelchair and have a condition that makes my hands shake.  But I like to look at and photograph the beautiful mountain vistas all around me.  This tripod makes it possible for me to use my binoculars and my camera to make life a little nicer.  While I worry about how durable it would be for heavier use, it is perfect for me.

This is actually a pretty decent Tripod, especially at this price point, I was taking a gamble when I bought it and was pleasantly surprised. It has a solid build, though the plastic parts could be a little better, not that they are bad, but I do feel I got to be a little extra careful when clipping things down, thus one star off (it’s really not as bad as I’m making it out to be, being overly critical) overall I’m happy with this tripod, I’ve had it over a month now and no problems and I can see it lasting for awhile, I’ll update if anything happens to go wrong

Here is why I am giving it three stars. This tripod gets the job done, it will hold your camera still, tilts, moves, tightens (a little much - read further), changes height -- all of it. First off, I ordered this in conjunction with the Amazon Basics sling photography backpack, with a tripod holder - this (AMAZONBASICS) Tripod barely fits in the holder, and by barely fits I mean, I put the holding clip to the maximum while only one leg can fit in the tripod holder base. My next run in, I wanted to take some boardwalk photos and sunset photos at the beach. Mind you, not once did I leave the tripod sitting on the ground - the only parts touching the ground were the legs. Sand that was just blowing on a standard day I guess got caught in every single notch of the tripod, and now will barely tighten or loosen. When I packed up the tripod (tightened so that it wouldn't move around) I now need to carry a wrench with me to loosen and tighten. For the price you pay, it is questionable for the quality you get. I'm no pro-photographer, but come on you know this product isn't just going to be inside all the time. And Amazon should match it with their other similar products.

This lightweight tripod packs in the features at an affordable price point.  Despite it's light weight it is super sturdy and has enough heft in the legs to not feel flimsy or cheap.  My camera feels secure and the leveling bubble, rubber rotating feet and handle make it easy to adjust and find the most secure setup in all situations. I do youtube videos at home and on the road and take lots of stills and videos while camping.  I've also used it to mount an outdoor projector for movies while camping.  I'm going to order another one of these to keep in the camper because it works great for that and still keeps a small and light footprint for packing it up. This shipped fast and was to my door in 2 days. I'm very pleased with this tripod and think it's a great value.

This tripod is really reasonably priced and fits my application perfectly.  I'm happy that I didn't spend an arm and a leg for a tripod that could get lost, stolen or beaten up.  I'm using it in dirty environments.Pros:
I ordered this product for a introductory media class at college.Pros:

We used it about 3 times and then the sliding mechanism and the locks just got stuck on each other and broke. We got a friendly return of course because Amazon is awesome. However, I don't understand how this has such high ratings over so many people. Overall, I would not recommend, however, compared to other products of this same caliber that are like $10 more I'd say none of them would be better than the other.

I bought this tripod so I could use it with a portable projector that I just bought.  The tripod is really nice and works pretty well.  I was able to connect it to the projector and it is pretty stable.  I have been using it inside the house and in the backyard and it is pretty stable.  It is a pretty good tripod at a very reasonable price.  I would definitely recommend it.

When I received the product it was missing the top part where you secure your camera to it. Pretty useless without that. Also I noticed a corner of the plastic up top was broken or nicked somehow so it may have been used already. It was light as paper- can’t be very sturdy so I don’t know why all the great reviews other than price. Also I put it back in the bag to return it and it was super hard to get it into the bag so that’s frustrating. Thankful for being able to return.

I like this tripod.  It's very study and you can get it to a good height.  We have taken photos with our iPhones mounted on it (we purchased a separate cell phone tripod adaptor and bluetooth remote) and all of these pieces have helped us get better photos quicker than just positioning your phone on something and using the timer.  Also, I think it'll work well for video conferencing with friends and family, so you don't have to hold the phone the whole time.  It comes with a handy carrier, which is nice, as I didn't really realize how large this tripod was.

There are many reasons to get a tripod. I am a beginner photographer and wanted to have a tripod to use for a few different scenarios. The first is for those times when you want to make sure your camera is absolutely still. So if you are taking a picture outside in lower light and want to use a longer shutter speed or if you are indoors in a lower light situation. you can take more pictures without the flash, yet keep a very steady image. This is a good lightweight tripod for those instances. It comes with it's own bag, you can set it up in minutes and has levels built-in to the device to make sure you are setting up your shots perfectly.The other situation is if you want to use the timer or the remote to take self portraits. Much easier to get yourself in the picture with the right height and distance. Works in the house but is light enough that you can carry it with you hiking. While I have used it outside a few times since purchasing, you need to make sure the ground is fairly level. The feet just don't have a lot of grip on to use with much slope. If I was going to do a lot of outdoor photography, I would look at tripod with spikes in the feet.

Great quality for the price!This is a great beginner/ starter/ back up/ hiker tripod! Obviously the price is good, but in this case it does not mean it is a total piece of junk either; on the contrary. Of course there are many more expensive and more solid tripods out there but this one is pretty darn solid for what it is, especially for the price. So if you are not shooting in extreme conditions, this works great! It is also fairly light, and packs reasonably small, so this could be a good hiker edition as well.

I've never had a tripod so nice - and for the PRICE!!!  It's adjustable every single way, legs extend easily, things tighten easily, setup to the camera was easy, came with a NICE BAG, and there's not just one but TWO bubbles for level.  If I ever get one of those honking long lenses for my camera...this has something to hang weight from in the center of the tripod to keep it from tipping over.  All that with a handy grip to just grab this and move it or go.  It is PERFECT!  I am loving it!

Surprisingly nice for the money. I was a little apprehensive about buying this because I wanted to a tripod that was sturdy. It turns out this fit the bill. Does just what I need for the price. Work smoothly and stays where you set it.

I honestly had no great expectations about this product given the price and the last similar item i purchased and had to return. however upon opening the well packed package i was overwhelmingly surprised and pleased with this tripod. it was much more than i expected. the very base of each leg has a pivoting leg standoff to adapt to different terrain, there are 2 spirit levels one at the top of the tripod legs and one on the mounting assembly. the mounting bracket on the assembly is removable making attaching the tablet holder easy. there is also a crank on the top of the tripod which can lift or lower the entire mounting assembly. all adjusting assemblies are solid and easy to use. i am very happy with this inexpensive sturdy and well made tripod and strongly recomend anyone who is looking for a tripod to blindly make this purchase...you to will be in AW.

I bought this tri-pod in hopes to start using my Canon EOS Revel T6 camera more for family pictures and sporting events, etc. Work s great and I love that the tripod can expend to 5 feet. Only reason I gave it 3 stars is because it is still a little long when completely collapsed and mine came beat up as it is was used without care for a while then returned and I got the return, which of course I don't appreciate but it still serves its purpose.

I was wondering why my angle lever wasn’t working, pretty frustrating but an easy fix. I knocked over the tripod last night while I was figuring out how to use it and that square nut fell out. I put it aside not paying any attention to it. Luckily I found out what it was for. It’s a good tripod but it’s cheaply made. Parts fell off, and I had to fix it. It sucks but nothing that can be fixed

I was only searching for a quick release mount and a ball adapter for my Fuifilm camera when I landed on this and thought I'd just order because of the low price and prior good experience with amazon basics products. May I say it is an absolutely incredible value pro features in this super lightweight and great quality tripod. Sturdy legs independently extend to desire height, plus camera top pole rolls up for additional extension, each leg slides smoothly with great locking clamps,has 2 bubble levels, a super quick camera release mount, tilts left & right, tilts up and down with a nice turning stick lever, has a center lower hook for sandbag weight (sandbag not included) and a hand grip at the top fold for easy hauling, Oh and it all folds into a super perfect black carry bag with shoulder strap! My sister is a pro photographer and she has 3 tripods that costs hundreds each but they're all so heavy and complicated and flawed that she rarely even brings them along, say, to a hiking shoot. Thank you, amazon, for another awesome basics product!

New to this astronomy thing. This is my first tripod so I have nothing to compare it to; bought this tripod to hold my celestron 15x70 binoculars because of shakiness when being held and theyre heavy. This tripod is for up to 6 pounds, my binoculars are a little over 3 pounds so it works well. Easy to use. Easy to fold up with a convenient handle on the side.

I bought this bad boy on a budget and it does exactly what I need. There are two tension clips on each leg that allow you to easily set different heights. There is a crank that makes the mount part extend up even further for fine adjustment. It's pretty lightweight. I added on a super cheap holder for a smart phone and I’ve got myself something magical. I'm sure there are better tripods out there, but for the cost this thing is perfection!

I think I was actually surprised that this tripod is as good as it is for the cost.  Many different height levels and adjustments as well as easy movement while taking videos.  Of course, I am not a professional, but did want it for some extended and numerous takes, it is quite nice.  Bag does help to store and carry.  Feet rotate just a bit to help with leveling.  I suspect that if I had ever owned some high-quality product, I might know of some missing features.  But, as it is seems a good bargain.

I bought 2 tripods because at the time, this one was not going to ship in time.  The other one I bought at the same price point was flimsy and too light so a small gust of wind knocked it and my mounted camera to the pavements.  ouch.  Amazon, however, crushed it (in a good way) with this tripod.  It is sturdy while still being light weight enough that it is not a burden to carry around all day (if you need to do that sort of thing), you can adjust the angles any way you need to, and it has a bubble level on it to help you out too.

I make YouTube videos a lot, so when my last tripod broke I needed something quick and that didn't cost a fortune. I am actually surprised by the build quality of this tripod. This tripod has a very durable build quality and even came with a carrying bag which was a nice surprise. I don't know how well it will do in a lot of outdoor situations and if your a photographer who needs something hefty for different weather situations, this might not be for you, but for your average person wanting to record a video or get a family photo with everyone in it, this is perfect.

It's a tripod. I bought it because it was cheap and I don't often need one. I use it specifically for my Self-Leveling Cross-Line Laser Level by Klein Tools (model 93LCLS). The level is a bit on the heavy side, so I'm extra careful not to bump the tripod while the tool is attached. For lighter items, like small cameras, phones, or webcams, this is perfect. For a construction site, look elsewhere if you want durability.
Poor quality. I was disappointed this product. Do not buy it.

This thing is great! I was a bit skeptical picking it as some reviews stated that it failed to hold the camera upright. Upon arrival, I almost believed those reviews— but they’re NOT true! Every part of the tripod is adjustable. To tighten the base, you have to twist the handle. At first, I was trying to twist the base itself (that only stiffens another part of the thing). This has been my first tripod purchase and so far I’m very happy.

I needed a tripod that would mount a camera near eye level for me (I'm 6'1") and this did just that. I was actually very pleasantly surprised at the quality of it. While not made of high-grade metals, it is very lightweight and sturdier than I expected. It has built-in levels and locks into place with ease. Adjusting is a bit clunky, so it takes a bit of playing around to get the position you want.

I am well beyond the days of hanging a seven pound camera on a tripod.  Most of my work is done either with my iPhone or a very small (by comparison) video camera.  This tripod is rugged enough for that service and does an amazing job.  I particularly like the lower weight of the unit compared to the tripod I had been using.  It is easy and quick to set up and stays where I put it unless I need it to move.

This is great if you are on a budget and/or beginner in the field. Every moving part is sturdy and it has a very basic level. My first one came with a broken foot and Amazon support was quick to have a replacement on the way. If they had put it in a thicker cardboard box maybe I wouldn't have had the issue of it being damaged but overall I am happy with this purchase.

Have had this tripod for a while now and it hasn't broken yet, so i guess it's pretty okay on durability despite feeling like the plastic pieces could break at any moment.  Attaching the camera is simple and easy.  It does have a bubble level on it which is handy.BUT... it doesn't rotate smoothly.  There's a small area of rotation (abt 5-10°) where it's pretty loose and rotates freely but then hits a tight spot and you have to really force it to rotate further, leaving you with a very jerky, hard to watch soccer game of your son.  Loosened every adjustable part on it and nothing helps.  Even lubed up every moving part on this thing but to no avail.  If you don't need to pan your camera left or right and can just leave it stationary, this would do fine.  However, would NOT recommend this for soccer games or basketball or anything that you would need to turn your camera for.

I have wanted a tripod for a while but the price has always been an issue for me, I only take pictures once in awhile but when I do I like to take nice pictures.  With that being said I could not see paying big bucks for something that I only use a few times a year.  While surfing Amazon I ran across the Amazon Basics brand and watched the YouTube video on a listing and after watching it I thought I would give their tripod a try.  This was certainly a good idea, from my research I found out the lighter weight tripods cost more and if the tripod was multi functional that would raise the price again. This tripod has a the ability to work with the leg extended or not and is made from aluminum so it is light weight.  All the extra features are easily usable and the included case keeps the unit all together and compact.  I have enjoyed using this tripod and would recommend this tripod to anyone.

If I could give this item SIX stars I would.  I first saw the item at an aquarium where the staff was using it.  I needed a tripod so I thought I'd give it a try.  For the price, its great.  Maybe not equal to a brand name $500 tripod, but still very good.  Best of all: I selected the option that had TWO tripods for an additional $1!  For about $25 two decent tripods is a great deal!!!!

Incredibly light weight and easy to carry.  The included carrying bag is a bonus!  The legs easily raise or lower simply by pulling open or pushing shut a locking lever.  The additional telescopic raising with the hand crack is perfect for fine tune height adjustments.  Bubble level makes it easy to get a perfect setup on stairs or new em ground!  Couldn’t be happier with this!  I purchased an adapter for my iPhone 8 Plus and have been able to shoot some great video with this!  Would definitely recommend!

I've owned many tripods for both cameras as well as telescopes. This tripod has everything but an electric control port which is only good for star gazing. It also has a leveler so your camera is in the correct position for ALL of your shots. Nothing to tighten by screwing only to become loose later on. All are snap clamps that hold their position tightly. My next door neighbor is a professor at a local college and has taught photography for the last 25 years. He saw it last night and told me it was a 5 star tripod. That made me very happy 😊.

Weight is great. Very cheep quality head. Very hard to adjust (pivot) camera. Feels as if its tightened even when its not, just waiting for it to break. Gets annoying when you have to move it only a small amount (say 5-10 degrees). Not sure even at that price is worth using more than a few times. Oh spring/clip that keeps release lever open until bottom of camera attachment is inserted, flew out after first use.

Out of the four tripods I ordered, three have "loose necks."  No matter how much you tighten it, it will not support the weight of a cell phone or DSLR camera.The one that works is solid & I love it.  But it's up to you if you want to leave things to chance.  My number one advice would definitely be to unpack it and try it out before you take it out to an event or a job

It's a nice looking tripod, The aluminum legs are very sturdy and well made. The plastic part at top where the camera mount goes is very cheap though. The adjustment screws to change the angles are metal and screw directly into the soft plastic, the threads get chewed up really fast. For the price it isn't horrible, but I wouldn't buy it again.

Relatively straight forward tripod. There are little plastic clips on the legs to log in adjustments and these are the weak point of the tripod. First round using it and the top clip broke off. At that point you cannot super glue or gorilla glue it back on. Went ahead and returned. The cheaper tripods due tend to have these plastic clips on the legs when you look around.

I have owned it for less than 4 months and it’s broken.I didn’t actually see how it broke and I have youngins but it doesn’t feel sturdy so I imagine it didn’t take much for one of them to break it while exploring how it opens and closes.

Replaces old SLIK tripod of 35 yrs.  Will see is this comes even close.  For the price point, after several months of steady use, seems to be holding up well enough.  Some of the adjustments seem a little clumsy but that may be due to lack of familiarity and work patterns compared to old tripod.

Phenomenal tripod!  I've never used a tripod before but needed one to use my iPad for video.  Even without instructions, the design was intuitive; absolutely one of the best engineered products I've ever bought.  Stable, easy to manipulate, solid construction.  I was able to easily attach the iPad holder I also bought from Amazon.  This tripod also folds up securely to fit in the provided bag, although you really don't need the bag since there is an ingenious built in handle.  I can't see anyway this product could be improved.  At this price, this is one of the best purchases I've ever made.  I guess professional or highly skilled amateur photographers may want some additional doodads on their tripod but the swivel head works just fine, the universal screw for attaching things like iPads is solid.  I love this product!  Thank you to whoever designed something this fine that could also be produced at such a reasonable price.

This tripod offers alot of features usually found on more expensive models. The only issues I've noticed is the panning isn't smooth even when 100% loose and I had the last lock on one of my legs malfunction.The first issue can likely be solved with lube or grease.

If this is what you need to just capture a quick shot or travel, it's great. The height is minimal, doesn't compare to my more heavy duty tripods but definitely has good construction and will do the job for most. Holds my DSLR with stability, when I add a external shoe horn flash I fear it is too top heavy. Been using about 4 months shows no wear. Comes with good carrying bag.

Given its really cheap price, this product has durability concerns. It served its purpose for the first few months of use. But once, I took it for a trip to AZ and packed it in my bag. And when I took it out from its case to click a landscape picture of the canyon, I found that the handle used for controlling the angle of the camera had come off the tripod along with a nut. Given the relative complexity to fix it, I missed the opportunity to capture the sunset and I was there at the canyon for only a day. Later when I tried to put the nut back in to its place (at the very deep end of the plastic casing), the curved plastic broke off as I was stretching it to make enough space to push the nut.I am very disappointed with the quality of the product.

What a great tripod, for a super reasonable price. It's very sturdy and holds my Nikon D800 firmly in place. It's also tall enough to be close to eye level for me (I'm 5'3"), while I've seen much shorter tripods go for a similar price. It's also lightweight enough to comfortably take on the go and comes with a well made canvas carrying bag w/shoulder strap. I'm very happy with my purchase and would recommend it to others.

From the reviews I read, I felt this was the tripod for me.  I am an occasional photographer and I don't have a lot of equipment to weight a tripod down.  I don't need a tripod to travel well and sustain lots of moving and/or loads.I like how lightweight this is.  The legs collapse and lock easily.  The camera screws down onto the platform easily and securely.  The levels are reliable.

I wanted a basic tripod for use on a trip to the Southwest where I took a photography course.  It had to be lightweight and durable and provide good support in some rugged locations.  I used it with a fairly hefty Canon DSLR.  I was very pleased with this Amazon product.  It is lighter in weight than a carbon fiber tripod that my friend has that cost 5 times more.  It has two spirit levels that are handy for leveling the camera.  The feet are good for outdoor or indoor use.  The quick release is convenient, secure  and easy to use, again much better than the much higher priced unit.  If you want, you can carry the camera around atop the tripod.  The legs are easy to extend and adjust with individual levers rather than the twist locks found on other  tripods.  Perhaps the only defect I can find in the tripod is that the legs do not open as wide as some other tripods which means that it may be a little less stable in a strong wind.  However, it has a sliding brace that opens with the tripod and helps to stabilize it.  The brace has a hook that can be used to hang a weight such as a camera bag which further stabilizes the tripod.  It is remarkable how much value has been packed into this device.  The bag is handy and durable.  I recommend this tripod  highly.

For the price, its not a bad tripod, but keep you expectations in check. Overall the build quality is just so-so. It is well featured, but feels a little cheap all around. The pivots used to pan and angle the camera feel a bit stiff even with the locks threaded all the way out (maybe they will loosen with time). I also had to trim some excess plastic off of the bushing that the center telescoping shaft rides on as a piece of it would scratch up against the teeth making a real annoying noise when raising or lowering the boom. Minor sure, but gives you an idea of the fit finish and QC on the product.For the $20 price I paid though, not all that bad for my intended use (holding a gopro up in the garage for some video capture). If I were to be looking to use it even more than just semi-professionally or in a less controlled environment than my garage, I'd probably keep looking...

I purchased this for hunting - not only as a rifle rest but also for glassing with my binoculars.  (Yes, I know they make tripods designed specifically for hunting, but they are much more expensive.)I've only taken it out with me once, but for the price, this tripod seems pretty sturdy and everything functions as you would expect it to.

This is perfect for beginners or people that just need one for point and shoot stuff. It would also be really good for vlogging. It's not SUPER sturdy so I sometimes worry about my DSLR on it, especially with larger lenses on it - this results in me often just taking low shots with it and sitting on the ground because it's sturdier when it's shorter. I plan on getting a nicer one as my skill and interest increases but this has been perfect for learning and doing very basic photography. The price is great for leaners! This is not great for long exposures. If you plan on filming something where you need to pan, it doesn't do that well. You can't precisely pan it very well, so be aware of that. You also can't precisely line it up to things, it doesn't move very smoothly. This is definitely a basic, as it says in the title.

This tripod fails at the primary level of keeping the camera platform steady. Every contact point has movement and flexes at modest pressure. The head and plate area is the worst (see video clip). On the plus side it is very light. Minus: completely unusable as a tripod.

Excellent weight for packing around while hunting. Was able to place my Bino adapter right on to the base plate, and hold both my Nikon and Bushnell binos with no problems at all. Also no issues holding my Bushnell spotting scope. Easy to adjust legs to height needed, weather it be sitting down or standing up. It is sturdier than I thought it would be. It was pretty quite when setting up and taking down. Sure I'd recommend this tripod to other hunters! All and all a good little product here. Believe it will stand up for a few years to come.  Again great weight for packing around when ya are already hauling some 65 to 70 lbs., of gear with ya.

This tripod is amazing. I've had it for many many months (forgot to do a review). But it has many different levels! From low placement near the ground, to nearly head level. Once you extend the legs fully out, it has a twisty lever you twist where the camera goes, and it almost reaches my height! Im 5'8 by the way. So its definitely 60 inches/5ft. It's very durable and looks professional as well. I'd recommend a hundred times! :)

This is an excellent tripod! There are a lot of features on this that I wasn't even expecting but I absolutely appreciate. It has a handle so that if you want to move the tripod with your whatever attached to it, It makes it so much simpler to make a move and you feel more secure to move your camera, Camcorder, telescope,…, whatever.  It has a crank to raise and lower the center pole/head up-and-down  which is much more convenient than the free flow with a knob to tighten, especially if you only need to  make a minimal move.  It also has a lock on the riser pole and the brace for the legs to keep them in place and makes it much sturdier. It also has swivel feet that is great if you're not on an even surface.  I bought this to replace the flimsy tripod that came with my Celestetron 70 travel scope and i'm glad I did.

This is a great little lightweight tripod. I have used it several times and seems to be quite sturdy. The legs extend easily, and the two levels allow you to make sure you are not at an angle when taking the picture. Buyer should be aware this tripod is very light, as such it is not one that you can leave unattended where there may be a chance of someone knocking it over. The tripod does have a hook that you can hang something to weigh it down a bit, but for the shoots, I use this for it is unnecessary. So for the photographer that is on a budget, I highly recommend this tripod.

I made this purchase fairly quickly. Upon arrival I couldn’t figure out how to attach this to my phone. I was looking for other reviews similar to mine and couldn’t find too many because most people are using this tripod to mount digital cameras 📷. You must purchase an additional piece separately to be able to mount your phone. I have an iPhone 11+. It works.

I bought this tripod because I forgot my good tripod at home.  I didn't expect much for the price, but it worked fine for still photography. Don't buy it if you want to shot videos because the head does not move smoothly. Besides that, I was satisfied with my purchase.  It is lightweight and easy to operate.  I found that the mechanism that raises and lowers the main shaft didn't lock into place very well.  This tripod is definitely not for the hardcore photographer. If you plan on taking a lot of pictures and want something that lasts, invest in a much better tripod.

This is by far the best Tripod I've had... It is very stable. I am giving 3 stars ONLY because it came with the PLATE broken. I was in a hurry to use it, I didn't have time to replace, so I had to try fixing it myself with Super Glue... It worked, but I know it's temporary. Now I'm looking for a Replacement Plate, but I just Can't find it.

After 2 uses I am very happy with this tripod, the price is great and it seems very sturdy. The different locks are all secure and seem to be of a good quality, so far so good but I am very happy with my purchase. Very lightweight and compact. The only thing I would have loved is if the carrying case had 1 or 2 pockets but other wise it is a nice quality case with the standard adjustable strap.

We wanted to take Christmas photos for holiday cards to send to friends and family. This gave us the ability to get a great shot, and leave behind our days of balancing our phone atop a tower of storage crates. It was inexpensive, sturdy, came with a travel case. It is the kind of purchase that makes us feel more like the adults we are supposed to be.

I've been using this tripod successfully for at-least 3 years. The very first thing I did was attach a 6lb sand weight to the middle by a tether that floats above the ground to lower the center of gravity. A heavier DSLR would easily get knocked over without adding the weight. I use the bubble levels and adjust the legs/height often. Great for the price.

The lightweight tripod is just the thing for my Canon DSLR which is not all that heavy. The tripod is very sturdy and has locks for virtually all of the degrees of freedom. This is an excellent feature, and it was missing from the tripod that this replaces. There are two spirit levels that are very useful for totally leveling the camera.If I were to complain, and it is really minor, it is that the rack and pinion assembly that cranks the camera up and down feels a little crude. It was much more refined in the tripod that this replaces. Again, this is a very minor complaint because the rest of the tripod has many refined features.

This item arrived broken.  The threads on the inside of the locking mechanism on the head are cracked.  So it isn't able to be locked down tight and doesn't hold the weight of the camera, rendering it totally ineffective.  Cheap plastic and not well made.  Don't waste your money; but if you do open it right away and check that it works.  Only 30 days to return.

We’ve struggled with diy family portraits for years now. Finally thought to check if Amazon Basics had a tripod and camera remote and wow, did they come through. The price is amazing and worth it, especially since we will probably use it twice a year... or maybe more! I’m so pleased with this find

I'm not sure it's fair to compare this amazing, feature-filled tripod with the super basic one I owned before. I love that it has a piece that attaches to the base of the camera that then allows you to easily slip the camera plus base assembling into the tripod stand.It has a handle along the side that makes it easy to pick up and carry.

It was the lowest price that still resembled quality. I am happy with the purchase. It came with a carrying bag. It’s my first so I may not know much about them but looks and feels great and extends very tall. If I could change a thing it would be to make the feet a bit heavier because my camera is kind of heavy. Compared to all the others I saw online I feel is a good deal.

I bought this to take pics with my iphone. I had to purchase a spring loaded phone holder (no big deal) but there is NO screw in adapter for this as pictured!!While there is a slight misleading line that the adapter is not included, it should say “screw in adapter for phone holder not included”.

Works well as a budget tripod. Includes a hook to add a ballast weight (pouch of sand or rocks) to keep steady in windy conditions.  The handle is another nice touch, though not important if toted in the accompanying bag, which has a nice strap.  OK for stationary video shots, but the pan and tilt are not "liquid" for smooth tracking.  This unit is lighter than many 60-inch tripods, but not something you'd want to carry on extended treks.  If you want something that will fit in a backpack, look for something smaller.

Happy with this product! I ended up gifting one and keeping the other. I've had it for about a year now and it's holding up nicely. I have to say I haven't used it a TON, but I've used it enough to know if it's a piece of junk. It's a great deal for what it is and I'd recommend buying it.

This is everything I needed it to be and more. I had never used a tripod before but it was definitely easy enough to figure out how to use it. Enough mechanisms on it to be able to get your camera in any position you want it to be in. Love the easy release piece really makes life easy for some things great value for price. Easy to store take out and put away and definitely light enough to whip around

This is a great value in a tripod purchase. It is very light weight, sturdy enough for my needs, and i can see using this for a very long time.  I primarily use this for a small video camera and a DSLR.  This is used for my childrens sporting events, and does the job fantastically.  I know it seems wierd using a tripod for sports, however, they run track, so the tripod really does come in handy to hold the camera steady as they go around the track, or to keep a wide shot set, while i use a different camera for still shots.

For the money, this is a spectacular product. Not the heaviest or sturdiest piece of equipment ever built, but really solid. I have an old tripod from the 1970s that I have been using forever that my kids broke after knocking over a bunch of times. I bought this is a replacement and it’s very good but it is not the tripod I had from years past. I love all the adjustments and the light weightedness of it, but it is not the greatest thing ever. Really, really, really good though.

Nothing monumentally life changing. Is definitely made of cheap materials and isnt super solid feeling, but I only needed something to stick a camera on for interview type purposes. Simply needed a basic stand, so for my purposes it works great. It hasnt broke on me yet, but i rarely use it or travel with it, I mainly leave it set up all the time. Its light weight and does what i need it to. Great starter tripod for anyone looking. Does the trick.

You couldn't ask for a better tripod at this price.  This adjusts in all directions, has levels on the base plate (two), weighs next to nothing, and comes with a carrying case you can easily sling over your shoulder.Has multiple adjustments for height, direction.  Very sturdy despite its light weight.  Has a hand grip for easy movement.  Camera plate easy screws into bottom of camera and locks in securely.

Ok.  This tripod has many features found on high end tripods.  Having said that, this is a very inexpensive product and the features are not as robust as on high end products.  Having said that they are acceptable for home use.  The tilt features and the camera lock are not as robust as I would like but for steady shots the stand is acceptable.

I bought this tripod initially for my second video camera (I do youtube videos) but it's quickly become the first one I reach for and honestly I'll be buying the other heights. I might be amazon "basics" but it's not cheap and flimsy, you get a lot for your money!Love:

I love it. Exactly how the seller described it. I would definitely buy more products from this seller. I am very pleased with my product. It has a nice grip to it. The handle really helps when you are trying to use it as a monopod so that's a plus. Another thing I liked about this product is how it spins in a circle so when I am filming, I could easily spin to get a spinning shot without any trouble. The spin is very steady. Another thing that I like about this is the long handle, it comes in handy for two things: one is obviously spinning and adjusting to the frame, second is it allows you to hold mic that is connected to your camera. I love how it came with a bag. Perfect for traveling!

The tripod head where you secure the camera is absolutely garbage. I have a lightweight Panasonic G85, and even with a TINY micro four thirds 25mm prime lens (thing weights like 1/10th of a pound...) the head would tilt forward on me. Absolutely shocking Amazon sells this under their brand name as Amazon Basics stuff is usually pretty solid..

I got a couple good night time photos out of this tripod. A moon photo is attached.However, my moon shots from one evening proved too much for this tripod. I was using a DSLR with a zoom. I ended up breaking the tripod's handle when I was screwing the handle to lock the camera position. The threads where the handle screws in got stripped. So the camera cannot be locked into a position now.

The tripod is a great price and fairly well made for light use. BUT, if you are using this on a daily basis, and/or in a rough environment, you will most likely get about 6 months to a year out of it. I'm a union carpenter and have seen these tripods all over jobsites. It is rare to find one that still has the little knob on the crank (pictured). Mine recently came off and I was able to reattach it with what I had available. Today, a rivet on one of the legs came off (also pictured) and I might just retire it for something more sturdy. Overall, good tripod and I'm disappointed it didn't hold up.

This product came in nicely packaged and in a nice nylon bag.  Quality is better than I though for the price point.  I am using them for video projector stands.  The only issue is the overall height is short,  but for what I was using them  for it is OK.  If you want a tripod to stand up to when taking pics, this is not the right model.
The AmazonBasics 60-Inch Lightweight Tripod with Bag Sold by Amazon.com Services LLC function and operate as advertised and received the product at a very, very reasonable price.

I was excited about this tripod at first... but then it started disappointing after a couple of hours of use. For the price, I don't know, I feel that it's worth spending a bit more money to get a better one. I do like the height adjustment on it and how sturdy the legs are, plus it's lightweight. However, the pitch adjustment lever fell put of its socket after about an hour of having it and the piece was gooey, wet, gross glue or something as if they just glued it together. I was able to screw it back in but it wasn't great to have to do that.

These are budget tripods.  You definitely get what you pay for, if you buy these.The tripods do have a level to help make your camera is is a good position, which is nice for still photos, or stationary point of focus, while filming.  The legs adjust easy enough, as well.

This tripod is just about all an amateur photographer needs besides a camera and good lighting. I've owned this tripod for over two years now and it's still going strong. I've taken it on six vacations, including 2 out of country, where the tripod was packed in my suitcase and checked on the plane. Not one part has broken. It's light-weight and works great. The product literature says it is 60 inches high, but I measured it at 62 inches when fully opened from floor to head plate where the camera rests. The legs telescope in and out of each other smoothly and easily. This tripod has two bubble levels on it. One is on the shoulder of one of the legs, and the other is on the head of the tripod. I think this tripod was engineered really well. Watch my review of this tripod on Youtube by PsychOtto.

Although it feels cheaply made - I still have found enjoyment of it. It's not often I get to be in pictures with my friends during group shots, because I am usually behind the camera... but now I can be! I have the Sony a6000 which allows you to connect to your phone so you can see what the camera sees and then like a remote you can take the picture. Its lightweight which makes it easy to carry around! Worth the buy! I have only had it for a week or so. I will update in several months when I have used it more often.

I've given this tripod 4 stars based on what I bought it for: A light travel tripod.  Some of the nice features are a quick release camera mount, quick release leg clamps, two bubble levels and a hook at the base of the center column to hang something heavy to add some stability to the tripod.  I've tried this out at full leg extension with a Nikon D7000 with a 18-105 lens and about 3 lbs of extra hanging from the center hook while I took three bracketed shots which I later merged them together.  It tips the scale at mere 2.7 lbs compared to the 12 lbs of my Bogen 3040 tripod.  The Bogen can easily handle a heavy camera with a heavy telephoto in gusty winds (which I wouldn't try with AmazonBasics) but it will break your back lugging it around while hiking.  One small problem I've had is a grommet at the base of central column like to pop off when pull out the legs.

Ok folks so I’m no pro but I totally look like one now!! This is the real deal it adjusts in every possible direction and is incredibly easy to use! Amazingly durable and is also totally not intimidating. I was worried when I ordered it that I may have trouble using it.. boy was I wrong! It is so straightforward that you don’t have to be a pro but will totally look like one with out the high price!! I use it for my YouTube channel “Johny’s Tiny Creekside Cottage” and it makes things so easy. And it has a grab handle...

For the price, this is a really good tripod that can handle all the basic uses. It balances well and I really like how high it can go. The height allowance is good. In my opinion, this tripod provides the best usage as a camera stand. It can panel from left to right or vice versa, but this function is not the smoothest. This is especially apparent if you are going from side to side at a slow rate. Other than that, everything else about this tripod stand is quite outstanding.

Overall this seems like a good tripod for the price. I am using it to hold a spotting scope, which isn’t too heavy. It’s a little wobbly, but it is as good as I expected, and I haven’t tried hanging any weight from the hook underneath. My one complaint so far is the panning is sticky, even with the screw loosened all the way. There is just too much friction in the plastic parts that allow it to move side to side, so it is hard to move smoothly when looking through the scope.

Bought this to use with a Huepar laser level, also purchased on Amazon. I absolutely love it. For the price it can't be beat. You can adjust so many different things and the height is good also. Really lightweight and I love that it came with a carrying bag [although the bag is pretty crappy]Overall I would highly recommend this for anyone looking for a lightweight tripod.

Good tripod for amateurs that use occasionally. All the locks, and adjustments work well for now, but time will tell. This replaces a worn out tripod I've had for 15 years, so right now it's great. A lot of plastic pieces to hold up to use. I would recommend this product, based on price.

This is a perfect entry level tripod. I have owned a number of different tripods over the years and this one would be placed at the top of the list for it's price to feature ratio. For me, height was a big factor. I am 6' 3" tall and I prefer a tripod that doesn't make me bend over too far because I have a bad back. This tripod allows me to take the shots I want to take without the need to bend down far. In addition, there are two different levels built in to the unit...one for the legs and another for the pan head...making it very easy to get a level shot. It's fairly easy to lock in to the perfect position, though it does take a bit of effort if you want it to be precise...especially when using a telescope lens. I bought this to take some photos of the "super moon" on Sunday and after testing it out on tonight's moon, I am very pleased with my purchase. The carrying bag is also a great bonus! I would recommend this tripod to anyone who is just starting out in photography/videography or for those who just want a nice hobby tripod. No, it's not a high-end, fluid movement tripod like you find in cinematography, but then again, it also doesn't cost hundreds or even thousands! I attached a photo of the moon I took using this tripod. As you can see, it holds it nice and steady when you need to leave the shutter open a little longer. This was taken with a speed of 1/800 and an ISO of 100 using a 2-second timer.

I’ve owned this tripod less than two years, and have used it maybe 10 times (for self-timer family photos). It was always stored in its bag immediately after—no rough use. Well, one of the clips on a leg broke off, so that leg is now useless... aka this tripod is now useless. Normally the quality of Amazon brand products is great, but this one was literally a bust.
Fell apart the second time I used it. Unfortunately didn't use it in time to return it. Total junk I guess you get what you pay for.

My niece is now a photo bug and she is interested in photography but until when?  So she wanted a tripod and this fits the bill right now and functions amazingly well.  Light weight, easy to set up and break down.  I took my camera a Canon EOS Rebel T6s and placed it on the tripod for fit, function and stability and it was an amazingly good tripod.  Much better than my portable tripod so I may get one myself.  This is NOT a professional tripod, it is light weight but it’s good for a hobbyist.
I'm really happy with it.It's well built and incredibly light.  The bag is cheap but I don't see this breaking if I take care of it.

You get what you pay for with this Amazon Basic Tripod. I am a podcaster who uses this primarily for filming interviews with my iPhone for my social media channels and for some basic photography. I've had the tripod for less than three months and it's basically useless. The pieces are extremely cheap, and many of the plastic pieces have snapped off with basic wear and tear.  You can shell out more for a heavy duty Magnus, which I love, but I hoped this would be enough for my purposes. I guess I was wrong!

I originally got this as a stand for my chronograph, also started using it with my DSLR for low light photography and long-distance shots. This thing is a fantastic value for money, its adjustable in just about every way you'd want a tripod to be and its super light. It also has nice features like spirit levels in multiple axes and a quick-detach mounting plate. I did take a star off for durability because it seems to be made out of a thin aluminum material - I don't think you'd want to subject it to rough treatment much or at all - but its plenty sturdy for normal use.

maybe it's not the highest quality tripod in the world (i wouldn't really know because it's my first) but, for the price, it was exactly what i needed and it arrived quickly.  this thing is very tweakable and adjustable.  even the rubber feet on the bottom of the pods swivel around 90 degrees so it sits flat and steady on any surface.  it's not rock solid so you better have good image stabilization on your camera if you plan on shooting during an earthquake or something, but all i'm using it for is making youtube videos.  for the money this thing is unbelievable

First of all, let me say that if you're looking for a $500 Pro Quality Tripod, this isn't it... BUT you wouldn't expect it to be for around $25.  That being said, the Amazon Basics 60-Inch Lightweight Tripod is one of the best "value for cost" tripods I have found.  I haven't had it long enough to really put it through it's paces yet but at first use it's a feature rich, competent tripod for the money.  Sometimes you have to backpack into places that you don't want (or dare) take a tripod that costs hundreds, but still you need something solid and usable.  This is it.  If you are an amateur photog just getting started out, this is absolutely perfect for a first tripod.  I'll maybe update this review after I've used it more but for now I like it a lot for the price paid.
I spent two chepo phone tripod and end up buying this.This item is awesome! Built with quality.  I wish I had settle this on first buy.

For under $25 this is a great buy. Holds our Canon Rebel T1I with telephoto lens effortlessly. While the head,etc are made from some type of plastic we really like the aluminum legs. The carry bag is actually nice. The leveling bubbles are also a nice addition. It is not a heavy duty professional tripod. But we are not professional photographers and have less than $200 invested in our camera, lenses, bag and equipment.

I was initially very pleased with this tripod, and impressed by the extra thought that went into the design as far as features go, but one of the plastic locking pieces within one of the legs broke after about 5-6 months, and now it’s mostly useless as a tripod with height (why I bought it in the first place) with only two extendable legs. I missed the window for return (it just wasn’t a priority during the pandemic). I’d consider buying this again if I wasn’t worried that inner plastic piece might fail again. Other than that, it’s decent quality for the price, and easy to use. I especially like the height, leveling bubbles, and detachable mount, which made my tasks easier and more efficient. Just disappointed it broke. (Second photo shows the broken leg lock at the top and an undamaged leg lock on the bottom).

I was nervous buying the AmazonBasics brand because I was unsure what the quality of the product would be. I was surprised to find that it was better than expected. I bought it as a gift to my husband for our Nikon D70 Camera. I like how it has short legs that extend to around 5 feet high. It also comes in a nice, black carry case. The camera easily screws onto the clip that attaches to the tripod.We love taking group family photos at special gatherings (christmas, birthdays). It's so nice not having to build a makeshift tripod with tables and chairs or, even worse, having someone take the picture and get left out! Another use for this camera is that we are expecting a baby soon. Now we have a way to capture pictures of all 3 of us!

For a budget-priced tripod, this thing is really made well. It's sturdy and adjust easily. The pan function (rotating from side to side) could be a little smoother, but at this price point I don't think you'll find one that works better. It's sturdy enough to trust with my expensive Nikon but light enough to pack around pretty easily.

The more Amazon Basics products I purchase, the more of a fan I become, and this tripod is no exception.The legs extend twice with easy to use clips to hold them solidly in place at any point you can extend it to.

I use this mostly for filming hunts on the ground.  I love the adjustability of it.  The head on it is not good though.  The plate that attaches to the camera doesn't lock down tight.  I had to stuff grass in the gaps to secure it.  The head is also very basic.  I suppose it would be fine for a camera taking pictures, but motion is jumpy.  I would have liked it a lot more if the head was removeable so i could have put my own on.  I made it work, but it wasn't as good as I hoped.  There are just a couple simple changes that need to be made to make it great.

I'm just getting into the hobby of photography and I quickly realized I need a tripod. I shopped around and found this to be a good option for the price range I'm looking for. I've never used a tripod before and this didn't come with any instructions. However, it's really easy to use and easy to understand. I figured it out within minutes and have had no problem with it so far. It fits my Nikon D3300 perfectly and it works really well. It's a great deal for the price. It's stable, sturdy, and I love that it came with a carrying case. It's light and it has been able to go all the way up to 60 inches as advertised. I'm beginning to think Amazon is on to something again here. They're beginning to produce affordable quality products on their own, a total game changer.

For the price, this might be the best inexpensive tripod you can buy! Even when compared to some inexpensive tripods you can buy in retailers like Best Buy, the build quality of this tripod surpasses them by far.Most cheap tripods are entirely made of hardened plastic where as this one includes aluminum all over the place. The mount where your camera sits is very sturdy which is great but sometimes when panning left and right, it can get stuck even though the bolt is loosened.

I don't think I have ever written a review before. But, I feel compelled to do so with this product. I just opened the package, and I cannot believe the quality of this product. It is way beyond what I expected for $20. Now, I am not a professional photographer. So, I'm sure the snooty crowd would stick their noses up. But, I personally can't find a thing lacking for the hobbyist. I like to take bird and wildlife photos from my deck or even from my kitchen window. Because of my arthritis, I find it difficult to hold my Nikon L820 steady while zooming. So, this will help tremendously.We had a more heavy-duty tripod that my husband bought years ago when we got our first video camera (one of those bulky heavy ones who hold on your shoulder). It was cumbersome for me to move that thing around for the kind of shooting I do nowadays. But, this new one is lightweight, has a neat carrying handle, pivots easily in all directions, even has a built-in level. The carrying bag is good quality as well. I couldn't ask for a better bang for my buck.

Pretty good for the money. I bought this for my daughter to use and didn't want to spend a lot of money on something that might get just few uses and end up in the closet. For the money it is pretty good quality. If stretched to the max it does feel axbut flimsy,  but that is expected when you look at the thickness of the legs. It does handle a DSLR camera pretty good, also works well with a DJI Osmo 2. I would definitely recommend it for the occasional photographer.
BOTH tripods had sheared pads (1 for each tripod) at the bottom of the legs. Both items.AND one of the leg supports had been jolted/torn loose.

These tripods are awesome. They are light, well made, and inexpensive. I actually bought these to make 2 floor lamps, and they turned out great. They are sturdy and I can adjust the height! And with this 2-pack, they were only $20 each, which I think is a downright bargain! They came with 2 carrying bags that I'll never use, but I'm sure they would be handy for a photographer on the go. My only complaint is that the tripods were pretty hard to take apart. That's only a gripe from my perspective, though- it actually is a testament to how durable these will actually be out in the field!

OMG I love my tripod so much I can't stop using it!!! All the sudden I love taking pictures! I originally bought this to setup in my salon to take pictures of the services I provide but soon enough I used this for every occasion and place I visit. Literally, I just got this item this week and I've already taken over 100 amazing pictures!!! Love it so much and highly recommend it to everyone!

Purchased this tripod 3/23/2019.  Could not tighten the tilt function knob enough to hold the camera steady, even with a pair of pliers.  Head would not swivel at all.  I explained my problems to the Amazon Customer Service people via Chat.  They were more than helpful in resolving my problem by promptly providing me with a replacement.

This is lightweight, comes with a carry bag and worked well when I was shooting stars over the fourth of july weekend 2016. It comes with a variety of neat adjustments. There is even a hook to hang accessories in the underside middle of the tripod which can be used to hang accessories or a weighted bag to make this even more stable. I will add that I shot over 750 photos with this on the first time using this, with 30 second exposures. The wind was minimal, basically negating any potential issues with wind and slight movement of the tripod but I was prepared just in case.For the price, this is heck of a deal.

Finally i got a chance a review of the product  - the product is not good, something which dented my opinion around quality of amazon branded products.The screw/spring hook which ties the camera  together with the tripod  broke off within a month, preventing me the effective use of the product.

This is a very versatile tripod for simple photography needs. When it comes to tripods, especially for professional work, the heavier the tripod, the better. However, for simple stuff, like stuff I need, this fits the bill. It is very adjustable, and despite its light weight, it's pretty sturdy. The light weight is also nice for lugging around, but I don't need to do that too much. The carry handle seems a bit pointless since there's not enough room for me to get my fingers around it, but that's about my only nit.
