It also features the detachable mount which I actually don't like since it's easy to lose. Well, it's easy for me to lose. I much rather the mount just stay fixed to the tripod, because if you lose it, you're screwed. You can't use the tripod. Other than that, it's great and the price is definitely right.

i guess i was looking for the most basic tripod i can find but this is one of the best ive seen and you can compare to higher priced itemsso many more features than i expected i was getting i guess i didnt read the product description but it comes with quick release system and multi axis adjustability

Most people use a phone to take photos or videos.  Why would you leave out the most important aspect of a tripod,namely the smart phone attachment.  There were no instructions, nothing when the product arrived so I thought I got a defective piece.  Only after returning it and getting another identical one, did I read the fine print that said this attachment was not included.  Argh!!!!!! Infuriating.

Solid tripod for the money. Pretty sturdy, lightweight metal and plastic construction. Many features and adjustments including several levels to make sure the camera is level when shooting. Digital camera is held solid. The tripod came with a nice carrying case but no directions. Make sure you take off the black plastic mounting plate using the release lever and use the screw in the mounting plate to attach the plate to the camera. There underside of the mounting plate has a hook which you can twist to attach it to the camera with the mounting screw. I tried to attach the camera to the the plate while still attached to the tripod and the metal spring loaded stabiliation button popped out of the plate. I had to reinsert with pliers. Took a few minutes to get back in. Once I removed the mounting plate from the tripod attaching it to the digital camera was simple. Then you simply reinsert the plate back onto the tripod and secure with the lever. As you probably guessed I never used a real tripod before. I am using it to record 8mm movies from projector onto the digital camera. I think it will definitely be very useful.

Our family is making videos every day and we use the tripod almost every time. We’ve purchased cheaper ones that eventually broke at one of the axis points and at the camera quick connect. These handles and axis are incredible smooth and are sturdy. I don’t have to worry about breaking it if I turn too tightly.It fits very well in the canvas bag. Very big fan of this econimical tripod.

Nice tripod but not sturdy enough when theres a slight breeze. I added weight to it when I'm taking pictures and that helps. The stance could be a little wider since there was times I thought my camera was going to fall over. Overall its great on flat surfaces but not so much on uneven surfaces. As a simple trip for light use its great.
Garbage, it broke within a few days of getting it.  One of the leg holders came out of place and now it slides up and down the extendable leg.  I have to hold it together with duct tape.

This is a decent Tripod for the money.  When I removed the quick release from the tripod to attach it to the underside of my camera, the small, spring-loaded button on the tripod popped out.  As far as I can tell, it isn't held into the tripod with much more than the outer edges of this little square button.  After picking them up off the floor (the square button and the spring), I carefully re-attached them and applied a small piece of scotch tap, loosely, over this pop-up button so that it would go flying apart again.  Hey, this is a $25 tripod, not a $100 one.  The legs and all locking mechanisms work well.  I'm likin' it even though it is "wanting" in it's construction.  It's good enough for me though I'll "baby" it.

This is a good tripod, FOR ITS PRICE. What it means is that it's not a Manfrotto or high end tripod, and though it's well built, it's not as robust as a more expensive tripod would be. It fits my needs quite well, but for shoots in windy or rugged conditions, I have a heavy duty tripod that would work better for my uses. Still, I've done some great long exposure night images with it and if there's no wind, or wind less than 5mph and not gusty, this is a nice tripod, especially when I travel.

Although, this tripod is considered lightweight, it is surprisingly sturdy. I recently used it to video a drama we were presenting and it held the camera rigidly in position.The tilt and pan control is easy to use and master.

This is the best purchase I have ever made with my entire photography life.  I am so tired of always being behind the scene for each and every occasions I have photographed.  I have always been complemented with my photos, but there are days I wished I was with the people I love for memories to keep and to behold.I have brought this on our trip to Vegas.  I agree, with all other photographers, that it's a must-have.  It keeps the pictures sharper without the blur/noise especially on low light conditions.  The framework of the tripod is well-built making it sturdy even on mild windy conditions.  It's well-worth the price.  I actually had my sister purchase one for herself too.  She was equally impressed how well this tripod stood the test of usage.

I can't really add much to what others are writing here.  It's a very good tripod with nice features, good lock rings for securing different features in their desired spots.Why the 3 stars?..................  The left to right pan is brutal.  I've loosened the lock down as much as I can and trying to rotate from left-to-right or right-to-left is terrible.  I'm trying to video a basketball game and it's a very jerky transition ----- not smooth at all.

This lightweight tripod is perfect for my needs as I just started using a new Canon T6 DLSR for my hobby.  I needed something that had lots of adjustments and yet was easy to use as well as coming in a lightweight bag.  It also has a hook on the bottom to place a weight to stabilize the tripod on uneven ground.

I bought the Joby Grip Tight Mount to mount it on top of this tripod so that i can take photos with my smartphone and both the stand and the mount meet my needs. The tripod is very light and sturdy, the bag that comes with it is also a great part of it. I literally made a 5 minute movie all by myself with the tripod and mount.I wont recommend buying this tripod for heavier cameras because it does have a weight limit. Ive notice that after a while the knobs to adjust the angles of your device start to not get grip when you tighten them all the way, so this means there is space when you try tighten the knob that stops the tripod from turning 360 degrees. Its hard to explain but when you get the tripod youself you well find out. Other then that i recommend this tripod for people that want to use there phones on the tripod and who dont want to pay much fpr a good tripod.

Amazing! The last camera tripod I bought was a few years back, but I remember not being able to find one for less than $50. This Amazon one is perfect! Height adjustable, super sturdy, there is a level so you can ensure your camera is level, and it folds easily for compact storage. It has also survived some brief moments of toddler curiosity  unscathed! All for less than $30!! I couldn’t ask for a better price for this.

I bought two of these as cheap tripods for my speedlights with umbrella (I'm always looking for a good quality/value trade-off). This tripod might be fine for anyone looking to mount just a camera, but if you get into any interesting lighting scenarios, say, using a flash/umbrella mount, you're going to find that a delicate balancing act is needed to keep the cheap plastic lock holding down the tripod mount from tearing off. The first time I mounted my flash+umbrella combo, the tripod lock was visibly bending under the torque and it looked like only a matter of time before the umbrella and speedlight crashed to the floor, destroying all of the equipment. I would be hesitant to recommend this to anyone using a flash, even without an umbrella, due to the force a tall object will exert on the tripod.If you intend to use this for the most basic camera situations, it might be for you, especially given the price. But if you are even a beginner looking to practice lighting scenarios, look for something much sturdier, preferably metal.

My first order arrived, and the tripod seemed to be decent quality, except the little knob used to make the tripod go up and down; was broken off.  There was no sign of exterior package damage, so I am assuming the knob was probably knocked off from being moved around.  As the quality of the tripod seemed good (other than the broken knob), I requested a replacement rather than a refund.When My replacement came, it was missing the camera plate.  And the head (the spot where you would set the camera) was super loose,  I was unable to tighten using the knobs.-  As this was missing the camera plate, I obviously returned it for the refund.

It's very intuitive and easy to use. I love that once you attach your camera to the the top part, you can easily detach the section in case you want to use your camera without the tripod. The legs easily extend and retract and are very sturdy. It honestly just took a few seconds to figure everything out and I was fully prepared to do some serious Googling, but it was unneeded!

I looked all around and read a ton of reviews. I'm not always happy with AmazonBasics but this is great. Very lightweight, perfect height for me and legs don't extend too far out. Used this with a smartphone adapter I took off a selfie stick and it worked great. ALso used it with my regular camera.Update, used it a second time and the screw in handle doesn't screw in anymore. Don't know what happened but just thought I would update the review. It can be used but falls out.

Have only used it once to get the attached photo (at 2:30 AM!) but I can tell this will be a very good tri-pod for a long time. Very sturdy, good metal, easily assembled but I've been doing this for years. Still, you can spend more but for the every-day photographer/videographer, this is more than adequate.

Well, it got out to the test and works great.  Each leg adjustable, camera tilt and raise.As clips for leg extensions are only plastic, care must be taken not to be too rough with them or they may break.  There is a hook on the lower end of center pole which, I am assuming is a tie down.  Great idea.

It's got two levels so you know your camera is shooting straight, and it can turn at any angle you choose, even straight up or down! It's a well-rounded good quality tripod with a universal screw mount.By the way, don't let the nub next to the screw scare you off. That nub retracts with pressure as you screw the camera down, and it's used for extra stability when the camera has a notch for it to go in.

I recently purchased a projector and this was a very essential accessory to use it. It would be difficult to use my projector.withiut this stand. This tripod stand works so well and is cost efficient. It can be adjusted to be higher and tilted to show perfectly on my projector screen. It is very durable and stable.

I have had several of these tripods that I mostly use for filming outdoors on the weekends.  I tend to have to replace them after a couple months of use because the mounting point for the legs tend to break.  They would probably work well for indoor use where you're not carrying them all over the countryside.The Good:

It seems sort of durable, but the movements are not very smooth and fluid.  I would definitely recommend making sure to lubricate some of the joints, and you should have smooth video footage.  I’m almost certain I got a used one, so make sure to check it over really well. I’m not going to be picky for the price. It looked pretty banged up, but it was functional.  Probably the only thing from Amazon Basic that I haven’t fell in love with.

At first I really liked this tripod because it is so light and simple, with well-placed levels. But it's been a year and the hinges have steadily loosened over time to the point where it doesn't work. If I mount the camera and point it, and tighten the screws ... the camera will fall to point at the floor. I'm using a DSLR - nothing super heavy. If you need something that lasts more than a year, don't order this.

Solidly built, but I've experienced two negative issues with this tripod:1.  The center ring that keeps the tripod legs from extending out does not tighten securely enough if you carry the tripod vertically (i.e. NOT by the carrying handle).  My hiking pack attaches near the head and lets the tripod legs dangle; on longer hikes I found the legs routinely would 'flop' open on their own because the ring would loosen itself.

I've been an amateur photographer for a number of years and have owned solid and heavy tripods. I wanted a light inexpensive tripod that would weigh like carbon fiber but not cost as much. This is perfect. Light, quickly packable with a bottom hook to add stability. Plastic may or may not hold up but for the money it should be fine. Only negative is a somewhat floppy and loose head but again this is not a $200 head and $600 tripod. Recommend.

I needed a cheap tripod quickly so I ordered an inexpensive one from AmazonBasics and was thoroughly impressed with its quality. For the price, this is an incredible tripod and is comparable to the sturdiness and quality of much more expensive models. I expected something cheap and flimsy for the price and received a great tripod that has performed perfectly for me in daily use. We are definitely buying more of these because you cannot find better quality at this price!!!!

I spent $30 years ago for one that might have been slightly heavier but didn't have the level, easy of use, or a bag which to me is extremely important.  Love the setup.  I also bought the remote (amazon basics) for my D3400 Nikon which works well for landscape shots.  Looking forward to using this soon.

Liked that it was light weight. Easy to use. Seemed sturdy as long as it wasn’t open to the tallest setting. NOT durable. After 3 uses, it broke. The locks on the legs broke and slide all over now as well. So after 6 uses, I am in the market for a new one. I wouldn’t suggest this for good DSLR cameras or any professional photographers who would use this regularly.

It may have been my last tripod was higher end but this one is terrible. Trying to get something just right in frame is a chore. Pan left, too far. Pan right, too far. Just a little, just a little, over shot.It is what you pay for. I payed for a 3 star product and received one.

When I picked up the package and heard a tinkling sound I knew something wasn't right. Box had a big smooshed spot in the side and one leg of the tripod was completely dented and the part attached to it was shattered. They must have thrown something heavy on it when they loaded the truck, or something giant fell on it on the way. Either way, had to return it.

It's a nicely priced tripod that's of quality. Upon receiving the tripod I immediately tested it out to make sure that it was 1. stable for my camera 2. stood evenly 3. not loose. There are extra knobs where you can adjust it to even be higher than it already stands! I liked that the camera can snap on easily by changing the base with a screw mechanism. I did notice that the lever knob that holds the base of the camera is a little crooked but this doesn't bother me since the lever actually holds the camera in tight.

I’m shocked that this tripod has positive reviews. The quality is awful. It’s unstable and falls over all the time (not a good thing when a $2,000 camera is attached) One of the legs for mine just fell off after a month.  Its a very amateur tripod. I don’t recommend this product.

Works well for holding my ipad (with a separate ipad mount) in my music studio.  Have used it for photographic work, but do not recommend it for that purpose as adjusting the head is a bit frustrating being difficult to lock down in a specific position.  Its a bit jerky and "moves" after its locked.  Very good value, but for photography, probably want to looks for a tripod with a better head.

I have really come to appreciate Amazon Basics for offering quality merchandise that holds up to any name brand in everything but price and therein is the one area they're running under the bar and that's a good thing. This tri-pod was purchased for use with a video camera to do some YouTube videos and after looking at many options ranging in price from $60 to $100+ I found the Basics version. Upon arrival I was amazed at the quality but also that had all the features and more than many higher-end name brands. I would definitely recommend this product.

Now that I’ve had several opportunities to use this in different settings, I can honestly say that it was worth taking a chance on! I’ve used this tripod for my Canon DSLR rebel and have had zero issues with it. I’ve used it to capture family pictures, pregnancy announcements, maternity pictures all with ease. I also love that it folds up super small and comes with a carrying case to store it in. I’m not a fancy photographer, it meets my expectations of a tripod function.

I was throughly dissatisfied with this tripod.On the first day the leg clasps became disconnected from the center mount.  I was able to shove them back on, but had to live in constant fear of it coming out again whenever I adjusted it.

This item is awesome.  I half expected it to be flimsy and made of plastic like the ones i looked at in stores.  Nope!  While there is plastic the legs are made of metal and overall it feels like it is heavy enough not to tip over easy.One thing I was confused about and maybe i am just a tripod newb, but it was only 50 inches tall and i had to fiddle with it a bit to realize there is a crank arm that brings it up to 60 inches.

Received my tripod today having gotten it the day expected.  I wanted to offer some initial findings in hopes of helping others to decide on this product.Positive: Very lightweight. Decent carrying case. I liked the simple snap-clip set up for the leg extension. Simply open the clip, pull leg to desired length, clip shut. Small, but decent, level about chest high. Easy swivel arm. A hook for possible weight if desired.  Just the right height for my 5' 3" stature with room to spare.

I am just a beginner and getting all essential gear. I don't know if this is just a basic tripod or not, it's very smooth in opening and setting up, holds to the ground well, is sturdy has a manually movable head, has level meters at two levels, has a handle to move around easily and comes with a bag. On opening full it's 60 inch tall which is excellent and can become as small as 30 inch to easily carry. It looks good and is very well priced, I would highly recommend this product to anyone who is looking for a tripod.

I used this as a base for a Celestron 20-60 X 80 spotting scope. I have no experience to compare it to other stands but I can say it does the job of stabilizing the scope very well. It is solidly made, easy to set up and take down and offers a great range of height. The price is well worth it.

We take alot of pictures and video in this family and my hands are just not steady enough to hold either our camera or video camera still enough to get a great video or picture. The tripod we had before this one you can barelt touch it and it would just fall right over. What I love about this one is it is so compact yet its extends to a nice size no matter how high or low you need it. Its nice and sturdy once it is set up and is very well made that will last for for a long time if taken very good care of. It can also be used as a stand for your stream if your video camera can be used as a webcam on the computer. I use this everytime I do my painting stream with this right on the painting and my other camera on me. Very nice and easy to take with you anywhere you go for those perfect shots while you are out.

I have been writing reviews now on Amazon for the longest time, but the Amazon Basics 60 inch lightweight tripod with Bag takes the cake, or grand prize.  What is the first thing you want in a tripod.  Light weight, next a measurement of plumb, that would be the bubble levels, but best of all is the price, and, of course,  next thing you need is smooth action.  Buy one and if you do not like it send it back in 30 days.  I am very satisfied.Rick
This is an extremely basic tripod, as the price should indicate.First, the negative:

This is a very affordable tripod.  It's simple to use and the carrying case is handy.  The only thing I have an issue with is trying to record low and the tripod legs get in the shot.  That's easy to remedy by switching the camera around and such.  Though some cameras are a bit heavy for the tripod.  Still a great tripod for the price.  It is made of plastic which I guess could be an issue but it holds up well and I've had no issue.  It holds a canon rebel t3 easily and holds other cameras well.  It is very lightweight which helps when taking it different places.

For the price it's not bad. Unbelievable review done by a guy who assembles it out of the box with nothing but his bare feet. He has no arms. I have not tried to film myself in the high wind we get at my golf course. But I used it in Florida filming my wedge swings in conjunction  with the ipad tripod mount adapter and the Callaway hitting mat. If it gets too windy there is a hook at the end of a string I could slam into the ground like a tent stake.

Very hard to believe this is actually ~$20 range. It blew away my expectations for the price. Although AmazonBasics has not yet let me down in other departments either.I can't even discuss all the features on this but it has levels, pivoting feet, can be extended and then even further straight up with a dial lever, it can pivot in many directions, has a hanger, and a nice handle to carry it (and it's light weight).

no pun intended they work for light duty around the house I would not put an expensive or heavy camera on them. The legs work well, its the head that is the problem. Too much plastic and hard to get the lights positioned and stable without drooping over. I would not recommend for mounting a camera because of the lack of stability.

Price for this explains the quality. The bottom part where it extends broke so I had to drill small screws in to hold in the tripod together. Disappointed it broke but It's a plastic materialized tripod. I wish they could at least use small metal screws at the base to prevent it from happening. It is very light weight and easy to carry around. It is better than the metal tripods in the aspect of grab go and setup.

Took this tripod out the first time and really loved it. We took a couple of family seasons that day and I was able to get great photos. It was sturdy enough that I wasn’t afraid of it tipping over and we used it in multiple locations outside. The second time I took it out I noticed that it was coming apart and that some of the pieces might have fallen off. I found them in the bottom of the bag. Should have purchased a protection plan.

It's not bad for the price but I wouldn't place an expensive camera on this and set it down without taping down the legs. It's flimsy but It works for light cameras, your phone, GoPro and such. Don't put a Canon or Nikon on this unless you are holding it. For the price it works but if you're looking for something in a professional setting I would get something stronger.

For an amateur photographer, this provides all the functionality I need and then some.  I use it to hold the camera steady while I photograph the moon, stars and planets.  Comes with a handy carrying sleeve so you can sling across your shoulder.

Sometimes you get what you pay for. I was quite pleased with the tripod at first. The head was nicer than I expected, given the price. The legs slid in and out smoothly and the locking clips calmed down reliably. Numerous bubble levels are a handy feature too. But after a couple months of very light use, one of the legs failed/broke at the point where it extends, so that leg gets unstable (it caused the tripod to fall once, but I thankfully caught it). If I fight with it a bit, I can get the clip to hold the leg in place and let me use it as if it’s not broken at all — but if I’ve got more than a thousand dollars’ worth of gear attached to it, I’m nervous about trusting it to hold up. If that leg fails and it falls again, and I don’t happen to be near enough to catch it, I’m risking a camera and lens and an audio recorder.

I've really wanted a tripod for a while, but being that I'm still fairly new to photography I didn't want to pay too much for my first one. I really do love this one! It's not huge and can easily be moved. It's lightweight, but also doesn't feel like the wind will knock it down. It holds my camera well, and does it's job. I wouldn't do anything too crazy with it, but it is just as advertised.My only drawback is that it doesn't come with instructions. There a few videos in this review section that did help me out figure out what's what, so it wasn't too bad.

After a year of use, I have taken this tripod to three countries and through all sorts of terrain. I have used this tripod underwater, in sand dunes, on the tops of mountains, to the arctic circle, and wherever else I found myself trying to get that perfect picture. After all of this, it is STILL in perfect shape and continues to be the best tripod I have ever used. Not to mention the price point, which you can’t beat for the quality!! Amazonbasics outdid themselves on this one!

Wow, well constructed, versatile and easy to use tripod for less than $30?  Count me in!  Unless you're a professional photographer that needs the state-of-the-art tripod with bells and whistles made of NASA rocket engines, this is the tripod for everyone else!  I bought this to use for my spotting scope and it's really stable.  The legs are made of solid aluminum with just enough thickness to make it strong, but not too heavy.  Each leg has a rotating "foot" so you can place it on uneven surfaces.  The head swivels quite nicely and is very easy to maneuver.  Also, there are TWO bubble levels, with one of the hidden under the mount.  Oh, and the mount comes with a quick-release detachable plate!  I keep the plate locked on my spotting scope so I can slap it on and lock it in quick.  And to top it all of, it comes with a nice handle and carrying case  Again, all for $30?!

I really like this tripod. I'm certain it's capable of holding my camcorder, or any sports action cameras I own, and it is quite sturdy. I don't own a dslr so I can't attest to the tripod's ability to hold that much weight but I think it's possible. I'm not a professional photographer or videographer I just am an amateur who has a bunch of crappy cameras so take from it what you will. It's the best tripod I own. I mounted a camcorder with shotgun mic, an "L" bracket and two 36 led camera lights and it had no issues with the weight.

I'm not much of a photographer, and the only reason I actually bought this was for my projector so that I could freely aim it in any direction I wanted. In that respect, the tripod performs well. It's not very heavy by any means but not overly light either, so it had no issue supporting the projector indoors for viewing on the ceiling. There's plenty of fasteners and adjustability so you can keep it steady and sturdy. There's a nice range of motion -- certainly enough for conventional shots and some unconventional ones as well, and the two bubble-levels are a nice convenience.If you're a professional photographer, I'm not sure this would be what you're looking for, but if you just need something to hold a camera or camcorder steady within reasonable conditions -- or in my case, a small projector -- for some hobbyist shooting without spending a ton of money, I think this tripod is a safe buy.

I had to buy a good DSLR camera this year and it took a good chunk out of my meager savings. I also needed a tripod to go with my camera. As the old saying goes, "You get what you pay for." I was really worried that I would be wasting my money on a really cheaply made tripod that would eventually force me to spend more money on a supposedly better quailty made tripod. I'm so glad that I was wrong on all accounts. This is a really nice tripod, it's not cheaply made, it's very good quality, sturdy, light weight, very good construction, and best of all the price is very afordable. When I shop Amazon I will deffinetly look for AmazonBasics first. Thank you Amazon for making quality products at a fraction of the cost.

I purchased this tripod to use with my digital camera. I wanted to be able to capture special events without the shakiness of being handheld.I was pleasantly surprised with how well it is made. Although it's nothing like similar products I've used 30 years ago, it has held up to the abuse my 3 year old had thrown at it. If it lasts a few years, I'd consider it money well spent.

This is a great tripod. Yeah there are more expensive ones, but expensive isnt always better. Its compact, easy to store, and very stable. The clips are durable and it even has a level gauge to make sure your camera is straight. It switches from horizontal to vertical shots in a snap, and the telescopic works with ease. A+++ I definitely recommend

I purchased a pair of heavy binoculars (long range viewing ones) and they were to heavy around my neck and to hold. This tri-pod took the weight off of my arms and neck. I've only used it on a concrete surface. The tri-pod is adjustable from a sit down or stand up viewing positions, very sturdy also.

It does what I need, mainly stability for my dslr camera. And it doesn’t break my budget. In fact, it is way below it. With this tripod, I can rotate, tilt the camera or even use it for portrait framing by moving the plate 90 degrees.Cons:

The tilt pan head won't stay up. Bought primarily to use with binoculars. Binoculars are light and way under weight rating of tripod. But every time they fall forward(binoculars when mounted) they will not stay up. The tilt head is tightened as tight as it can be. Afraid would bust if we tried to tighten any more.

This is one of the best purchases and investments that I've made. I travel often, and in so many environments. This can expand up quite a bit, and it collapses easily, and light enough to hike with it. Nice bag it comes with too. It doesn't come with a phone adapter so you'll need that for anything besides a DSLR. I've used it with my Nikon DSLR and it screws in just fine to the base, and can be removed. Great product!

Some times when u buy cheap stuff it works great and that is the case here.Pros: super light weight easily adjustable legs and head and head sets very solid. It even has a bubble level and even better a hook to hang weights for windy days or u sturdy ground.

This unit is great and is perfect for medium weight dslrs with gear.  I have a T5i with light and microphone and this tripod is great .  VERY solid unless on slick flooring but just add same friction pads to the feet(which you should do anyway) and its perfect.  I like the handle, makes it easy to use this vlogging .  All of the actuation are very solid and do not drift after set.  I was impressed with the build quality compared to price.  The only addition i would like is another mount included.  I would like 2 or 3 infact as a separate purchase would be great.

We use the tripod to hold an iPad that films our diving practices and transmits to an Apple TV.  I needed a new tripod because the previous, more expensive one, broke.  This came quickly and was even in its own carrying case.  It is very sturdy and does the job.  Would highly recommend it.

I was looking for an entry-level tripod that was very portable.This one comes with a carrying case and folds nicely. The mount is sturdy for its weight and the 2 built-in levels help making sure the camera is straight.

Light weight and perfect for an FPV monitor/ground station. Not of the highest build quality but that is to be expected at this price point. All the functionality of a more expensive tripod. Picked this up for less than $18 and it even came with a tote bag. Very pleased with this purchase!

Mostly use this for slow-shutter landscape and nighttime photography. Basically need something to keep my camera angled and still. This tri-pod delivers both. I would never use this for any type of video work. The head is very plastic-ey but once you tighten it down it stays there. It's also pretty light-weight and it makes it easy for me to tote this on my hikes. The strap bag is simple yet gets the job done. I just sling it over my shoulder and get on the trails. I'd recommend this for the budget photographer who needs a decent tripod.Update: Less than a year later, 2 of the legs have fallen apart on me and the quick release plate is pretty much useless (won't stay on if camera is tilted at all). If you're just getting into photography, I'd still say this is your best option, but don't expect it to last very long. You get what you pay for.

Quick disconnect arrived damaged.  Compared to more expensive tripods, this one is very lightweight (meaning not very stable) and plastic breaks too easily.  It is probably fine for some uses but nothing that any professional should consider.  I was only planning on using this for some night-time binocular viewing and it is not capable of holding the binoculars.  It could be the fact that it arrived damaged but even trying to work around that issue it doesn't seem capable.  I'm instead using my wife's photography tripods as they are much better quality and can handle it like a champ.

This tripod is easily worth the price point. If you're looking for a tripod to support a point and shoot or lighting, this tripod is for you! However, due to the build quality and the head being plastic, it doesn't support heavier DSLRs very well. The panning motion is very jittery due to the friction of the plastic.I gave the tripod a 4 star because it is still useful for mounting lights and lightweight (point and shoot, go-pro) stationary mounting where you don't need to pan the shot.

Only by this if you really use a tripod and don't beat your equipment up at all. I bought this thing with the warranty couldn't find some of the parts to send back with it never exchanged it. Buy a manfrotto it's worth the money.

I received my tripod today and already love it! This is MUCH better than the CRAP tripod from Walmart that broke on me. I especially like the crank to raise and lower the top, and it's very stable!  The handle on the side is also especially handy! I believe I'll get a lot of use out of this!

Very lightweight, I used this with my Canon 5d mark iv. The legs are skinny and light, I probably wouldn't use with a heavy lens. Just be careful of possible tipping over. Mine was only a 50mm 1.8 lens, and it is doing the job for me! I like how tall it is compared to others I've tried.

Needed a couple of extra tripods for a multi-camera music video shoot. Nothing fancy - didn't want to spend a lot of money, just something to hold a camera for an afternoon. I had zero expectations. Imagine my surprise when I set them up, saw how positive & smooth all the functions are and that not only do they look like they might last awhile - but they might be a great, lightweight travel tripod for trips & location shoots. Very light - so you might need to hang a weight from the ballast hook to keep it steady, but I couldn't be happier with the item and the price.

This is a great lightweight tripod that has all the features and adjustments that you might think of. My only thought that because it is lightweight, a heavier camera like a DSLR would be less stable. That is of course what the hook on the bottom is for though. As for me, I just use a point and shoot and this works just fine.Update: As of August 29, 2015 one of the leg clasps broke off completely. The tripod is now inoperable and unable to be repaired. So it lasted about 4 months. Should've bought a more quality tripod.

You get what you pay for, and I'm pleasantly surprised by this tripod. It does require a tender touch so if your rough with equipment it won't last long, but take care and it works great. Once it craps out its my permanent flight control stand and I'll buy something nicer, if your starting out and want to save a little $ it's not a bad choice.

I bought this tripod for my new Nikon D3300. Works just as expected and seems to be a very reliable tripod. It's lightweight and is at my eye-level when fully extended. The only problem I had was that I unscrewed the main handle too much so it came off and the bolt in the front which held it in place fell out. It was easy to fix though - you just put the bolt back where it was (in the front) and screw the handle back on. I recommend this to anyone looking for a decent, affordable tripod.

It is simple, handy, easy to carry. This is my first tripod and I have been able to use it with a DSRL and a point and shoot. I also have to say it is compact (for carrying)  but extends nicely. I do like the built-in level, the carrying case the quick disconnect feature if you want to quickly take the camera out of the tripod base. In times feels a bit rough on the movements which might be an issue is your are filming, but so far I have found a work around and learned to deal with it.I would highly recommend, of you are not a professional,  this as it is good quality and excellent price.

The tripod from AmazonBasics is a steal for its price. I purchased this to use with my Nikon D5600. The tripod uses quality materials. The fit and finish are good(solid manufacturing tolerances). Additionally it has most of the bells and whistles of mush more expensive tripods: C-clamp leg locks instead of spin locks which wear out easier, double extending legs, level balancing bubbles, a quick release camera mounting base, and a decent carrying bag. Kudos to Amazon because this isn't the first camera accessory I've purchased under the Basics line and I plan to buy more.

If you don’t have a tripod. You should! And if you want a good budget one, then get this one.It is pretty lightweight and pretty sturdy. A really good deal for this money. I wish it were like two inches higher at its maximum length.  But that’s on me; it is as described.

I've had this tripod stand for a year now.... Its a great product! The height and adjustability is outstanding. The base, with screw attachment fits my DSLR camera and also fits my phone holder. I use it mainly to record video for my Youtube channel and often have to place it on the stairs... the legs adjust easily to the different levels of steps.  There are two bubble levelers on the stand so you can be confident your equipment is leveled out. Great product for any photographer at any level. -- however its not very heavy so if outside in high wind, use better judgement.

It looked great, felt great, and I was really excited to use it but while checking the height on the camera stand it popped off the legs and won't go back in. The way it's constructed prevents me from being able to fix it so now I have this dead-weight, busted tripod and Amazon has 24 of my dollars. Waste of money.EDIT: I managed to put it back but it's a bit shaky. I'm not sure if that's the tripod itself or my inadequate fix but for my purposes it's not a big deal. Having to fix it on the hour I got it still irritates me, though, and I will begrudgingly be using it with that memory. So far everything else seems to work fine.
For the price this is a great tripod.....i dont think i will be replacing this for now. Love the 2 levels so u can always know when ur camera is straight.

This broke after having for less than a year. I removed the arm that rotates the camera to store it and when I went to put it back together it wouldn't screw back in no matter how hard I tried. So it became useless since it would stay up right with a camera on it. Bought a cheap one to replace it and that works better than this one did!

This tripod is both well-made and affordable. What I like most about the tripod was how it had bubble levelers in various places of the tripod to ensure it’s leveled properly. I would definitely recommend this to anyone in the market for a tripod.

I use this thing almost every day with a Dewalt line laser and its fantastic. Bear in mind, its $23 and not comparable to high end fluid tripods but for $23, i dont care if it lasts a year on the job site. The laser i use is kind of heavy and this thing has no problem being stable at max height. the hand crank is great for making minor adjustments, and seems to be of decent build quality for the money. I cant speak to how it works with a camera but its perfect for a jobsite laser tripod! will be buying more of these in the future

Purchased this nearly a month ago. It's lightweight and as described.The Good: Holds the camera up and feels relatively solid given the price point. Great first tripod (especially if you don't know much about gear), as it will quickly teach you what you actually want from your equipment. Inexpensive!

I have to admit I've never owned a camera tripod before so I wasn't sure exactly what to expect, but this one seems to have everything. It has both a tubular and a bull's eye spirit level, and a rack and pinion crank for fine-tuning the height. It is very quick and easy to unpack and set up, and cheap enough to use with a phone mount. It is surprisingly compact when retracted. The included bag is useful for on-location shooting.

It's light-weight and comes with a nice case. There are many height adjustment options and camera angle options. I like the quick release feature too. I'm not a professional photographer, but I do many photo shoots with my family and when you need the right equipment, you need the right equipment. This is the perfect product for occasional use and at a great price.

I've been using this little guy for about six months now. The primary purpose is astrophotography and auroral photography. It is a rock solid, lightweight, and sturdy tripod. Unless you have tons of money to burn you won't find a better price-point in tripods.I have sat this tripod on the arctic ocean (it was frozen) and photographed the milky way, if that gives you an idea of how durable and trustworthy this tripod is.

Works for what it is designed to do. Easy clamps to adjust legs, breaks down quick, has a handle and a bag. Could use some extra weight perhaps. Only complaint is the adjustments for the camera head are a little less than smooth. If you are using just for still shots, probably wouldn't be an issue, but a little zoom and recording video, every minute adjustment brings on jitter and shake time. For the few shots I've taken, this has worked great, but the panning & tilt during (albiet zoomed) video is not ideal.

Cheaply constructed tripod.  The plastic head is difficult to adjust and doesn’t accommodate a metal binocular mount.  The plastic is very flexible and doesn’t keep your device stabile.  In fact leaning against a wall or window without the tripod is a better option.  Save your money for a metal version.

This is by far the cheapest and worst quality tripod I’ve ever seen. I used it all of 10 times in the year I’ve had it. Opened it to use it today and one of the locks for the legs is completely broken. And I was unable to repair it.

I needed a tripod to take to the latest Space X launch as my last photos were just orange blobs. This one was the top pick in the price range, came in 2 days (on a Sunday!), was super easy to get level and I love how the top part that you screw into the bottom of the camera pops off with a lever so it is easy to get set up.  I give it a 10+

I have a Canon EOS M3 and this tripod works great for me. I lost my previous tripod and started looking for a taller one. I'm 5'7" and love using the tripod. Only takes me a few seconds to setup and the cloapse. Plus, everything is very adjustable. I like this tripod soon much more than my last!

The tripod barely rotates (so stiff it feels like it's going to break!) at the top - all knobs are adjusted correctly.  The only way to rotate it while recording with my camcorder is to force it around or pick the whole tripod up & move it to where i need it to be.  I'm wondering if I just got a defective one?

This tripod would work okay for point & shoot cameras, or maybe if you put a cell phone holder on it. It would be risky for a real DSLR, particularly with any heavy lenses. ...I actually bought it to hold a DIY photography *light*, not for a camera at all. The light doesn't weigh much and has a counter-balance weight.

This is my first tripod so I don't have a basis to compare this product to. However, I have found that it definitely serves a practical use for whenever I need to take family or other large group shots. I really liked how it came with a drawstring case so that I didn't have to go out & find one. One thing I really appreciate is its reasonable adjustability of height. Although this was already explicitly stated in the product name, I should also mention that I'm pleased with its lightweight. It's definitely going to be nice to have on road trips. It's compatible with both my cameras so all in all, I'm content with this purchase.

I was using this for outdoor filming and to hold my spotting scope. I love how lightweight it is but it shakes a lot even with a slight amount of wind. When adjusting the camera view for slow moving objects the tripod was very rigid and sticky which resulted in a lot of poor footage. Unfortunately, the plastic connection peice between the tripod and camera broke after a month so I can’t use it anymore. The price was right which is why I gave it 2 stars but the only way I see this tripod being useful is for indoor still shots where the tripod doesn’t need to be adjusted during filming.

I have owned this tripod for just a week, and I have taken it out a few times to take some wildlife photos around the property.. I do like how light weight, and easy to use it is, but with that being said, it does make it feel cheap. But for the price, it is well worth it, and would but again.

I am relatively new to photography, and I wanted to get a tripod for my DSLR without spending very much money. I decided to go with this one because I liked the features and the price. I think this is an excellent tripod for people on a budget or as a spare for someone that has a nicer one already.Stuff I like:

It's a perfect , simple, basic , beginner tripod ! If you're newer to photography and tripods buy this one first! I swear it's great to learn on and super durable. I brought it to the ocean all the time and the redwoods. I used it until I got my fancy smancy expensive one (that's amazing) but I'm glad I got this one first before I committed. Buy it.

I bought this for my granddaughter because the price was good and the tripod looked (and is) decent. However, be aware that it says "Pack of 2!!" Stupidly I didn't notice and probably could have better spent the same amount (or a bit more) on a better single product. However, if you really want two, these are certainly decent enough for a beginner in videography.

This tripod is perfect for anyone who needs basic camera stabilization that isn't in rugged terrain. I would not recommend this tripod for heavy outdoor use or as a tough grab-and-go, but it's perfect for basic indoor photos and videos. It's very lightweight and easy to adjust, with with perfect height range for average sitting and standing positions. The more precise adjustments for pivoting and angling the camera can be tricky at times, but use simple tightening mechanics that are easy to understand. This is a great tripod for anyone just getting into photography/video, or anyone who is looking for an inexpensive backup tripod just for use indoors.

Used one time to see how it worked and then took it out of the bag to actually use it 3 months later and it just fell apart. It's cheaply made the plastic pieces were stripped. It was too late to return. Will not buy again

lightweight, easy to store and a very basic tripod. I work in fashion and have seen my fair share of tripods. This is nowhere a heavy duty professional tripod -BUT! -  quality is well balanced with the price. I use it in my studio for product and detail shots. Works perfect.

I've been looking for ways to improve my photography and decided I needed a tripod. So I scoured the internet in search of 'the best' tripod and came across this beauty. From the two levels it has, to the extending legs, and two the vertical and horizontal panning handle, this tripod works 100%. I couldn't have found anything as good as this tripod anywhere. On top of this, I was shooting a commercial product for my theatre class and one scene called for the tripod falling over. This tripod was able to take a hit and be rendered unscathed. I would highly recommend this anyone looking for their first ever tripod, you will not regret it.

We ordered the AmazonBasics 60-Inch Lightweight Tripod with Bag out of necessity for filming our unboxing vlogs. This tripod is exactly what we were looking for. It's tall enough to film at eye level and taller if needs be. The max height is around 60 inches (or 5 feet) and it has a minimum height of around 24 inches (2 feet). It accommodates both our cell phones and mirrorless camera. The controls are pretty standard, and are easy to learn and operate. The shipping was fast with no issues, which is a plus. I would recommend this tripod to anyone starting out in photography or filming.

I have gone threw several tripods over the years of taking photos. This one has last the longest so far. We simply use it on unlevel ground in the back yard to take our large family photos!For smaller purposes as the one mentioned above, I do recommend this tripod. I would buy it again if the one I have ever does break.

This stand is even better than I expected. As soon as I opened it in an unboxing video, I was already testing it out. This item comes with an up-down rotator, double-extendable legs, a crank to increase the height of the camera itself, and even levels to test if it's straight. In addition, it has a little handle to hold it, so it's easy to carry around. The only thing it does NOT (at least not that I've found yet) is the ability to horizontally rotate the top piece. In other words, to turn it left or right, you need to turn the whole stand (Do correct me if I'm wrong about this, but I haven't had luck on this end).Still, though, highly recommended, and for the price, you really can't beat it.
I needed my first tripod, to use for tripod-related things.  Cheap price and it works.But when I was doing research for more $$$ tripods, I can see why you'd move on from this.

I'm new to photography and wanted an inexpensive tripod so that I could take some steady shots.  I read a lot about what I'd need in a tripod, but honestly, I was driven by price.  I didn't want to invest a fortune in something that I wasn't even sure if I'd use all that often!  I've already gotten my money out of this little guy.  The built-in levels make it so easy to be sure everything's set up correctly, and it's super light -- very easy to tote around, especially in its carrying bag.  My only gripe is that as a first-time user, I literally had no idea what I was doing or how to attach the camera to the tripod.  A quick instruction sheet would've been helpful, but it's so easy to use, anybody can figure it out.

I've yet to mount my camera on this but I know my review won't change.  I had a more expensive one before, wind while I was setting up a shot took care of that one and I needed new, I like being in the family pictures I'm taking so this is going to be great.  It's well built, feels solid and has all the things I need to get my pictures without spending a fortune!

Overall good value for basic photography, but terrible for zoom-lens; light cameras would likely be fine.I've got a Nikon P900 and I purchased this tripod to be able to use the super telephoto lens on that camera and it just isn't a good fit. No matter how tight I make everything, the camera still moves around quite a bit making it difficult at best to use for telephoto photography. It's still useful for my older cannon DSLR which is much lighter but I wish I would have dropped a bit more money to get something that was a bit better.

This is a wonderful beginner's lightweight tripod! I say beginner because I know there are others out there that are insane and probably weight 60 lbs or something!The options of settings that you can put your camera in is very handy, though I'm using it for simple straight on filming.

I use this tripod with my Nikon Monarch 3 8x42 binocular for birding and the heavier Oberwerk 20x80mm LW Binocular (4 pounds) for celestial viewing. Easy to set up and tear down, light to carry.  I use ARMRA Quick Release Plates from Amazon for both binoculars. Recommended.
My initial impression was good. Nice bag, light weight and adjustable. Decent for the money. The first time I tried to use it, one of the legs fell apart just extending it. Not impressed.

I'm very happy with this purchase. Very light weight yet extremely stable. I questioned it's durability but I've been using this product for well over a year and couldn't be happier. Can adjust to any height I've needed and very simple set up and pack up. Highly recommend.

I never write reviews but this deserves one. You will NEVER find a better tripod for this price than this tripod. I have a very heavy DSLR (70D + battery grip + telephoto lens) and my previous cheap tripods couldn't support the weight. The head of the tripod would just tilt down under the weight of the camera and the legs weren't very sturdy. This tripod is rock solid sturdy. The head is rugged and sturdy. The legs are thick, sturdy, and fully extend to a height slightly shorter than myself. This is a great tripod. Great price.

I know I shouldn't expect much considering the price, but I have to say it's less quality than I expected. Nevertheless, I purchased this to hold a $150 chronograph....not a camera. I will give it a try, but I'm questioning if I will trust this thing or not. I certainly would NOT trust this with a nice camera.

I bought this since March 2016 so I have been using it for one year and more now. I purchased it after my first tripod broke which was a cheap one nothing fancy and I can't remember the brand even. I then saw this which was in the perfect price range to me but i didn't think that it will be a very high quality when i purchased it. this stuff is great and it can handle my canon700D and i used it a lot for one year and it never failed me. it's not heavy and it has a handle where you can hold it when moving other places. i still use it to this moment.

I bought this to replace my old targus tripod that the gear stripped out on.  Upon receiving Amazon's tripod, they appear to be nearly identical, if not identical.  Hoping this one won't have the same issue down the road.  Otherwise its exactly what I expected for this price point.

I’ve been growing my Instagram lately as an influencer so I decided to get this in order to help take pictures if I have no one else to. It’s been amazing! It’s not heavy, it’s very portable, it’s easy to open up and easy to close up. It doesn’t come with instructions buts it’s very easy to figure it out. Great product and especially for the price!

It's a good, cheap little tripod which I've been using with my phone quite a bit for videos. I got a cheap $3 selfie stick and took the head off of it. I attached it on this and it works like a charm. It has levels which are pretty cool, and all the adjustments are super simple.If you're looking for a good basic tripod, I'd highly recommend this one.

This is a good tripod for the price as long as you don't need additional features. It feels sturdy for such a lightweight tripod. I ended up getting another tripod because this one doesn't work for overhead and low shots, but I still kept this tripod since I've been able to use it for basic setups.

A good cheap tripod for stationary shots. Terrible for video shots where you expect to pan a moving subject and/or zoom in for close-ups. (ie: school plays; concerts; sporting events). I purchased the better tripod which allows smooth movement with a 360 degree ball head and now get perfect recordings. Yes it cost more but the results are worth the expense.

Worth it if you don't have a lot of money to spend. Yes it *feels* a little cheap, with its plastic components but with care it will be just fine until you can upgrade. The levels are a nice touch. The one under the camera plate is a bit hard to see without direct light or in portrait position. But it was worth the buy for me for the money.

This is a good solid tripod.  It is a great step up from my old cheap Quantaray.  I really like that it has a hook on the center column for additional weight.  It's light and acceptable for taking on outdoor activities, but the carrying strap can get a bit abrasive.  This is the price we pay for a solid $20 tripod.My main intent of this tripod was for off-camera flash.  With the combined weight of umbrella holder, flash, and umbrella though, you have to tighten the assembly very tightly to the quick release plate or the whole assembly will rotate on the rubber QR plate surface, possibly upsetting the balance of the whole unit.  (It will stay in place if you tighten it enough) I could see the rubber on the QR plate degrading after seeing too much high pressure friction, but I've only used it in this capacity once so far.  I have rated it 4 stars because I'm very pleased otherwise, and it probably wasn't fully intended to be used as an umbrella flash holder (since there are light stands dedicated to such things).

Does the job.  Carries my Nikon D610 with a 80-200 f2.8. without any problems.  Not great for video as pan is rough.  A great value.  Docking a star cos the head cant be changed.  If that was possible, these would sell in even greater numbers.  Took a hit with a field hockey ball traveling at quite a speed and survived without a dent.

If you're looking for the best tripod on the market, this isn't it.  However, my original inexpensive tripod quick change plate finally gave out, and the price on this one was right.  The legs lock, the quick plate attaches, and the head swivels and tips.  This tripod lives in my studio - I don't take it camping or out in rough weather.  It sees fairly light duty.  On occassion, I might need to fold it up and take it across town, and from what I can see I doubt I'll have problems with that.  If you're looking for an inexpensive 'pod to hold up your camera and a not-too-heavy lens, this will do you fine.
This is a really nice tripod. Comes with all the features you can ever want or need. Amazing quality and unbelievableprice.

I just got my tripod for my new camera, it’s the best DEAL you can get for a tripod I completely recommend it. The feet are adjustable it goes pretty high, there’s also a crank by the camera that can adjust how high and low the camera can go, it’s pretty strong and durable and holds the camera tight. I’m so excited to use this now for my photography! Good deal for a tripod.

This is my only tripod I've ever laid hands on, but for the price I don't know if this thing can be beat.  It's a trameneous value.  I only need to hold a camera and laser level, and with all the features this offers and the materials used, I'm not sure why anyone would pay more.  This is a great tripod.

I received this over Christmas of 2015 after using it. Few times I feel OK to write my review.This is a very simple to use tripod with a decent carrying case to go along. I was hoping for more height but I am still very new to photography and may end realizing I won't need anymore later on. I also do not have a remote yet, so I am using it with a timer when I am taking a shot of myself and others. When I am taking and scapes or wild life portraits I do find it very easy to set up and use without worrying about a steady hand. I can adjust it as needed with out difficulty and it is very secure once locked. I think this is a great tripod for any newbie like me!

I bought this and it is exactly what I thought and wanted. You unlock the segments of the leg and extend them and lock them. You  turn the crank to extend the mount off the base. You aim the mount and turn the knob to tighten. It is standard tripod functionally. It was cheap to by and serves it's purpose excellently.
NEVER would have gotten this shot on a windy day without a tripod.Amazon's tripod is lightweight, sturdy, and easy to use.  Price and value

Great tripod for occasional use. It keeps the camera still and is very adjustable. It’s not a pro accessory that I would tote around on the job, it probably would not hold up to the abuse. But I’m a hobbyist that needs to use a tripod every once in a while. It will be perfect for that job.
I use my tripod indoors mostly in fixed position.This is an exact copy of my previous tripod that lasted over 10 years.

Some of the reviews for this product say that it is too small for someone who may be tall.  I am 6 feet tall, this tripod is plenty tall enough, even for me.  I am using the Celestron 71008 SkyMaster 25x70 Binoculars with this tripod with 0 issues.  The tripod does not fall over, doesn't shake, is not too short, it is perfect.  My dad is 5'7", this tripod is perfect for him too.  Don't forget that the neck also rises, just turn the dial.

Sturdy and not too heavy. I use it when I don't want the camera to shake (during videos or portrait shots). However, it does not move around smoothly, so if you want to film movies that requires the camera to move, this is not for you. It will be choppy and hard to maneuver. But if you just want a cheap solution to hold you camera still, this is perfect. It is not expensive, and it can get tall enough for standing shots as well as low enough for sitting shots. Easy to use and sturdy.UPDATE:

Before purchasing this Tripod I read all the reviews that highly touted this item. Some said that it was an incredible value. Others mentioned the level, and vernier crank for final elevation adjustment. Some thought the portability was nice. Some kindred purchasers liked the overall smoothness of operation and the convenience provided by the quick release mount that is attached to your camera.I concur with all and can only add this brief remark in regard to the AmazonBasics 60 inch Tripod with bag...

Can't believe I only paid what I paid for this. It's super sturdy, it stands up very tall, and the locks work great. it has two different levels built in so you can make sure you've got your camera angle straight. The twist locks hold things in place very tightly and are not difficult to loosen. All that in a lightweight but sturdy package. I just wanted it as a backup, but it became my go-to.

I use a Canon DSLR now, but when I purchased this, I was shooting videos in an iPhone, so it made sense.  I can recommend this product for indoor use.  When I use it for outdoors, its very light which its pretty nice, but I need to be very careful if I leave the camera unattended to take a picture of myself with the family or make a video of some sort.  I always look for wind or people walking around, because it is extremely light.  It has a hook underneath to put some weight.  It does the job, but not for professional use, the price speaks volumes.

I know this isn't incredibly cheap but when you open it you understand what you're paying for. This feels solid yet light with a bunch of ways to adjust angles from any direction. It has built in levelers to show you exactly where it is uneven, making it super easy to get flat shots even on slanted ground. It can get incredibly tall for small you can fold it for traveling. It even came with an over the shoulder carry case on top of already having a metal handle on the side. Amazing product and price! 10/10

The only negative side to this tripod is you can visually notice that it is made out of cheaper materials than the traditional high grade expensive tripods. However in my opinion it does perform like a high end tripod, it has everything you will ever need, its lightweight, it can pan up down and side to side, no stability issues and very portable and easy to carry around.

This is my favorite tripod. It is very sturdy and lightweight, and it collapses down to about 2’ long and fits in a black carrying bag that looks clean and professional. It’s very easy to pack in a backpack and I just leave it in my car trunk for whenever I might need it.

So far so good with this tripod. The mixed reviews made me think twice about ordering, but I'm glad I did. This tripod holds my Canon SL1 very well and it seems pretty sturdy. Height is perfect too, as I can fully extend all legs, and crank the center up and get the camera right at eye level which is perfect. The head of the tripod has good adjustments, and also seems pretty sturdy.I think the key is not cranking down the adjustments on the tripod. I saw some reviews that mentioned that screws and adjusters have stripped out, and broken. Just snug everything up to the point where it doesn't move around. You don't have to tighten everything until it's at the point of snapping.

I'll start by saying that It's hard to complain about a tripod at this price point. All in all, this is a tripod that will hold your camera steady. If you have that need only once in a while, this guy will do the trick. It's good for someone who is just buying a kit to have on hand in case something unexpectedly comes up.That said, this tripod is not sufficient for everyday photography use. The head is stiff and hard to maneuver. The legs feel rigid, but not strong. Small bumps and movements make the whole fixture shake. While the tripod does include some conveniences, the construction is weak; mine started coming apart after a couple of weeks tops. The handle is now loose, as are the legs when folded. I already feel like it needs to be replaced, since I don't want to risk a leg breaking off while I'm trying to open it up to take photos.

I like this very lightweight tripod. I use it to hold my spotting scope. It is very adjustable and I can use it on a bench or freestanding on the ground. The scope and tripod are very lightweight which can be an issue in very strong winds. Pleased with the purchase and consider it a very good value.

The first one had a broken leg. The replacement one also had it's leg broken. I think the quality is way too cheap. Luckily, I use them in a stable setup where I don't have to move it around. So it works for my situation. I have no confidence in the longevity though.

For the value of the tripod is great, After I recorded multiple videos, I noticed the camera shakes a bit.  I thought it was the camera, so I test the camera just sitting on the table.  That’s when I noticed it was the tripod.  I have no idea how it shakes.  I even made sure everything is locked and secured, I still have the same effects.

When I purchased it, it seemed like a reasonable basic tri-pod for occasional amateur photography.  Side to side panning was not smooth enough for video, but the price was right.  After just 18 months, one of the leg joints is broken.  I can't recommend this product.

mine arrived with out the adapter plate required to put a camera or anything on it.  just an empty qr plate pocket. I ordered a 2 pack that claims to be compatible for $12... so factor that into the cost.  not worth the hassle of having to drive out to a ups store to return for replacement.

For the price and amazon generic brand. You can’t really expect more. The tripod is lightweight. However when you try to tilt the camera it is not very fluid. I do live broadcast with it. When I try to tilt the camera you can see the tilt gear gets stuck and sticky. I wish they would put a bit more investment on that part.

If you have a lightweight video, still, or phone camera this tripod makes the difference between shaky, blurred, pictures and rock solided sharp focused masterpieces!I also use one for a portable amature radio antenna.  Makes for a quick setup!

Considering this was paired with the Nikon p1000 as a package buy, I expected this to be a decent tripod. It's crap. It will not stay in place when I aim then tighten. It drops dramatically. Very frustrating.

The tripod is okay for the price. It's only $20. Took it hiking in New Zealand and it hit the ground once. The head broke so it's not really worth fixing. The tripod is not very sturdy. If you're looking for a tripod that's going to last do not buy this... Although, if you want a cheap disposable one then it's okay. Because it's so light weight you have to be careful with a heavier camera so that the tripod doesn't tip. I was using a Canon 5D mark 3 with a 70-200mm lens and the tripod was more tentative with that much weight. Although, I still got some cool shots with it before it broke. :)

This tripod is extremely lightweight & compact, and the travel tote is perfect for storing and taking the tripod around.Despite it's light structure, the tripod is very sturdy and does not wobble at all. It also has telescoping legs and a reclining neck, allowing for a lot of height variation based on your needs. Overall, I would say this tripod is a great base for the casual photographer. It is definitely a great value for it's price!
I am impressed at the quality for this price pointI see other tripods out there at triple the price that are not worth it

Cheaply made but functional for occasional use. This is perfect for those times when you just need a bit more stability for a longer exposure shot. Not for the serious or semi-professional photographer but will be fine for many home or vacation uses. Built well enough so it will not break unless it is abused.

For the price, this is a good tripod. It's aluminum and plastic, but the look and feel, and the controls, are quite nice.The z-axis swivel was a little snug, even with the tension knob unscrewed. I rotated the swivel around, about 50 times, and that loosened it up a bit. Now it has just a slight tension with the knob unscrewed.

I am blown away with the quality and  Versatility Of this tripod. It’s just good stuff. With many features I was unaware that I was getting.  Infinitely adjustable, sturdy. Feet pivot, hook for stability weigh, removable quick change platform mount, nice carry bag.

This is a light weight well made tripod and I am currently using them for work light mounts. I liked the first one so much I bought two more. All three have been able to do everything I needed them for and the completely adjustable features allows for the lamp to be angled in any direction to illuminate the area I am working! Hope this helps! Have a great day!

Have had the tripod for almost a year and a spring just broke that holds the plate/quick release to the camera on the tripod.  Everything functioned as normal for the time period but then out of nowhere, while finishing up some photography, it broke.  Luckily, my camera didn't fall.  I wish I could have it replaced but there is no option apparently even though it was no fault of mine.

It gets the job done very well. However, even though the legs and tripod are very sturdy and made of aluminum, the plastic hinges and handles are made of very cheap plastic.Unforunately for me, one of the hinges broke and the tripod couldn't expand evenly anymore.

I just make home movies, so didn't need a professional model with a lots of expensive features.  So this tripod is just right for what I need at a very reasonable price.Well, you get what you pay for. Panning isn't smooth, jerky no matter how much I adjusted or lubricated it. And a leg slid past the clamp, and I never could get it back it and work as expected...and I have tinkered with many things.  So, If you plan on leaving the camera attachment area in a fixed position, and leave the legs permanently extended, this is the one for you!.

Excellent product for the $ and can even compete with much more expensive tripods, very durable and sturdy and have every possible feature that professional tripod has, love this tripod and highly recommended to any photographer, comes with quick realease plate that screws easily into my Nikon D7000, has a Buble to show you that you are straight and has many extensions and tilt control options, I'm very happy with this purchase.

I purchased this to take a family photo at Christmas and it worked like a charm!  It is compact, comes in a nice carry bag, and sets up quickly. I bought the separate attachment for my cell phone and it screwed right on.  Very happy with my purchase! Great value!

Like some other reviewers, I am amazed at the quality of this tripod for the reasonable price.  I was expecting a lot less, even after reading other reviews, but when I took it out, I was very impressed with the quality, and how well though-out it was.  A real bargain in my opinion.

Decent tripod for the money. I like the lightweight and flexibility of this tripod. Excellent travel and get up and go for the price. Easy setup for filming kids basketball and recreational videos.The only downsides are when panning left and right the head jerks before it starts moving. Mainly because of the plastic is uses to try to glide when panning. The tripod is light so bumping, tipping, on the court dribbling makes it tip or jerks when trying to film.

Got this for my spotting scope. Very durable and light. If your making movies and you need to pan, swivel and tilt it may not be as smooth as you want it but this thing is  great for the novice and for my intended purpose its awesome. Killer price to value this was a steal.

Wow, for the money - I wasn't expecting this.  Its not as solid as my 1970's era "made in Japan" high tempered steal Tripod (over exaggerating here), but considering this this is made mostly of plastic - pretty solid, usable, and recommended - especially when you are on a trip and you need to travel light.

For the price of this item I have been able to get a lot of angles and uses out of it. I use it for production purposes mostly but I would supposed a true professional invest in something more pro. For the start up or one timer this get's the job done. I have been impressed with it.

We bought a DSLR camera last year, and wanted to find a tripod for occasional use. This works perfect for what we need. I mostly photograph my little boys, and occasionally products for my small business.I am not a professional photographer, but I do know a fair amount about taking photos and wanted to improve the qaulity of my shots. Having a tripod is key for getting clear pictures in low light or indoor settings. This one has a lot of adjustments for different heights, and angles. I like that you can securely attach your camera, but that there is a quick release too.

Love, love, love this tripod! Comes in a great little shoulder bag to carrying. has a leveler on top to make sure all your sides are level and stable. While I'm sure that down the line as my photography advances I will have to spend a little more on a tripod, this is a great starter for people just beginning or people on a budget, amazon always has the customer in mind when attaching their name on a product, this great little tripod is proof that they care! Thank you Amazon for making my dreams a tad more accessible with your amazing website!

I have nothing to compare to so...  This is a great tripod.  I had my shutter open for 30 seconds, tack sharp image.  What is there not to like?  I think some of the reviews that say it is not steady are not using it correctly.  It is tight as a drum for me.  The low cost is just a bonus.

Seen a lot of negative reviews, its $20 plus dollars. Pay more if you want better quality. for me it fit the bill. Works great and was delivered fast like always. I could have went with a big brand and pricey product but chose this one and I like it.Only thing is the pan is a little tight even loosen but I've learned to work with it. I highly recommend even more to beginners

My previous one was broken last week, just need one quickly. Thanks to Amazon's Prime, got this one quickly and used it this weekend for my game recording. Overall, it's not bad, especially for the price. My major issue for this one is: not smooth when rotating/tilting. It's sluggish and make recording pretty hard.Tripod seems to be built with good quality though, light weight and easy to carry.

I wasn’t expecting much from this Tripod but I did need one for portraits. Well let me tell you what, this Tripod is awesome and holds my canon T6i and lens without any movement or worry. Cameras are very expensive and you forsure want something you can have confidence in that will hold you camera, well this tripod blew me away and is very sturdy. Defiantly would recommend.

I bought this for a fairly non-standard reason.  I want to be able to easily 3D scan people using the Xbox One Kinect and the Kinect to PC adapter.  I read online that mounting the kinect to a tripod and having your subject rotate on a chair is the best way to do this so I picked up this tripod for that purpose, and as an added bonus I can use it for its intended purpose as a camera tripod.Pros:

This is a nice tripod for the price and  I was enjoying it for a week. But while in use, the pan handle screwed out which caused a small nut to drop out from...somewhere. After that the handle would no longer screw in and we couldn't find the slot to replace the nut that holds it. We worked hours trying to figure out how to put this back together. Also  NO MANUAL comes with this tripod nor could I find one online anywhere. I called customer service for a manual and was told there wasn't one. They kindly offered to replace the tripod with the return of the first one. I took the offer but I'll be very hesitant to buy another Amazon Basics product.

This unit has a good size interlocking pad which collaborates well with the size and stability of the tripod. With a $1500 Electronic Radon Monitor mounted to its top, I need a stable and secure support system below. This tripod rises to the task! I liked it so much , I changed out all my previous tripod setups to this one and actually bought two extras for "just -in- case".

I thought this tripod had a universal mounting system.  I have a Cannon T3 Rebel and I could not mount my camera on this tripod.  Took with me on a hiking trip and had big hopes for it.  Ended up taking all the pics myself and don't have a single picture of the complete group of people on the trip (group pictures was the goal).  Really disappointed.  This was supposed to work!  Even the picture looked like it was a T3 mounted on it.  Completely useless to me...

So far so good! I really like that the top middle part extends even after all of the legs are fully extended. I haven’t used it a ton, but I like it! I also think it’s great that there is a hook at the bottom of the base! Comes in handy to hang your bag while getting the shot :)

This is the first "AmazonBasics" product I have purchased. It is a very fine tripod and I'm pleased with the 60-inch height. I have used it to mount a camera and a 60 power Leopold spotting scope that is one heavy dude. This tripod can handle the weight. I like the carrying bag too.
