It is a quality piece of equipment regardless of price, and the price is right!

This tripod is very good for the price. You can adjust the height, tilt,  and rotate .  Adjusting is very simple and easy you can do it without instructions. It can go as high as 6 feet with additional height  adjustment.  I am a beginner photographer so I don’t need expensive high and tripod this perfectly suits my needs .

I have to admit, I read the description and saw the price and thought this can't possibly be as good as it says it is for the price.  If this is not one of the best deals at Amazon, I don't know what is.  This is an amazing tripod that adjusts in so many numerous ways that I have yet to find an angle or position this tripod can't accomplish.  Its is lightweight so if you need to carry it any distance, you will love it.  I have used many much more expensive tripods that I ended up hating because it was too heavy and did not have enough angle options to meet my requirements.  This one does it all.

Before I bought this tripod I went to bestbuy and bought a 65 dollar tripod that was very similar, I got home and pulled it out of the box and one of the legs was broken so I returned it. Then I checked on amazon for tripods and saw this one that was less than half the price so I went for it. I'm so glad my first tripod broke because this tripod is super nice and on par or better than the 65 dollar one. There's nothing fancy about it but for taking still photos and video that doesn't need smooth panning this tripod is perfect. It's also very light and comes with a great carrying case. I would definitely recommend this for anyone who is in the market for a tripod.

Alright, this one is really confusing to me. For nearly 5 stars and 2k reviews, I absolutely expected more. I will note that the camera I use is an old (2007ish) Canon Rebel XT. This is not an abnormally large or heavy camera.I bought this to photograph my products for my small business. I need the tripod to do very simple things.

This is a great little tripod, nice size, lightweight,  lots of versatility. This is great if you don't have to pan left or right. You really can't use this for video, the panning is stiff and you have to hold onto the tripod aggressively when you pan. If you don't need to pan left or right, it's a great tripod, unfortunately I needed it to shoot video and it's pretty hard to use in this respect.

I bought this for my 14 year old daughter, hoping it would be a decent tripod for her. It only lasted about 3 months, and one of the legs fell off for no reason at all. It was very, very light weight, and very sensitive to any vibrations. This is a waste of money, good thing it was super cheap, but I will not be buying this product again

This tripod is amazing and you can't beat the price!!!  It's perfect for my YouTube channel and so lightweight, I have no problems moving it up and down the stairs to film.  Setup was super easy, and it's much more durable than I expected it to be.  There are many other more expensive tripods out there, but this one gets the job done, easily, and for much less money.  If you're just starting out and experimenting with tripod use, I would highly recommend this tripod!!

Wow, this tripod is great. Cheap and it functions in the way I need it to.OK so I'm not a professional photographer so don't have particularly sophisticated needs, but I wanted a tripod that was functional and lightweight and this met that criteria. I have had no issues with stability or strength and it is simple to use. It has a good height range that works for me (5"6) or my 6"3 husband. The legs are easy to adjust and the feet can be manipulated to help level it even further. My Nikon D3300 feels secure when on the tripod.

I absolutely love this tripod. It smoothly changes height and stays in place very nicely as well. I like that I can simply slide the camera out and click it back in place without having to wear down the screw threads on the bottom of my camcorder. This tripod also make it so easy to angle the camera and lock it into position again. It's nice that this comes with a bag, but really it's just as comfortable to carry around with the handle. The only thing I wish this had was a way to connect a ring light as well without having to use a separate light stand.

The package arrived torn, dented, and ripped apart. The tripod itself had a dented leg that prevented extension so for all purposes it was unusable. Amazon is sending a replacement free of charge and the return process is much more painless than from a third party seller so at least that's nice.The tripod itself is a bit bigger than I expected, definitely less compact than others I've used but for the price it seems functional. Planning to update review once a workable item actually arrives.

I was blown away by this tripod when it arrived. It is so easy to adjust the leg height. The camera footplate is so easy to use. Almost everything on this tripod is adjustable for whatever function you could be using it for. I am so pleased with the high quality of this product. It is a great value. The only thing I can’t comment on is the longevity of the product but it just seems like it has a quality build to it that will last.

For us baby boomers who remember when a small professional tripod could cost several hundred dollars, I can say this simple tripod is totally fantastic and worth twice the price.  I have a similar 60" Sony tripod which cost $60 and it pales in comparison to this AmazonBasics tripod.  I can't believe I got it for under $25.  I hope you can too.  It's a winner!

For the most part the tripod worked just OK.  The horizontal axis was very tight (not fluid) in its movement, which was very disappointing because I was using it to do bird watching with your (Amazon's) 80 mm scope (GoSky)., that made the image really bounce.  It was so bad that the tripod would tip to one side.  I was going to return it, but decided it would be too much trouble, so I threw it in the bottom of my closet thinking I'll use it with my 35mm DSLR someday to take stills.  I went to Wal-Mart and got one of much better quality for half the price.  The GoSky scope was very nice though.

I am a newbie photographer but this tripod is so easy to set up, that it deserves the 5 stars.  I don't know how long it will last but that's ok it does the job and the price is unbeatable.  In the past I bought one from Targus at Target for 40.00 and it was so complicated that I never could set it up it hardly got used yet it broke.  So far I'm happy with this purchase. Even it it breaks in the future I'm just glad it's not complicated to set up and I have been using it without any issues.

Lightweight and easy to adjust - but not very stable (telescoping head still a bit wobbly, even when the locking nut is cranked down). If you're placing a lightweight camera on the head and not touching it much, you'll be fine. I'm using a DSLR for video and not manipulating it during shooting, so I'm getting away with it. But if I were looking for a truly stable platform to shoot from, this would be pretty useless.

Know upfront that this is not a heavy duty tripod. With that said, I am satisfied with it for my purposes since I only use it occasionally at home for videos. If I needed a tripod for daily use at different locations, I would go with a more durable model. It is packed with the same features as more expensive models, just made a little cheaper.

I got this tripod to use it with a Nikon D5100 with either the 18-55 kit lens or a Nikkor 35mm DX f/1.8. The only additional weight I expected to add was a small metal focusing rail.So far the tripod has performed pretty well. I use it a lot for macro and it is steady enough that vibrations are not an issue. When fully extended it is very stable, I am never worried about the safety of my gear. There are two locking rings, one with a simple tread is used to lock the post, and a some kind of bayonet ring locks the legs open. I would love this even more of both locking rings had used this bayonet mechanism.

I use this tripod for general photography both with camera and smartphone (using a smartphone adapter), and to stably position an SPL meter for receiver calibration.It's stable, well made, has all the expected adjustment points and even includes a carrying bag.

I'm not an expert on tripods, but this is perfectly solid and feels very quality overall. I could imagine some of the operations being smoother in a higher end tripod, in particular the twist action on the handle (controlling up and down pitch angle) and the left-right yaw swivel. For example I'm not sure I could do a smooth left-right pan if I were shooting video. Also there's no way to lock the yaw angle that I can see, but it's not loose so you don't need to worry about your camera swiveling inadvertently.

I was surprised how nice this tripod was for the money. I'm not a professional photographer or anything like that. Everything on the tripode worked smoothly and it feels strong and sturdy. I'm a tall person and even this tripod extended tall enough for me to use as well. It's rare that something surpasses my expectations but this tripod for the money did. Would buy again.

I’m a real estate photographer. Extremely lightweight. Easy to lift and maneuver. The lock broke on the first one I bought after about 8 months. I use it multiple times a week so it held up fairly well. I bought another one and it is still going strong after several months.

I was a little worried about this after reading some of the reviews but I didn't want to spend an arm and a leg on a full size tripod.  Glad I gave it a go.  So far, so good.  It is easy to use and supports my 60mm Gskyer telescope without any problems.  Feels very stable and moves smoothly.  I'm thinking about purchasing a second one for my spotting scope.

I was pretty excited when I got this. I don't use a tripod often, but it's nice to have one handy when I need it. That's why I didn't want to spend a lot of money on it.This tripod is very light weight, sturdy even when fully extended, and is easy to adjust and tighten. It worked very well for me when I used it and is a great buy for the price.

I found this more than adequate to my needs.  When using 500 mm (2x teleconverter for 1000mm) lens like Viviatar, Bower, Opteka, a tripod becomes a necessity.  I found it solidly built, with levels, and stable.  Easy to set up, easy to uses, easy to disassemble.  Inexpensive for those on a budget.

I am quite impressed with the quality and overall usability of this tripod.  It's incredibly lightweight, LOVE the carrying handle, and the legs telescope for even the tallest person!  I can't say how much I am enjoying using it.  Thanks Amazon for a great product!

I LOVE THIS, I just wish they made a smaller version that was just as nice so it would be easier to carry on hikes.I've been using this for awhile and it holds up really well. The movable feet make it easy to set the tripod up outdoors. It has multiple levels that let you get the perfect shot! For such a low price this Tripod really works well. I was able to get multiple shots with it I wouldn't have been able to get without it! This photo I included is one of my favorites that I would have never gotten with my previous cheap tripod (which happened to cost about the same as this one)

I really like this tripod ... it truly is lightweight, but it is still very sturdy. I especially like how the faceplate can flip right off if you need to handhold your camera and don't want to start unscrewing it. I have purchased many AmazonBasics products and I have never had a problem with any of them ... they are always well made and are offered at a very competitive price as compared to similar brand name items. As for this tripod, I am very happy with it and would not hesitate to recommend it.

I have three now. One for a camera, one for a sound recorder and one with a phone adapter for a second camera angle. These are very good tripods at a low price. I had one arrive with a split gasket ring but I just replaced it with a matching one from the hardware store.

I love how light it is yet you can use a good size camera on it. You can take it with you in the car, or in your bag. Easy to move around and easy to adjust. Great buy and very sturdy and stable. Purchased one a few years ago and say this one on sale so I had to get it.
Works great for shooting home made xxx videos at the house with the wife and her friends!

Compact, easy to carry, like the quick tach option, but makes noise while turning that gets transferred into audio recording during videos.  The foot pads on the legs come off easily and can get lost, making it slide around more than you might want.

I have never owned a tripod before this one, so I can't compare it to another, however this one has worked great for me so far. I liked the fact that it was portable, I needed it to fit inside my suitcase when I traveled to Jamaica for a wedding and vacation, and it fit perfectly. It is very light, and easy to set up. We used it for our large Canon EOS camera with both the standard and a larger lens, worked great. We also used it for a Kodak hand held video camera, also worked great. It is very easy to move when it is all set up, but felt very sturdy when in use, even on a sandy beach. Once I figured out how to maneuver it how I wanted, it was easy peasy. I know I will get a lot of use out of this tripod.
So many adjustments, very stable, levels ect.You could pay $150.00 if you want for a different that will literally do the exact same thing.

This was a great tripod for me to bring on my trip very lightweight and will fit in a suitcase when compacted. My only qualm is that my camera is very heavy and so when I put it in a sideways mode it kind of does not support the camera very well that part could be a little bit stronger.

I would say this is a great tripod because it is small and you can store it anywhere and unfold it and use it, adjust any way you may want to. I did a lot of research to find this tripod and i exceeded my needs great quality, very easy to use, and the price is just dirt cheap i mean super cheap. I wouldn't spend a ton of money for something like this on this product you get more than what you pay for is a good investment. It comes with a bag so you put it anywhere and the height can be adjusted to your needs.

Wow Amazon is going to put everybody else out of business this stand is professional lightweight and does everything I needed to do at a third of the cost I was looking at from other places if you are a motivational speaker like me  or just need a quality Stan and this is the right choice trust me

I've owned a few tripods in my life, this one truly is a great find. This is a basic model for amateurs or even a very nice cheapy for any professional that goes places where you wouldn't want your expensive tripod to go. Very easy to use and it is sturdy enough even for my expensive Cannon. This truly is a good deal!

If all of your photos are dead flat with a slight hint of a curling corner from the cover page of Virginia Woolf's To The Lighthouse appearing in the foreground, then you my friend, have been taking photos wrong the entire time.  Who knew that removing books from the bookshelf in your library and carrying them downstairs for a family picture at the dinner table proves to be such a tedious task.  Worry no more, this tripod will literally save you and your back thousands of dollars from all the doctor visits, acupuncture appointments, and physical therapists after years and years of stacking books just to reach the desired height for your camera.  Do your back a favor and keep the books where they belong...on the bookshelf.

I am an amateur photographer, and one with not loads of money. This tripod gave me a cheap "professional-level" tripod that I was seeking - it provides enough support for my camera with different lenses - including a heavy 100-200mm Canon FD lens from the 1970s (older zoom lenses can be heavy!). It is stable, and the few times I have used it have made me very happy. Locking all the mechanisms that you want, and the camera stays stable. lock a few, keep the swivel available for quick panning - that works great too! pumping the tripod beyond the legs height - still stable as well! For the price, this is a great tripod. I am sure professional photographers might find issues with it - but for my needs, it beyond exceeds my expectations.

I was looking for a tripod to mount my camera on to.  I have a higher-end tripod for my Spotting Scope but I can't mount my camera on that one because it will only let me take horizontal photos.  I wanted to get another tripod for my camera so that I could also take vertical pictures.  When I found this one I decided to purchase it and for the last half month I have been using it and love it!  Perfect for what I need as a non-proffesional photographer and very helpful that it is so light-weight given that I am a nature photographer going on long hikes with it.Would give it 5 stars but only downside is that I can't fully lock it so that it won't move at all, but that is a minor problem that I can totally put up with.

I bought this tripod for taking pictures of my new daughter, and so far it has been great for that.  My one complaint, which is why I knocked off a star, is when I took this out of the box for the first time, the end of the handle that raises and lowers the part that mounts to the camera was broken.  Not a major issue, since it still works fine, which is why I didn't bother sending it back to get a new one.  The tripod seems sturdy, and is very easy to put up and down.  It also comes with two built in levels, one at the top of the legs, and a second where the camera mounts.  If you're looking for a tripod for family photos, and general use, this is a solid option.

Purchased this to take our family Christmas photo on the ONLY day that will work logistically. It arrived the day before our shoot but missing the plate with silver screw needed to connect camera to tripod. No instructions either. Now I have no idea what I'm going to do! My plans are totally screwed up. Warehouse FAIL :(

Super functional and effective for the price. Had it for a few years now and while I don't make a living with my camera it works really well and the built in levels are a nice feature considering the price. Definitely would recommend and buy again.

This is exactly what I needed. Why pay hundreds of dollars for a tripod? this does the trick and the price is great! I have a T2i and a T4i camera with extra attachments. I have a videography business and it holds my camera just fine. It's great for traveling and comes with a traveling bag. If you have a larger professional camera, not sure if this tripod will be strong enough for that kind of camera. The quality of the product is OK, the legs seem to be hollow...so just beware of that. You can't put sandbags at the bottom.For the price I'm happy. If I find that I need a stronger tripod I will pay the extra cash. Right now I don't need one, I have other options such as a shoulder rig and a monopod.

The item arrived broken, taking the time to return it + driving to post office + printing label is not worth returning it.On top of that the feet is not very stable, the fixation for the camera is not design well enough to insure a consistent and stable position.

Just to get this out there; this is not a tripod for people with super expensive camera equipment.  If you have a super duper heavy over like I don't know, maybe over $2,000 camera and lens?  Then you probably should be looking for the expensive tripods.  This is a $24 tripod.I was pleasantly surprised with this tripod!  When I was looking at the reviews I saw quite a bit of distaste for this product; but those people obviously didn't know what they were buying.

Sturdy, and built to last. A friend has a differently branded one that he bought over a decade ago. The design is exactly the same, except this has feet that articulate. No other difference so I'm confident it'll last quite some time.I use it for an LED projector and it's been perfect. The carrying case is a huge bonus since I use the projector as a portable movie theater.

Easy to use and nice looking tripod. Nice enough that we can leave it in the corner of our living room behind the loveseat. We have a pair of our good binoculars mounted on it to look at the lake (or lake bed in the winter) where we live. It's amazing how much easier it is to see birds, coyotes, people, boats, and houses a mile or more across the lake. No more jittery views that give me a headache!

Sincerely, the product is good but to some point, you'll always find it disappointing. I bought a smaller one of this product earlier this year, and it accidentally fell to the ground because the camera was too heavy and some parts just disappeared and it couldn't work again. However my camera which should be way more delicate was totally fine. It was past the return date so I bought this one. As the size is bigger this one is stronger. However, today when I took it from the shelf it fell down again, because the strap was off the bag. I only used it for twice and most of the time it stayed in a storage and I just can't understand the quality can be so weak. I know I should take good care of it but shouldn't it at least can stand one or two crash？

I highly recommend this tripod. Not only is it very affordable but it’s very lightweight and simple to use. I love that it fits in it’s own little bag, and I can throw it over my shoulder and take it with me on the go for outdoor photo shoot anywhere or to an event! Best tripod I’ve ever owned for sure!!

I purchased another brand, Paladinz Phone Tripod 42 that was basically $5 less but far more inferior, almost to the point of a child's toy quality. Returned and bought this Amazon Basic 60 inch tripod and wow, difference was like night and day in quality. Much more sturdier and stronger metals used. I would recommend this to anyone who needs a basic tripod that can hold up to task without the fear of breaking and doesn't want to spend a fortune.
All plastic. One of the leg clip assemblies completely fell apart after 4 uses. It's now useless.

I have messed with this tripod for hours. Where do you attach the camera? The top piece with the lever that moves back & forth does not really attach to the tripod. If you flip it to the side it falls off. The underside of the lever is the only potential camera screw I see. Am I missing something? I see notes that refer to a quick release but where or what is that? Instructions with parts list and photos would be useful!  Help??

I needed a light, cheap tripod. Got exactly what I wanted. But have used this sparingly and it already is beginning to break. But what do you expect? Just remember, it's not a professional tripod so don't expect this thing will last for years and years.

It is a great stand. I got the amazon brand because it was cheaper. It can be made much taller than I thought it could be and folds up super small. It is also surprisingly sturdy for the price. It may slip on hill because of the tiny feet.

I purchased this product as a cheap tripod to use for still photography. For this purpose, I have found that this tripod works seamlessly. I have had no issues adjusting the height of the tripod or the angle or direction of my camera. I have found this to be a quick and easy set-up for portraits with my family. I have found the tilt and swivel functions to be more than adequate for my needs, but I have not been using it to shoot any moving footage. I imagine that the plastic mechanisms would prevent the smooth swivel often desired for videography. This tripod has been plenty sturdy for me and has held up well thus far with my Nikon 3200 DSLR. I would purchase this product again.

This is a nice tripod for a good price. It's lightweight and can hold a DSLR. The plastic parts seem a little flimsy like they could break eventually. The level is on the wrong axis and useless. You want to make the camera level to the horizon, but this measures how much the camera is tilted up or down. But you get what you pay for.

I had to send the first one back because of some defects.  Amazon quickly sent a replacement with no bellyaching at all. This one is perfect in every aspect.  I have a large spotting scope mounted on mine, weighing around 3.5 pounds, and it holds it steady without effort.  I'm really pleased with this one, and it's price was very reasonable.

Admittedly I haven't used this a lot, but it's been pretty good to me so far.  I plan to use it mostly for recording my son's judo tournaments.  It's not super rugged, but it's seems sturdy enough that as long as it's not tossed around, and abused like it's made of steel(which it's not) I see no reason why this tripod can't last a good long time.

A decent tripod for photography. Good for the price, as long as you’re doing still photos. There is a good 1/8” of play when panning from side to side. For still photography, this is perfectly acceptable. For videography, especially when the subjects or scene is moving, it causes jerking in the video. It is very well made. The tripod this replaced was double the price for only one unit. The materials and build are very comparable. I would highly recommend these for photography, or even to mount a spotting scope on, but not a video camera.

This item was delivered today, right on time. I was actually impressed with the quality for the price! My husband is a videographer and he has a $100 tripod, and this one has pretty much the same look and features. The only thing different was that this is lightweight. Which, for me, is prefect. It has a little hook underneath the camera mount where I assume you can hang the carry bag it comes with. Or my husband suggested to hang a weight to make it a little more sturdy when panning. There's two levels built in, as well which is something my husband doesn't have on his. Nah nah nah nah! This Item is 100% worth the price! Thanks Amazon.

I bought this several months ago, thinking that I did not have to worry about it. That I can just keep it in the closet and pull it out when I needed, that moment came a few days ago and it was terrible! One of the knobs used to straighten the camera was loose, I had to stuff papers under the camera for proper placement and the screw that sticks out to mount the camera was so short my camcorder barely clung onto it. Terrible, terrible. Lesson learned that I should test and try out products upon delivery.

I got my tripod today and I have to be honest, I didn't know what to expect - but I am so very pleasantly surprised!  It's light - it has a great carrying case  - and the tripod itself as a handle.  I had no difficulties "opening" it up to full length and the same with closing it back up.  It has two bubble levels, a hook to hang your bag or purse (if you carry one); you can seriously position it any which way.  I'm super excited I got this!  Definitely recommend!

This is my first tripod.  I'm loving it.  It's exactly what I didn't know I wanted.  I purchased this on a whim because I've always heard they were great to have but never felt I needed one.  Finally, I agreed it would be nice but was just purchasing a "cheap" product and wow I'm so glad I did.  I don't know how I managed to take pictures without it.

This product is ok , yes it is cheap and yes I have seen worse . So I am using this as a tripod for my smart phone and for this it is stable. But if you are looking for a stable base for a heavy camera I doubt that the head has the long term stability to hold it in place , especially when it is a crocked angle. Further if you are shooting action and moving targets the head is simple jerky and it is impossible to follow a target with a continues fluid like smooth moving action. I think it is a decent product but I also know that I have bought better quality in the past. It does what I wanted it for ...

This is a very easy to use and a great working product. I use this for taking concert videos, still pictures and a variety  of other needs. Find this to be extremely easy to setup, a very nice carry case to carry it around to all my places. Use it, tug it to the bag, drop it on your shoulder and walk around to the next stop. The steel is very sturdily made and so far I have had no issues with the extending legs or any of nobs and widgets. It is also very light compared to my previous tripods that did not last long and were much heavier.

I needed a tripod for my up coming vacation. I wanted a compact and durable tripod for my Sony camera. This was promising because it is an Amazon high rating product. Which I usually trust when I buy things on Amazon. But turns out it is not anything close to being compact. Durable, yes since it is huge I would expect it to be strong. But it is still too long and bulky to travel with. The "lock" at every notch is very flimsy and I have a feeling it will not be good for log. I guess you get what you pay for!

Awesome product,  starts out very compact and even comes in its own carrying bag.  Sets up in seconds and adjusts up to six feet tall. Has two levels to be able to get the camera level and stabilized quickly.  Weighs next to nothing so carrying this tripod around is effortless.  Has made making videos so much easier as I can just set it up and hook up my camera in minutes. I have already recommended this to dozens of friends and family who thought my most recent pictures and videos were more professional looking.  The cost is only one of the best aspects of this product. You will not break the bank trying to find a reliable tripod any longer.

This tripod is the best for its price. I have been using this tripod for the past 2 years. There are some limitations using this tripod under certain conditions, but it would be unfair to blame this tripod for the price. This is a very light but stable tripod. I hang my camera bag under this tripod for maximum stability. I use a D750 with a Nikon 16-35 lens which holds good under any angle. I am maimly into landscape and this tripod has been really helpful under most of the conditions. Due to its light weight, you can carry it always. People tend to avoid tripods which are expensive because they have to carry the weight. The only drawback is the minimum height, where you really want to get close to the ground for a foreground. Same for the height. The carry bags strap isnt big that you can carry it cross your shoulder(I find that safer). For these limitations I have given it a 4 star and not a 5 but for its price definitely a 5.

Hobby photographer here, I bought this not thinking much of it since its priced cheaper then most I've seen. It actually works way better than I could have anticipated. So glad I bought this. It's easy to use, easy to fold up and light weight so it's great to take on those shoots where you have to walk a ways to that perfect spot.

Bought this for our trip into the smokey mountains. Worked great. It's lightweight, has a quick release plate which is very easy to use. There's a carry handle built-in to carry it if you're close to your next pic location and not wanting to take the camera off. The leg heights are easily adjustable on uneven terrain. Breaks down quick and the carry bag is convenient. Great buy.

I think I received one that had been used. The box was partially open, there are 'dings' in a couple of the legs - where the legs are inside before extending.Because it is functional, and works well, I won't be returning.
Pros:+ Price

This inexpensive tripod is perfect for any beginner. It's adjustable and easy to carry around (and it comes with its very own bag). Extra weight can be added on to make it more stable by hanging it on the hook at the bottom. The only issue is that it doesn't pan as smoothly as I would have expected it too.

This Tripod would be ok for cameras and photo shoots with stationary shots. For Spotting scopes and video cameras it is awful.It would be difficult to film on this. The panning horizontally is about as smooth as the rumble strips on the side of the road. Movement is also very limited in some directions.

It’s pretty sturdy, but the mechanics of it are awkward and overall it’s a bit cumbersome. I have purchased a few other tripods on Amazon and while this one feels like it may last longer than 9-12 mos, it doesn’t thrill me.

We love this! It’s a great price. It isn’t the most durable thing out there but we don’t use it a ton. We love the adjustments and everything. We bought a second one after testing it out. We will buy again if the need arises. It’s perfect for us.

Loved this tripod at first, but went to use it this weekend & one of the leg locks apparently broke and slid down.  Cannot get it to slide up and stay locked in place.  Kind of like having a broken knee.  Really annoyed.  Only use it a couple of times a year

Would not recommend this for a DSLR camera with a telephoto lens. The legs of this tripod are very skinny and don't feel sturdy at all. This would be fine for a point and shoot camera but I wouldn't risk anything heavier.

I am not a professional videographer or photographer so this mid-range/priced tripod is perfect for me. It is light weight and holds my small camcorder stable. The price was reasonable. I am happy with this purchase.

At a much lower price than others, it's easy to think that it won't be high quality or will have limited functionality. I can't believe I didn't get this sooner. I've seen others in person for much more and they don't seem too different from this one. It's solid, lightweight and does what it says it does. Great job again amazon.

I had read earlier reviews about how this thing might be Chinesium, and well, while it is, it's not flimsy and it's quite accomodating, which is a relief. While the movement of the handles and the direct aim leave a little bit to be desired you can tweak those by adjusting the tightness knobs a bit and moving it around to get a feel for where you want smoother handling. Levels are worthwhile and having not had a legitimate tripod before, this can be a decent solution.

I love this!! It's sturdy and great. I used it to photograph stars, and also for video of my training. I have a very expensive camera and feel safe with it.I can level it up to be straight on unsturdy ground, and it goes high enough to go over the electric fence as pictured.

I had higher hopes for this tripod since it had such a high rating. I was going to use it for my 62x superzoom dslr for zoom shots. Unfortunately, the plastic mechanisms it uses are not nearly smooth enough to be able to zoom in and then tighten down without moving the subject out of frame. It works well as a typical tripod.

This was an awesome buy. I only have stability in 1 arm. This was so lightweight to carry on one side along with all my camera equipment. The hook in the center was perfect to hang my camera bag from & it was really stable. LOVE this tripod.

This was a surprisingly nice tripod. It's very tough, lightweight, and maneuverable. The price is a bargain. The only thing I didn't like was the adjustment arm. It juts out a little too far from the central axis. It's easy to bump into more than it should be.

Use this with a phone adapter to film my training sessions and ensure my positioning is correct. So good I bought two for different angles.Not the most solid piece of equipment, but good enough for light duty things

As others have described, the tilt handle broke where a nut fell out of it.  Returning the item for a better quality tripod. I love AmazonBasics for most stuff I have purchased but I have been striking out lately with the tripod and power strips.

I needed a lightweight tripod to use with a small video camera, and this fits the bill perfectly. The legs can be locked in a small footprint configuration, so I can use it in a row of an auditorium.  This tripod is actually more sturdy than a more expensive tripod I purchased many years ago--everything locks down tightly so there is no shake or slop in the mechanism. While I don't know if I would put my heavy DSLR on it, for a lighter weight camera or digital recorder (like the TASCAM DR-40), this will work just fine.

Like: small compact portable when folded. Opens up to be very tall and stable for use. Very light.Dislikes: too light and can easily tip over,  if with little kids can knock over easily. Not quit sure how strong it is bit seems ok.

Used this for the first time the other day to take a family photo. It is incredibly simple to set up and put your camera on. Its sturdy and has a little level to make sure the camera is straight. I'm not a photographer by any means but this thing is super easy to use. Love this thing.

This tripod is a nice, inexpensive, lightweight item. If you have any intent of using it to tilt and pan a video camera, you will probably want something sturdier and with a much quieter head. I had to use some dry lubricant on the pivot points and even with that and with all of the release knobs loosened, it still would catch and grind a bit when I moved the head. The grinding was loud enough to be picked up by the camera's microphones.Still, OK for the price.

Stable 'pod. It doesn't come with a holder for smartphones though (if you're into phone photography like me). It comes with a travel bag for storage. There's this attachment that balances out the tripod itself if one of the legs isn't aligned with one another.
I've been using this with my IPhone and it's perfect.  I did need to get a holder for the phone, but I knew that going in.It's perfect for what I need it for.

Picked this up on a prime days special and very happy I decided to move forward on it.  For the price the quality of the tripod is excellent.  I will mainly use this with cell phone, GoPro, and DSLR with smaller lenses so it should work out perfectly.  Again, surprised with the high quality for the money especially with the amount of features.  I would highly recommend this to anyone looking for a good, versatile, and light weight tripod that is very cost effective.  Thanks!

This is a great little Tripod. Obviously not a Manfrotto, and feels lighter and less robust, but does not feel flimsy. Offers easy rotation from landscape to portrait and includes level bubbles. happy to have it in my kit.

Hey, it's a cheap entry level tripod. I can't complain, but it's not exactly great. But if you need a cheap tripod, or are just getting started, it's a great buy until you are ready to upgrade to something a little more serious.

I am a hobby digital photographer, dragged kicking and screaming from film.  My old 3 leg tripod was expensive in it's day but was a good 20 yrs old.  This new inexpensive tripod is WONDERFUL.  The snap-off plate that locks the camera on the top of the tripod, the two bubble levels on the tripod, the adjustments for forward and backward rotation is on the exntension handle at the rear of the camera (wrist-rotates to lock or adjust), and the easier method of flips to extend the legs.The tripod also has a convenient plastic grip to carry it when out of the bag, the black bag that holds the tripod for travel, etc.

We use this with a phone mount and it works very well. It's nice and sturdy and will raise to a nice height, but it's light enough to be carried around. It also has two levels in it so you know you're getting a good shot. Very impressed for the price.

If you need a tripod for cheap, this is it. It works fairly well for basic functions. I've used it for time lapses with any issues. It comes with a carrying case that makes storing it away very nice without the worry of scratching anything. I will note that the quality is not the best. At full height it is quite wobbly if you don't tighten everything down very well. Another issue I have found is that it does not open very wide. It can seem unstable sometimes due to this, especially the more extended it is.

I purchased this tripod for my spotting scope for use at the rifle range. Just perfect for my needs. Light weight and compact. The adjustments are numerous. I love the mount that stays on my scope and snaps in instantly. They price was incredible also.

This is the one to get.  Sturdy, easy to operate, compact, great price.  I highly recommend this tripod to anyone who needs to steady their camera for a timed shot or take a self-time photographs.  This is the one to buy.

I actually have bought this tripod 2 years ago and it still holds itself together! I recommended this tripod to anyone who wants to use it for youtube videos, photography etc. I used it with my iPad and my camera; Canon Rebel T6i (I still do) and it still works perfectly fine.It doesn't feel like its going to fall its very sturdy and honestly its the best tripod out there especially for the price!  And I use it for YouTube videos :)Pros

It works. The tripod is light so don't trust it without weighing it down. I've had two of the little grippers on the legs pop off when I extend them, and they are a pain to get back on. After I glued em all down, it works pretty well. Got what I expected but in my opinion below the quality that AmazonBasics usually delivers. May have just gotten a lemon.

Hi, I bought this tripod a year ago. I am not a regular or professional photographer and I don't use heavy lens or anything. But within an year this is already broken. One of the leg is broken. Also, it is always very wobbly. I am not sure why Amazon makes such shoddy stuff. DON'T BUY.

I'm over 6 feet tall and this tripod comes almost to eye level when my camera is attached. It's a great deal for the price, but it you want it to do self portraits outdoors when there's wind, this is very lightweight and a good gust could blow it over unless you rig up a way to weigh it down. But on a budget this is a fabulous option.The carrying case it comes with is great for transporting and storing this too. It fit my Nikon D3200 beautifully. Will probably use it for my Panasonic Lumix as well.

Amazing!  I love my tri-pod.  It has adjustable legs so you will always be level even if the ground isn't.  You can tilt your camera and it will stay without falling over.  It goes to about 6 or 7 ft tall in height and it works with my Canon Rebel T3i camera, which is awesome.  It even has a level.  I was impressed with the overall quality of this product and the bag it came in and would recommend this to anyone who is a beginner in taking occasional pictures.

I shoot studio and outdoor portraits. I mount around 3 lbs of gear on this guy and it works real nice. While it might not look as sturdy as it's 3-5x pricier competitors it sure gets the job done and it's pretty customizable. I'm happy with my purchase

Used it for a party photobooth and it was perfect. It has a surprising number of features I learned about via youtube. I wish it had instructions with it for us non-photographer types. For example, I didn't know it could go sideways until I saw a video online. Very nice. AmazonBasics impresses once again.

Fast shipping and this is an excellent tripod. It is very light weight and easy to set up and take down. When everything is tightened down it is very sturdy and secure. I've used it for a 20x60 - 60mm spotting scope and it holds it just fine.If you are a professional, you might want an expensive tripod, but this is perfect for everyone else and it is priced right and extra quick release attachments are easy to find.

This is very unstable and wobbly, but does the job if you want the cheapest option. It also tilts horizontally in both directions when panning, and is very noisy and not smooth, so don't expect to be doing ANY pan or tilt during recording.

This 60-inch tripod has one less section than my other ones ... and so it does not fold-up as small, and it didn't fit in my tripod carry bag, so I had to return it.  So, keep that in mind!  Other than that ... it's a great value :-)

It is what it's advertised to be: a basic tripod. It actually functions fairly smoothly. The only complaint I have is that the pan rotation is not particularly smooth, even with the locking nut completely disengaged. The tilt friction control is much smoother.The one complaint I have is related to a cost-neutral design decision. The bubble level is integrated into the tripod at the top of the legs and below the pan swivel connection, rather than somewhere in the body above the tilt control. As a result, you can level the pan rotation relative to the ground, but there is no way to accurately zero the tilt elevation. The similar

Bought this cause i need a cost effective tripod to mount a small dslr on (Rebel sl1).  I am decently pleased with the quality for the price.  There are a couple nice features it has such as the level indicators.  The only thing that is keeping it from 5 stars is when i fully extend all the legs, it isn't truly level and i have to manually manipulate the leg sizes to get it to set level (I've tried on different surfaces so its not the floors). I would buy again if i needed an additional setup.

20$ and i got this?! this stand is GREAT. its light weight metal and plastic, the plastic is thick and good quality. only down side is it did not come with instructions, this is my very first tripod. after tugging loosening having pieces fall off because i loosened them all the way.. it took about 5 min to figure out and i was good to go from there!!! the camera is detachable which is awesome. the foot that goes on the bottom of the camera is "ok" it has levels, its easy to collapse and set up. no binding with the legs, and once set up its actually pretty darn stable not wobbly at all for the price i expected a bit lesser quality .im not sure what the others who reviewed bad about this expected. over all i am in love with this tripod, if it breaks. i will buy an identical one.

Excellent value for this travel ready tripod. It's well balanced, easy to use and is great with my iPhone adaptor. I've not used it for a DSLR camera, just for iPhone. I prefer heavier more pro tripods for larger, more expensive equipment. This one fits in a checked bag and is easy to transport. Overall met my expectations.

This tripod did not come with instructions.  thankfully, the operating features are basically easy to figure out.  So far it is very sturdy when setup. Very lightweight to carry in the carry case, which is a quality material.

Perfect little tripod for the price. I bought this refurbished through amazon, and the build is solid and very high quality. My only wish is that the top of the head would allow a 90 degree swivel, for shooting on table tops, desks etc. Highly recommended

I purchased a Davis & Sanford EXPLORERV Vista Explorer 60” Tripod. Thought this would be the upgraded version. The previous version lasted me 3 years. This one only lasted a couple  of trips. Parts came off easy.
Does not resist bumping the leg at all, so rope it off. Goes 60 inches which is perfect for average standing talent.  You might not want to pan with it. our touch it during recording at all.

Love my new tripod! It's made a big difference in my photography - for the price I wish I bought it years ago! It's lightweight, easy to set up and carry with me (although I typically just use it in my studio so I'm not so sure how it would hold up with a lot of heavy use outside and moving around).

Well I should have read the reviews first.  Don’t be deceived by the amount of stars this product has.  I received the item took it out of the box to inspect it and naturally the head won’t tighten down.  It’s being returned and I’m spending $10 more for a better quality one.  My recommendation is do not buy this item

I'm not a professional by any means.  I don't have a steady hand so I wanted a tri-pod so I didn't have to hold my camera for 2 hours straight.  But still wanted to be able to move around with panning in & out, from side to side, and up & down on a moments notice.  I had to do some filing on the "gears" to do so which are plastic to give me some wiggle room.  I think this is great.  I love the levels and the two jointed legs.  Fold up easy and lightweight.  Definitely would recommend.

It does what it's intended for. Know this... other than the legs, it is entirely made of plastic.I'm not bad mouthing this item because I knew this in advance. If you are even a little bit rough with it, your most likely going to break it.

I got this for myself when I got my first tripod and am now buying one for my sibling, who is now getting interested in camera stuff. It's sturdy and you don't feel horrible for dropping it a million times. It's level and stays in on place with a dslr. It doesn't allow for smooth pans but it's quite stable.

This is the second one I've purchased, because they work so well, I want to use multiple cameras at the same time.  Just be aware that they sometimes come without the shoe that fastens the camera to the tripod, and they are not standard sized bases, so not all others are compatible.  There is a hook to add a weight to keep the stand from blowing in the wind, but if you use it in a high traffic area, I suggest hanging something bright off it, to let people see where the legs are.  They can be bent very easily.  I also would like it better if the shoe would allow me to turn the camera 360 degrees without moving the stand.  For the price, you can't go wrong.

I don't use the tripod as much because I like to move around a lot with my camera, but this is perfect for when I need to get a shot really still since my hands shake just a bit.  It's easy to set up and store, very lightweight, and inexpensive for the quality.  It arrived quickly, was packaged well, and fits perfectly in the case it came with.  It's an excellent tripod for light photography use.

I purchased one of these tripods years ago. When it finally broke, I decided to buy another one just like it. It performs as expected. It is smooth, easy to operate, and lets me record from my camera from different angles. I'm not a professional photographer, but I record videos for my website and for YouTube, and this is perfect for that.

Perfect item, works and feels sturdy.  I use this tripod to hold my camera for recording video.  This tripod will look and feel as professional as other photographers/radiographers that I frequently encounter when I'm using this tripod.  The tripod is a little stiff when trying to move horizontally, so perhaps a little lubricant will improve it, but other than that, great price for this product.  Oh, and don't lose the adapter at the top like I did, its used for other mounts that you can incorporate into the tripod, such as a bracket for your phone, etc.

Excellent Very sturdy and very happy with it and for the money he feels and it works like a professional Stan are use it for my iPhone max and my Canon camera I wish I knew this before I have purchased many of them they And phone falls off..I would recommend this van to anyone especially for the price, thank you Amazon
I accidentally broke my dad's $300 dollar tripod and gifted him with this one. He loved it and it's easy to use.

I am so impressed with the quality of this tripod given how inexpensive it is. It is very quality for the price and has all the features one need for a tripod including levels to help you determine whether the ground your on and your shot are straight, plus a handle to direct the angle of the shots up or down and to catch a panorama, plus it has a good amount of height. Very light so easy to transport and very easy to set up/breakdown. It also comes with a carrying case. Extremely convenient and very content with this purchase and would highly recommend.

Evidently as shown on the pictures, this product get easily damaged. I use this tripod for vlogs and photos using a DSLR and go pro. This product is very light, and gets easily bent and snaps. My $1,200 camera almost broke because the tripod fell and snapped some of the locking mechanism.

For the price, its one of the best tripods I have seen. It has all of the adjustments you would need to accomplish a broad spectrum of photographs and video recording. It comes with a nice case and is very light and well built.  Great tripod all around. Not to mention it shipped quickly, came well packaged and undamaged, and arrived when it said it would.  Great purchase.

For the price, I was not hoping for a perfect item, and I got a much better deal than I expected. It is kinda light weight, but the adjustment of height and removable mount are perfect for a ballistic chronograph. It did fall over the last time I used it, but with 15-25 mph gusts, and two 20"+ parachutes (sun shades), I wasn't terribly surprised.

Good quality, the mechanics are great and work well it can be folded to carry out and comes with a bag , you can also adjust the height to optimize those shots , every leg comes with a lock so your camera will be safe when adjusting positions

The tripod lasted about 2 months and then the tiny bolts started coming out. The tripod lost stablization and I tried to work around it, but eventually over the next couple months the leg fell off. I liked the item but it didn’t last long, regardless of how careful we were with the tripod. Amazon basics, it’s what you get, basic, not quality.

I sent this back immediately. The weight of the tripod was great, but the product was useless.  I tried to set it up for about 30 minutes and never got it fully set up or functional. Don't purchase this product.

I got this for my daughter because she loves to make videos. She loves it because it works perfectly and isn't hard to use. She can easily attach her camera and start filming her videos. I would recommend this!

I love Amazon Basics!  As the item description states, this is a lightweight tripod that is perfect for hauling around.  The tripod comes packed in a handy carrying case that has an adjustable shoulder strap.  The case hss a zipper which unzips across the top and half way down one side to allow for easy packing/unpacking.Very good price, too!  That's what I have come to appreciate about Amazon Basics, quality product at a fair price.

Not nearly as excited about this purchase as other AmazonBasics. Tripod is too light for semi-serious DSLR user and I don't feel comfortable with my additional audio and multi battery attachments (well under 5lbs). Too much play. I tightened but there is too much play. Note to Amazon / Supplier: I think this level of tripod is too light for the multi angle pivot included in the head unit... That added to "play". I don't think I will bother returning it... I expect I will have other (lighting) uses but that was not the intent when I bought it. For now I will limp along with my existing tripod.

I ordered this stand for my wedding for my DIY photo booth, but didn’t end up using it. I missed the return frame, and when I went to pack it into storage I noticed that part of the handle on it was broken. I don’t know when that happened since I didn’t use it for the wedding. The quality isn’t the greatest, and now I have a half broken camera stand that I never used.

One of the leg broke off after light usage inside of home. I used it to hold a WYZE camera in a static position for a year or so.  It worked well for a while but found it broken today. I guess you get what you paid for...
Can't beat the price.The side swivel stays stiff even when the tightening screw is loose, so it makes it hard to fine-tune.

very very easy to use. needed it for a first time photography class. had NEVER worked one before. this one came with zero instructions but came with a case. very easy to understand, did not need instructions. superrr durable AND lightweight.

I bought this tripod to hold my smartphone instead of a camera. I have a camera lucida app on my phone to allow me to draw an image on the phone onto a canvas for painting.For the money, this tripod is very well built.  Everything on it works perfectly.

I got this hoping it would be light weight and portable. It is, but, it's to light weight. I'm sure if you anchored it down a little it would stay put. You will also have to use a remote shutter release to take a photo, any contact with the camera created a lot of shake.The build quality is ultimately the reason I choose to return the tripod. I had contemplated using this as a light stand but just wasn't impressed that it would even work in that capacity.

This thing isn't super heavy. It is light material but is solid. I have Manfrotto tripods that I use regularly, and thing little guy has some features that I wish those had. The crank center shaft is great. The handle is awesome. The little deals that secure the legs is amazing.The caps on the bottom of the legs aren't super secure, I lost one in the back of my car while in tow.

I love this tripod. It is such a durable and adjustable tripod for its price. I have bought multiples, one for myself and one for each of my friends who also have a need for a tripod. It works great with DSLRs and is perfect for your basic photography gig. I've taken many photos with this camera and it stablized well and holds the weight of my camera as well as the awkward angles I put it into. It is lightweight and easy to transport. Stores nicely in is case and is a great tripod overall.
Excellent tripod for general use.Low cost with a fairly good build quality.  Lightweight to carry around on your shoulder with the included carrying bad (includes shoulder strap).

I love how lightweight this stand is. Plus, I love that I can adjust the height easily. The only down parts are that it does need to be weighed down when I adjust the angle of my camera; the two separate handles can get in the way of each other; and the carry-on bag is slightly smaller than the stand itself.
I am pleasantly surprised by this tripod!PROS:

Very light and easy to operate. All the parts fit snugly with no wobble. The tripod stands sturdy and comes with leveling tools. The metal parts make scraping noises, but a little bit of lubrication for the adjustable crank makes it nice and quiet. Easily accessible and secure mount point for camera.This thing will probably last me forever, so I may not have an opportunity to buy again. Highly recommended.
Broken on Arrival. the tilting mechanism knob/metal rod slides out of the tripod which dropped my camera.

Ordered this after buying a camera package that already included a tripod. The one that came in the bundle was garbage. Very happy I bought a new one. The material is very strong and durable. Adjusting the height of the tripod is also very easy. Has a good weight and feel to it.
It's a great stand, levels on both the legs and top of this camera stand so you can tell when the camera is centered and tilt the camera however you would like.

I used this about a year and a half. I carried it everywhere strapped to my camera bag, so it was getting picked up and set down and tossed into the backseat of my car frequently, but wasn't abused. It worked fairly well during this period. The panning action isn't smooth, but it's reasonably stable and held my camera (a relatively small NEX-5R for most of that period) well for long exposures and video. Eventually, though, one of the little pins that hold the stabilizers to the legs broke and that was the end of its useful life. It's decent as a beginner's tripod and lets you move and position the camera how you like, but don't expect to get heavy use out of it.

Used it only for street shooting with nice weather, 2 times before for some reason one of the legs fell out and couldn't fix it. Literally lasted for around 3 hours before it became useless, and i still have no idea how that happened

Very affordable and high quality Tripod, my only complaint is really a generalized complaint regarding all lightweight tripods: stability. The little feet on the bottom are really nice for promoting stability on uneven ground though! Extremely lightweight, above average quality for its weight!

I have never even seen one before when I ordered this.  It is very stable, made well, and functionable.  THERE ARE NO INSTRUCTIONS FOR USAGE.  If you have never used one, get help.  I watched a YouTube video from a YouTuber, but it was inadequate.

But mine arrived with one rivet missing from the leg stabilizer, and I didn't discover that until the return period was over. Managed to find a long, tiny screw that would fit.Check it over carefully as soon as you receive it.

The tripod is great for the value but there is just one issue. The plastic knob that tightens the head where the camera goes, yeah that is enough to say this product is garbage. I’ve ordered a replacement but reading the other reviews it seems that it’s common for the head knob to be garbage. Really hoping the replacement doesn’t have the same issue, if so, I’ll most likely refund and look for a better product that will assure me that my camera isn’t gonna just tilt forward or back because of a stupid plastic knob that can’t do its job.

Too long to hang from a backpack when collapsed, too short when expanded for me (I'm 6'2) to comfortably use. It's flimsy and not really stable, and it takes too long to raise the top. Pay ~$200 and get a MeFoto aluminum Globetrotter if you have any intention of doing photography which requires a tripod (long exposure landscape or woodland photography).
Don’t risk expensive gear on this tripod. Plastic part broke with minimal use and manipulation.

This is not a very good tripod.  Its cheaply made, almost too lightweight, and is made with a ton of plastic that is just waiting to break.  That being said, I bought this as a support for a time lapse rail, and for that purpose, it works.  But I would not purchase this expecting to use it for hobby or serious photography.  Spend just a little bit more (in the $30-$50 range) and get something that is so much better and will last much longer.  I have $50 tripods from 10 years ago that are still in great shape and get tons of use today.  If your buying this as a "throw away" that is its intended use.

I’ve only used this briefly. It seems pretty cheaply built with lots of thin plastic.It works and holds the camera well, but I wouldn’t want to “bang” around with it to much. I suspect it will not hold up well.

I got 18 of these to do a camera array. Great for small cameras. Would not use as a professional tripod or with a large DLSR. Your average Canon or Nikon DLSR would be perfect, but a telephoto, battery pack, and flash might be too heavy for the plastic components. Surprisingly very durable... except for gear hook in middle.

I've had this tripod for a while now, I wouldn't recommend it for anything other than still shots. If you need it to pan the camera or tilt it for a video save your money or spend a few extra dollars on a better tripod. The handles loosen up properly so you may tilt or pan but they sort of jam when you do need that motion. Pretty much jerks or hesitates before actually making the motion.

If you're a beginner photographer, then this is the perfect tripod.  I'm learning about how to manipulate photos using the aperture and shutter speed settings.  I needed a way to keep the camera perfectly still.  This does the job, and it's really easy to use.Pros:

This is the second tripod I've ever owned (first one was a kodak brand) so I don't have much to compare it to but I am happy with my purchase. Right out of the box it felt sturdier and bigger than my kodak one. The bag is better (thick black canvas material with zipper, as opposed to my kodak one which was a thin draw-string one that ripped quickly and didn't close all the way). I love the handle that is attached; it's so easy to pick up and re-position. I also like that it's level! With my kodak one, I had to keep one of the legs significantly longer so it would be properly leveled. I have no issues with this stand.

So I've only ever owned a couple of tripods in my life but this thing gives you so many options. I found myself saying wow as I discovered all the different gadgets. For the price of $25 this can't be beat!
The lever broke after only a few months.  This is mostly very cheaply made plastic garbage. You get what you pay for.

For under $25 bucks....amazing.  For still photos this tripod is all you need.  Why would you need more?  But if you are taking video and doing pans this is obviously not the best option, lol.  I was using it for this and it was fairly jerky and was not smooth.  I'm sure the more I use it the more it would loosen up and become smoother, but I'd rather just spend more $ and get a better tripod.  However, for still photo's this is great!!  Reallygood value.

Bought this tripod in Aug '15, by first week of Jan '16, one of the lower leg extensions no longer functioned. Tripod saw moderate use - approx once, maybe twice a week, so I can't call fair wear and tear. One of the plastic guides inside one of the legs gave out and the lower extension no longer functions. My repair efforts have been unsuccessful.My only other concern is that panning is NOT very smooth, but for the price, it may be understandable? Not sure.

This is my first camera tripod, and I found it very easy to use, without looking at any instruction manuals.  It has a little plate that screws in at the bottom of your camera, and this little plate easily comes on and off the tripod.  When you have your camera attached to the plate and locked in placed on the tripod, then you can use the levels and swivel things on the tripod to point the camera up or down or rotate it side to side.  You can take pictures in horizontal / landscape orientation (normal) or vertical / portrait orientation.  There are a couple of levels built into the camera for checking to see if you have the tripod set up level.

The legs eventually locked out and wouldn’t go back in. Doesn’t hold heavy camera bodies well. Starts to tilt easily with the weight. Good for a cheap tripod that will eventually fall apart but not a long term investment.

I've ordered two Amazon Basics items, a remote for my dslr and this tripod, and I have been impressed with the quality of the items so far. I've seen reviews saying how it feels cheaply made and isn't very sturdy but I haven't had that experience at all. Is this a heavy pro tripod? No, but for the average person this is a great tripod. It's lightweight but well-built. When shooting outside with slow shutter speeds and with the legs fully extended I got some blur, but other than that I have no complaints whatsoever. The thing that really surprised me was how many features this has compared to similarly priced tripods.It isn't perfect but it's well-worth the price.

While this isn't the lightest tripod it does seem sturdy enough for any task.  (I use mine for hunting.)  The price is certainly better than many others.  Especially for all the features it has.  I like it.

I will say this tripod is one of the best I’ve tried hands down. Compared to a more expensive one it doesn’t feel maybe as premium as other tripods but it has all the basic features of a tripod that works well. Plus, the screw to hold your camera doesn’t even require a screwdriver! All you have to do is flip up the handle on it and screw it with your fingers! It’s a very simple and well built tripod. I like it!

We purchased this to use with a scope for a trip to Yellowstone. I loved the easy set up. It worked great. Just wish it was a bit sturdier but that was only a problem on a super windy day. This made animal watching great. We would set it up and everyone could look since height is adjustable.
Sorry all plastic construction. Might be all right for lightweight 4/3  but not for full-size cameras. Head cracked so I  threw it away.

Sturdy, easy to use and super portable. I use with some big binoculars foe stargazing so a sturdy tripod is a must and this delivers.moving using the handle is smooth with adjustments. cant comment yet on durability but it seems well enough made that it should last.

Lightweight, easy to use, and comes with a perfect carrying case. I do a lot of video and photography by myself and this helps me set up and take down very quickly. The bag has a nice strap that makes travel extra convenient.

It was relatively functional while it lasted. To begin with, the pivot was a bit stiff. It was really awkward having to muscle and wrangle this tripod with my clients looking on waiting for me to start snapping photos. Then, about 4-5 photo shoots in, the ring around the center column fell out and I can no longer collapse this tripod. Bummer, but I guess that's to be expected for the price.

I should have done more research on this tripod. I based my purchase on the reviews I read for this item. Well, It was delivered on time and I was happy to come home and see a package waiting for me. So I opened the box and got the tripod out of the little carrying pouch that came with. The first impression I had was "you get what u pay for". It felt very flimsy. It did not come with manual either.The little lever that locks the plate on the DSLR did not feel sturdy. I moved it couple of times and the little spring that was under it started to come out.I think I will be sending it back to purchase another more reliable tripod.

This is a great beginner's tripod especially if you don't want to spend big bucks. I love how lightweight and stable it is with the range of heights. My only issue is that when I try turning it I notice sometimes it gets stuck. Maybe I just need to add something to help lubricate it so it turns more easily. Other than that, highly recommend it!

This is going to be fun to use with the cell phone to make videos for my computer tutoring business.  It was very easy to set up with the collapsible legs to adjust to any height needed to get a good film shot.  I would have liked directions with photos that demonstrates how the adapter fits on top.  (It took a little playing around with it, but I did figure it out.)  Also, a round rubber ring fell out of the package that was broken.  I do NOT know where it belongs on the tripod. With no directions, I do not know if it is important.  (How does one go about getting directions for the tripod and finding out what the little rubber ring [about 1 1/4 inch] is to be used for?)Otherwise, it is going to be fun to use all the three tools for making videos!  Thanks a LOT!!

Prior to purchasing, read a lot of the reviews. Both good and bad. This tri-pod is no wear near bad. Haven’t had the opportunity to really give it a good work out. But, with what I need it for as well as most folks do it’s a great product.

I fell in love with this tripod.  First of all it’s so light and that’s perfect for someone like me who is always on the go!  It fits in my suitcase and doesn’t add too much extra weight.  I like the functions of it and the way in which rotating a camera from crosswise to lengthwise is super easy.  Hands down the best tripod I’ve owned!

A great tripod with perks I would expect on more expensive models. Great height. Sturdy and stable. Adjustable in all the ways you would need. The 2 bubble view levels on the head AND body are very helpful and a nice touch. Again, great choice for functionality and price! Definitely recommended!

I am a fan of Amazon Basics products but coming from a higher-end tripod, I understood why this one is priced so well. I use(d) this several times per week for real estate photography... never thrown around. It has been less than a year and one of the clamps cracked this morning while making a simple adjustment. While this was a great buy, I feel like it should have last longer than this. There doesn't appear to be any kind of support/warranty at this point so I will be purchasing another brand that will hopefully last longer.

This tripod provide you with about everything you'll need, unless you're trying to peer over an 8 ft. fence or need micrometer adjustments (a feature you can buy separately) Good value for the money if not something you're planning to use 24/7 in the most primitive of surroundings.

I needed a tripod to record video on but this tripod was super tight causing my video to have abrasive movement when following my subjects. If you’re using this for still shots, this is a pretty good tripod for the price. But I’d rather get one that will do all the jobs.

I was a little hesitant when looking at Amazon basics tripods but after it arrived I was amazed at the weight, ease of use and overall quality.I would suggest a larger tripod for more stable set shooting but for light on the go, you cant beat this price.
Works perfectly. I wanted to start a youtube channel and actually start doingvideos for myself to spread information. I am using a cell phone.

It's a nice tripod, it has a level and everything you'd want in a tripod, but the one thing I'd say is that when you raise or lower the tripod it slips sometimes by a couple centimeters. This might not matter for you, but for some people if you need something to be perfectly in frame, slipping just a couple of centimeters could cut off part of the "intended" top of whatever photo you're trying to take. You learn to work with it eventually, but it would've been nice if there was no slip whatsoever.

Although it's super light. it does not come across as flimsy, which was a pleasant surprise for me, but I mount a GoPro to it, not a heavy camera. I bought it to shoot videos of our life moments, around the house or outdoors and it's just perfect for this use.I'm a tall guy and its height is sufficient for me to operate comfortably. I would recommend this to a friend.

This is a great tripod for my purposes. I carry it while hiking. It's small enough to latch to my backpack and light enough so as to not notice any extra weight while hiking. In my opinion, for whatever purpose you feel you need a tripod, to have anything more expensive than this model. It is well constructed and holds the camera weight well. A sandbag can be attached at the bottom if you think you need more stability, but I have never found the need to do so. I highly recommend this product.

This is the perfect little tripod.  Not too heavy yet sturdy enough for my use.I bought it to use with my older Sony a500 DSLR.  The tripod mount has a pin near the screw to ensure the camera doesn't unintentionally swivel which is perfect for those cameras that have a corresponding hole; which my camera does not.  For me it's still equally perfect as that pin is spring loaded and easily slides out of the way if you don't need it.  Additionally, there are 2 levels built into the tripod; one on the mount and one on the front of the tripod so you can set up to get those level shots on uneven surfaces.  The pole the camera mount attaches to is different as you extend or retract it via a hand crank.  I initially thought this odd but it's actually quite handy since it means you can easily make even the slightest of height adjustments.

I recently bought a Canon DSLR, and I knew that I would need a tripod. I decided to try something from Amazon and I went ahead and purchased this basic, as stated, tripod. It could be more sturdy than it is, but I like that it has a nice range of features to where you can position your camera when you want it. It's very light and pretty portable and it comes with a cheap, but usable carrying bag to store your tripod in. For a economically-priced item, it does it's job of molding down your camera and accommodating your height with it's up to 60-inch height.

I was a bit disapppinted because I've never even taken this outside of my home..by the second or third use  the stopper on one of the  legs broke and now the tripod is always crooked. I shouldve spent the extra money and got a better one.

For the price, this is an excellent tripod that works perfectly. I wanted something simple that would be easy to set up and dissemble for taking pictures with the family. No longer are we taking selfies, instead I quickly set up the tripod and set the timer on my camera. It takes less than a minute to set up the tripod out of the bag and it seems very sturdy even without adding any weight to it. I also really like that the top adjusts so that I can go from horizontal shots to vertical shots easily.I'm completely satisfied and would highly recommend this product.

I took this item on a trip to the Arctic Circle. My main goal was photographing the aurora borealis. I was able to set my shutter speed to 8 to 10 seconds and capture some of the most beautiful photography I’ve ever done. Thank you for this tripod.

I was surprised by the quality of this tripod when I opened the box.It’s rally well made, very light, easy to adjust and level. The quick release sled is great for popping the camera on and off. The built in levels help get everything straight before shooting.
Good basic tripod for a small lightweight camera. It’s quite stable unless you extend the legs all the way. I wouldn’t use it for panning but it’s a good, basic, travel tripod. Great value for money.

Even though this was my first tripod (I just never required one before) this seems to be high quality,sturdy build,multi-adjustable and has some of the features not found on other tripods (quick release plate,level bubbles,tilt,rotate etc) My entire purpose for this tripod was to place my webcam on it to get more of a clear view during youtube videos and live streams.I think this may be the last tripod I ever purchase and will do a great job meeting my expectations and demands.Feel free to ask me anything and I will do my very best to answer.

Great little tripod. I have about 5.5 lbs on it and it seems to be holding good. My complaints are small. It can be hard to get everything level while having the device on it. I also find some of the adjustments are kinda difficult to get exactly right. being my first time with a tripod, I kinda figure they all probably suffer similar issues.

Having used much bigger and far more expensive tripods, both for school and the TV station I work at, this did take some getting used to with how the different joints loosen and tighten so achieve a smooth pan/tilt, but once you've got it down it holds up pretty well. Very light weight makes it great for mobile shoots (I used it for a small local concert and was able to easily move from spot to spot to get good shots). The handle built into the center bar helps when moving so you're not worried about dropping it, and the hook on the bottom can be used to hang a bit of extra weight for stability.

Great Tripod and no major complaints.  The only one complaint is that you have to put some Vaseline or other lubricant in the camera where it gets connected to the tripod because the base from tripod will get suck. Eventually I was able to detach two pieces. What I have learnt from internet is that this is pretty common and has nothing to do with this tripod directly.

I looked around for a quality, but inexpensive, tripod for my camera.  I didn't even know before this that Amazon makes items itself.  Let me tell you: I have not been disappointed!  It works as well, if not better, than more expensive tripods that some of my friends use.  It's sturdy, yet lightweight, portable, and very easy to use.  It came with a quality carry bag as well that makes travelling even easier.  I'm very happy with this purchase and will buy AmazonBasics items in the future.

This tripod is a decent and budget friendly tripod for those who don't want to commit to something more expensive unless required.  It's easy to use although I would have appreciated some kind of manual to explain how to mount the camera.
