I managed to find instructions via online information/videos found elsewhere and also comments by the community on Amazon.  So far, very sturdy for a DSLR although I have heard it may not be stable enough to take good videos.  For the price I'm pleased.  I probably don't need anything more elaborate at this point in time.

I got to use this only once on a hiking trip and it half itself together in spite of the cheap plastic joints, which do not complement the aluminium legs. The tilt screw broke off eventually because of the cheap plastic. I would not suggest putting anything with a real lens on this tripod stand.
Hey, you pay 25 bucks for a tripod, you get a 25 dollar tripod. Don't expect much. Attempting to rotate the head in precision amounts simply won't happen. It just jerks its way through the movement.

This has got to be the most outstanding purchase i've made on amazon. The design quality for the price point will scare you. Easily the best product out there for an entry-level photographer. There is a small, lightweight base that can be fixed to the camera bottom and this can simply be plugged into the tripod with ease and securely attached. There is a level indicator, a sleek tripod holder for easy grasping with hand and most importantly smooth adjustment of height.

By far a underrated tripod. I've worked with three before this one that were "top of the line" and honestly I like this one the best. The price is amazing, quality is great, bag hook is crazy helpful and those levels? I never thought I needed them till I got this tripod! I highly recommend this tripod for anyone from starting level on up, I think it would make a great gift and plus it comes with a bag for it so that just makes things perfect!

This is one of those cases where sometimes you actually get something better than what you pay for. Although this is not a high-end professional tripod, which you could spend $300.00 or more, for less than $25.00 it compares favorably and is in fact quite similar to a tripod I bought for $100.00 almost 20 years ago.

Wow -- decent quality! At this price, I don't think there's any reason to complain about anything on this tripod. It definitely does the job (mounting a little projector) for me. UPDATE: At five years of use, this thing is still going strong. It has served well for intermittent use now over many years. If you're a professional and plan to use it daily, I wouldn't count on it lasting for a decade (you weren't really hoping for industrial-strength quality at this price, were you?). However, for personal use, it has been more than satisfactory. I just purchased a second one for light use at work.

This is a great product and completely worth every penny. I'm taking a photography class and this has helped my photographs a bunch. The adjustable legs make taking outdoor photos on uneven or hills a breeze. If I needed another one I'd definitely purchase this again. The shoulder bag takes the portability of the tripod to another level.

I just walked out the door and about to go inside saw this on the porch. I had been here all day and there was no knock. I thought everything was coming tomorrow. The tripod is huge and well built. I had not imagined it would be this big but that is a plus where I go to take video- the rivers. I love it. Now just need the camera and then will get some good shots of the places I love.

This is a really good value. It's super light, extends very tall, comes with a carrying sack, and has a bubble level. It also features a quick release/install configuration which may or may not be desirable for all uses. You simply screw in a tapered square flat plastic "foot" into your camera bottom, and then you simply drop the camera/base into the tripod and twist the locking lever to secure. Twist again to release. It seems good for full sized cameras or medium camcorders, but might be more inconvenient for compact/travel cameras, where you probably wouldn't want to attach a 2+ inch square foot to your tiny camera. The unit also doesn't seem to be a fluid head, so movement is a little bit "stuttering". For the price, it's a good buy.

This tripod has ever bell and whistles you can imagine. The only downsize was the carrying case it came in ripped the first time I went to use it. I don't really need a carrying case for my tripod so i didn't really care.

My other tripod broke within like a year. I've had this for 3 years and it's worked so well for me. Very easy to use, AND easy to do a flat lay without rigs etc if you're into that type of photography. Literally no complaints.
The tripod works very well with my-Adjustable legs slide smoothly and locks nicely in place.

This tripod is okay for still pictures and it seems relatively sturdy for the still cameras.  However, I purchased this for videoing sports events and it is not acceptable for that.  the pan and elevation is too stiff.  It is not fluid at all and has not loosened up over several events.  It is so stiff that you have to use your hand to hold the tripod to pan the video camera and the picture is still jerky/shaky.  Not recommended for videos unless you want real in expensive and do not pan or elevate the shot much.

Wow, was not expecting all of this for the low price I paid. This was a gift for my brother but damn I’m thinking about buying one for myself too just to have around for whatever occasions arise. Amazing!

I am an amateur photographer who is interested in getting more into photography with my new camera.  I bought the tripod for future vacations where I might need this.  It seems very sturdy and well built to me.  For the price, I definitely think that it surpasses expectations.

Technically this is my first tripod and idk why I didn’t buy this sooner! It’s tall and sturdy. I’m actually glad I didn’t buy a $100 plus one off the bat because this thing does everything an expensive one will. You definitely get a lot of tripod for the price and I received it in a couple days. If you’re looking for a tripod and don’t care about brand names, buy this tripod!

I was thrilled with this purchase.  I'm am a pre-teacher with many rowdy students.  We were experimenting with "green screen" technology.  I didn't want to spend big bucks on a tripod that many or may not be destroyed by my students.  I also did not want to buy something of poor quality and risk my iPad (used for video recording) being damaged.  This was a great compromise.  The tripod is very sturdy and I felt comfortable attaching my iPad.  The pride is extremely reasonable!  I have recommended to other teachers!

It should be Amazon junk not Amazon basics. Broke the second time I use. I wonder where Amazon produces these own brand products. Pay a few extra dollars more and buy yourself a sturdy brand that's worth every penny. The ESDDI products (lights, tripods) are sturdy and never let me down.

I ordered several of these to use at our church for our broadcast system that uses iphones.  They've worked great.  The only prblem that I've encountered is in one area, with the tripod fully extended in height, the music makes the iphone slightly move.  Lowering the top section a little fixed that problem.Highly recommend.

Look, this thing is certainly not a $300 tripod.  But damned if this tripod doesn't perform and feel like a $100 tripod.  I bought these for my equally cheap Skymaster binoculars and the tripod did the trick.  It holds the heavy Skymasters pretty well (but I don't think the tripod could handle much more weight.)  For the price you cannot beat this tripod.

When I opened the package I didn't realize that the liquid that is supposed to tell you that the camera is level or not, was missing. Now, however, I needed to use it and I have to use an app on my phone to level the top base... disappointed, to say the least. The vial looks like it was glued in place empty like someone didn't look at it before he or she did their job!!! I love the tripod as it works and is not heavy to lug around, plus it looks great and gets the height I need for the job I bought it for.
Perfect budget tripod.It has a bubble level which is really helpful.

This tripod provides everything you need in a basic tripod. The attachment point is solid, not wobbly, you get a great range of height and it is quick to set up and take down. The telescoping legs have a quick snap lever to lock/unlock them. The quick-release mount is stable and doesn't wobble like on some cheap tripods. The tripod is light but has a hook if you need to put a weight on the bottom.It's good for having around the house or studio, or for leaving in your car for unplanned shooting opportunities. This is *not* a tripod you would want to take backpacking - it's light enough but a tad too bulky (collapsed length and width).

It didn't come with instructions so configuring it took some trial and error which could've resulted in me breaking it but luckily did not. Other than that, the item was affordable and worth the money.

I didn't need something expensive - just something that works to take some photos and videos with my iPhone. This tripod is lightweight, easy to set up and take down, and comes with a decent carrying bag. Very pleased.

The tripod was good for two years except for the unfixable slant the mount creates and the tilt knob no longer being able to keep the camera still; the knob just constantly goes around without tightening the camera’s tilt.

For the price, this is a darn good tripod. I'm not a professional photographer, but I have had tripods before and this thing has many more features than the last one I had, for far less cash. It has pan, tilt, and the shoe can be set vertical or horizontal. There's also a crank to raise and lower the mount, it's a decent mechanism. I'm pleasantly surprised at this tripod's utility.

This is an excellent tripod for the price, I paid about $25. No it’s not the greatest tripod on earth, and it may not last that long, but certainly a very certain serviceable unit and better than many inexpensive tripods that I’ve tried. Recommend !

I love this! It’s such a great Tripp’s for an even better price! Seriously you can’t go wrong with it! I’ve used it with my canon camera and iPad Pro 13 inch. It supported both very easily and hassle free!

For the price, it can't be beat. If you're using it for something heavy, you'd probably want to spend more. I'm using it for a Pentax DSLR camera. I'm not using lenses that are too big. I did some night shots of the sky/forest and they turned out great.

I'm only using to support a phone camera but the tripod is shaky when tiuching the camera to activate the shutter. I've started using the timer to give the movement time to stop. It does its j ob in every other way.

I recently received so my comments are really on an initial feel and some brief use functionality.  I like the fact the tripod is light and I can use it for all three of my cameras. I wish it was smoother for easier panning and adjusting to changing view.  That being said it is an annoyance but not one that will stop me from enjoying and using the tripod.
pulled one of the legs out one day and it pulled all the way out. like it's not connected anymore lol.used it like 10 times tops. was not hard on it.
I wasn't expecting this to be a fancy tripod - I own several of varying quality, but I DID expect this to last for more than 3 uses before one of the leg latches broke, rendering the tripod unusable.
We bought this to be able to take pictures with our camera for the holidays with the family.The good:
Has tons of scratches on this.. some deep..However, after playing with it.. I figured out how to work everything! & all is good!

I purchased a different tripod from Amazon and it worked but wasn't very sturdy.  This  one works great and I feel it will hold my iPad and I don't worry about it falling over.  It is a little heavier than the other not really not bad.

Fairly solid (though a little wobbly if you're really trying to shimmy it) and lightweight camera tripod as described. Two levels built into it, one for the legs, one for the camera base. The camera base is a quick disconnect which is nice to flip a lever and disconnect the camera. The feet are a ball joint fashion allowing it to adjust nicely to any uneven terrain you place it on. Levers for the leg height are quick and easy to adjust. Operation is very simple and allows for a solid station to take pictures with.

I really like this tripod. I don't know I waited so long to buy one. It is very easy to use but didn't come with any instructions. It's really self explanatory but if you're not certain of anything just take your time and you can get it. There are so many things I didn't even try on the camera until I got the tripod. It made me want to learn more about my camera other then just taking your standard photo. The price is great too though that wasn't my only consideration for buying it. It came with a nice storage bag so you can keep it clean nd carry it easily. You can carry the tripod with the camera attached to it too. It has a handle that makes it very convienent. I highly recommend this product. Thank you Amazon!

This is a great deal. I bought it on the chance that it would work out and I’ve been really happy with this tripod. I have celestron binoculars and this allows me to raise and lower the height with a little crank on the tripod.  A lever with a handle you can twist allows me to easily adjust the tilt of the binoculars. This purchase has vastly improved my stargazing!

I wanted to like this so I can shoot videos- first of all is hard to ply to get your phone to set in- then I was using it and the wind blew it down together with my phone - shattered my phone and the stand! Complete disaster-

I purchased this based on the reviews and thought it would be great for filming church services, upon arrival everything seemed fine, until I added my camera and one of the legs wouldn't stay out, it constantly slides back down even with the latch closed. I figured that was not going to be that big of a deal until this last week it completely collapsed throwing my camera to the ground during services. Now the latch that controls the head of tripod is broken. This sucks I would have just purchased the Raevelli tripod that I KNOW WORKS FOR SURE!
This is an great product for beginner vloggers, photographers or just an person who wants an hands free video and/or taking pictures experience.Pro:

I can’t really say a thing about sturdiness yet because fall football season hasn’t started yet, but so far I am impressed by this Tripod. I have had a few that broke within a week so for the price I paid I do like this a lot.

I use this Amazon Basics tripod for shooting my board game reviews for your youtube channel.  I have two Canon Rebel cameras, and each came with their own lightweight tripod.  I've used one of them for over a year and a half, but it finally fell apart on me.  I went ahead and purchased this tripod as I've been pleased with Amazon Basics products before.  I wasn't disappointed.  In fact, this tripod is far superior to the two tripods that came with my cameras.  It is a bit heavier, but it is also a bit sturdier- I like that.  Easy to use and manipulate, this Amazon Basics tripod is everything I hoped for.
Used it for a week and the top tightening clip stripped and you cant replace it. Very disappointing

A decent tripod. One of two tripods I have setup to hold cameras for the Oculus Rift. The two features I felt were missing from this product was an inability to lock the legs at set intervals of open. The other was that the feet did not have retractable spikes to hold it more steady.For the price though the product accomplishes what I needed it to. For someone who is really into photography they might want to spend a little more for a better one.

I ordered a second “sturdier” model after the first one I ordered broke for what i thought was no reason and i was right because the second model ARRIVED broken. Fooled me twice. I wont be reordering.

Love this product!! It’s fantastic. The first one I ordered came broken, but I didn’t realize it was missing the piece until 2 months after I had it. I contacted customer service and they sent me a new one in 3 days! It’s perfect! It works great!! Thanks to the customer service for making it so simple and easy to get another one. :)

This is a very compact and very sturdy tripod. Don't let anyone tell you differently. I set it up in Bakersfield on windy days and it doesn't tip over. Very strong footprint. I wouldn't buy anything else if you're looking for a tripod.

Not pleased.Reason:  The handle for camera adjustment came apart while taking it out of the box.  Nonetheless I set the tripod up and the legs and fasteners were durable enough for light use.  I would not purchase this tripod if you were a professional photographer, there are much better, higher quality and craftsmanship ones out there.

The features of this unit make it possibly the best entry-level tripod I've seen. It's quite inexpensive, yet has features not found on many much costlier pods. For example, there is a nice carry handle built into the unit (plus a bag with a carry strap). The quick set and release snaps make setup fast. Leveling bubbles and a weight hook complete the offerings. The tradeoff is that the tolerances are fairly liberal, so that the crank raises a somewhat wobbly central mount. And don't expect a liquid head, controlled resistance mount that will let you pan smoothly. Better set the camera in the position you want and then don't move it until you are through shooting. In short: attractive design, attractive price, functional basic tripod for camcorders and cameras.

Love this product and all the adjustable pieces. It’s compact for travel. I can’t wait to take it out into the mountains! I was going to get the gorilla tripod but after seeing a lot of reviews where the joints come off it scared me out of the purchase! Why would you ever put your valuable camera at risk? I’m glad I went with this for my final choice.

I just love this tripod, it's so versatile and feature packed plus at a price that was, I thought, too good to be true.  I wasn't really expecting much for  $23 bucks, but boy was I wrong and I couldn't be happier.  Now I'm not a professional photographer so I won't be using all the features, and while I've certainly seen tripods that are better/more sturdily built, they come at a cost of 5-10 times as much as this little gem.  So while it's possible this might not stand up to the rigors that say a professional nature photographer might put this through (I could be wrong), for the rest of us hobbyist shutterbugs, this is certainly ideal and easy on the pocket book ;?D

Well this is probably the best budget tripod out there.  For a little over $20 it works great, it’s sturdy, and definitely does what a tripod is supposed to do.  I’m just starting out as a photographer hobbyist so I couldn’t justify spending a lot on a tripod just yet.

I ordered this based on price and trust everything I've gotten from Amazon. This is super easy to use and figure out. It did not come with an instruction manual nor did it need one. I can't wait to use this at my events with my Canon point and shoot camera! The price is right.

For $23.49, you will never find a better tripod. Comes with two sets of bubble-levels to ensure your camera is on straight. Quick-release works great. Mounting plate was a bit of a pain to screw into the bottom of my Canon Rebel XSi, but it attaches great. The five sets of adjustment knobs will take a bit of getting used to, but they lock the camera tightly into position.Lightweight with a handy-dandy carrying handle and a fairly-sturdy carrying case. Telescopic legs are the best! This is my first tripod and I'm very happy with it. I wouldn't trust this tripod to carry my camera, but that's not a big deal.

I really liked this tripod for the price until I realized that the side handle lever is on the right side, along with the hand strap, record button and zoom button on the camcorder that I use to tape football games.  For me, it is totally useless on the right.  To make it worse, it sticks straight out to the side, getting in the way of my hand and arm while I am recording and zooming.  My last one had the handle on the left.  The tripod itself is well constructed for what I paid for it, but I wish that I had paid more attention to this feature on the picture before buying.  There is no way to switch the handle to the left side either.  I would send this back if I hadn't tossed the box.

The Amazon Basics products have such a great quality and price, I am thinking why buying anything else branded and pricy if this works just great!!I am very satisfied with my tripod and using it a lot.Comes with a zippered carrying case. The weight is super light, can be taken to long hikes/camping. I have Canon 550D and the tripod works great with it.

This tripod was better than I expected. Allows you to angle a camera in every useful angle I could think of and is very easy to use.  As my first tripod, I didn't expect that there were so many ways of turning and locking certain parts of it to get those angles but they are all very easy to use and figure out.  And it is very good quality.  For the price you certainly can't beat it.  I think this would suit most people's needs.

I bought this item to use with some large binoculars for whale watching in HI.  They are light weight and I'd avoid any use other than careful.  I don't think they will take any abuse.  But they carry heavy binoculars reasonably well.  For the price and the free shipping to Hawaii I didn't want to spend more on anything better and I suspect it will do well for the gentle use I have for it.  With these restrictions I would buy again.

Great tripod! Perfect for personal use. I use mine constantly, video and digital still cameras! Has a level bubble, handle and a hook for the carrying bag (I've hung a small weight from it in windy situations). Great for the price.
this product worked well with my Nikon, until it didn't. the leg straps no longer strap and is insecure at every moment now. product is cheap and will not last.

I'm happy I checked Amazon for this, it is a lot better quality than I was expecting and it worked out perfect for my photoshoot. The adjustments can kind of be confusing. you just have to play around with it a bit but everything should work perfectly, and if you're using it right it should hold up the camera just fine

This is my first tripod and I think its great for the price I was able to get it at. Its very versatile and light weight. I love how easy it is to put together and use. There are only two things I wish I could change about the tripod, the fact that the top handle part does not come off and convert to a hand held tripod and that when I place my long distance lens on the camera the steadiness of the tripod is low and does not stay like I need it to. For now this will work.

You get what you pay for. This is a decent enough tripod for the price but it doesn't have the smoothest operation, it results in clumsy jerky camera movements. I wouldn't use this much for live video and it has basically inspired me to eventually get a much better tripod. I'm happy to have it now, but 'basic' is definitely honest advertising. I appreciate the built in levels, and though I haven't used the hook yet that is also good to have since the tripod itself isn't too heavy. I would definitely tie it down before letting my hands off the camera in any sort of wind. I think this may be a good tripod for someone that mostly uses it indoors and with photos, not video.

Excellent camera stand.  My son loves making movies with his camcorder and always has it propped on shelves or books- this works great and is super durable.  Has alot of versatility for angels and height.

My second purchase, the first one broke in my suitcase, lightweight and works well, I especially like the carrier bag, not high quality, but doable for a lightweight inexpensive camera, it’s not that sturdy, but will stand on its own, with no problem and no bumping

This is my favorite piece of equipment! I use this stand for my iPhone when I’m filming my yoga sessions & it works beautifully. I don’t go anywhere without it. I love how the legs are adjustable so I can make this stand very tall or very short.

This tripod saved my life.I was photographing a waterfall on a ledge about 20' up. I was wearing proper shoes and was pretty sure i was safe. I was about to snap the photo i slipped and and started to fall. The tripods leg ended up getting caught on some roots and I managed to get myself back up. I would of fallen into some rock and water. In that process the tripod was destroyed beyond repair, and all I had was some bumps and scrapes. I haven't gotten a tripod since. But I do recommend this one. It was sturdy when it lasted. I am just now really getting back into my photography more. So I'm on the look out for a premium tripod, like a Manfrotto.

this product is great! Great price and super light, handy and does its job!adjustable height is great, love that i can set it up in a tight corner and adjust one of the legs to be shorter than the other.

Over the years I've had many tripods (photography has been a hobby for over 50 years) this one is light weight - yet sturdy. Easy to extend the legs - yet they stay extended with out trouble. And in the past I've spent way more money for way less tripod.  And the carrying case is a welcome plus.

I am basically a cheapskate and have had other 'cheap' tripods that all have fallen apart usually sooner than later as I use it to film games for my teams.  All get hit at times and knocked over but this one has out performed all the other 'broken' ones by ten fold.  Can't believe this is priced this low and yet still a super quality tripod.  More than pleased with my purchase!

I used this item to stream my wedding ceremony live to a Facebook group for family and friends who were unable to attend. This tripod is awesome. It's lightweight, has 2 levels so you can make sure you're stable, has two adjustment levels on the legs alone, plus then the neck also goes up further, and can rotate/swivel. This exceeded my expectations, and for such a low cost, you can't beat it! I would recommend getting a cellphone adapter, which I also used since I was streaming from my Galaxy S7 Edge.

This tripod was everything I needed for corporate headshots. And for such a great price as well! The best part is that I can raise the head up more than any other tripod I've worked with in the past. This works great for me since I'm so short compared to the grown men whose headshots I'm taking. I am using a Nikon D5500 camera model with it, so I can tilt the display screen down and perfectly view the image preview without standing on a stool.

Good lightweight product with decent quality. Not the best tripod for video shoots, but good for still pictures. Because it's lightweight it doesn't feel super durable and a trip to the beach didn't do it any favors. But overall a good tripod for a good price.

This tripod broke on me after a few times of use... too bad the replacement window is closed now. I should’ve mentioned it earlier! Do not recommend. Spend a little more for a product that actually lasts. This thing is cheap.

I was looking for something that would be well made, relatively inexpensive and functional.  You know, the kind of product that s/b easy to find but actually is not!  This is, IMHO, one of those products that accomplishes what it sets out to do.  Unless you plan on taking it to the top of Mt Everest or El Capitan, this should make the grade for you.  I'll know more about longevity in a few years.

I use this product every Wednesday and Sunday for church services. The only problem I see is the turning mechanism. When we use the handle to turn the camera in a different direction it makes a creaking noise. If you are video tapping like I am on periscope, you can hear that distracting sound. I have not figured out how to cut down on that. Also keep in mind that I am doing a180 degree turn. This problem may be something I need to address.

This is a very light tripod, which is exactly what I wanted. I've taken it on hikes, and it is the perfect weight, I wouldn't want to have anything heavier. I feel like it is sturdy enough to put my expensive camera on it without any dangers.

It does the job! I use a Nikon D3300 camera and it fits perfectly for the camera. Sturdy support and easy to use. I personally think you don't need an expensive tripod to be able to use it good. Starting off with this is a good idea and I'm pretty sure it'll last. I'll update this review if anything changes. Other than that, I love it.

When rotating and filming, you will get a lot of jerkiness.  I am reviewing video footage and it looks like there is an earthquake going on when I rotate the tripod.  I would not buy again.  I would not recommend to friends, even if you need a cheap tripod.

I was excited to get this and couldn’t believe that it was used,broken,missing parts and no booklet.During a pandemic it isn’t best to give customers used dirty items.It was a huge thumb print on the case.
Good value for the $.  Light tripod for light duties. some features like the high-end tripos, such as tilting feet, buble lebels in center and head, snap locks to hold legs tight.

Great budget tripod for the price. I cannot compare to very high end tripods as I do not own any, but the build quality is good and everything is solid. Movements are not completely smooth when using the hand crank which is not a problem for photos but it is a problem when I am recording video. Overall I happy with this for the price I paid.

This is a good tripod for someone who is going to be just casually shooting with it under not particularly rugged conditions.  It is VERY light, which is great if you have to lug it around, but there is a trade-off in stability for heavier cameras.  If you are using something small and light it is a perfect match.  But it is no substitute for a serious heavy tripod -- and since the point of a tripod is to keep the camera perfectly still, keep that as part of your consideration.

I got this tripod in February 2016. A great tripod for people new to photography. I have used the tripod to take long exposure images as well as a few HDR images. Overall, it can't be beat for the price. Additionally, it is lightweight (less than 2 lbs) but still able to be 60" tall, allowing for less bending over to look into the view finder. My only complaint is that the mounting plate feels a little loose when it is locked into the tripod but it has never fallen out. The middle post of mine got scratched up pretty quickly from opening and closing of the tripod but its just cosmetic, did not affect the usability.

I was very happy when I received the product. But After I install my camera, the head keeps tilting down and can’t stay in place even the adjust knot is super tight. Actually there is always a gap between the knot, I don’t know how to fix it

It is a nice looking unit. Seems to work as it should. The movements are a little rough. The parts where the camera attaches to and the whole upper part of the unit are made of cheap plastic, a little on the thin side for my taste. But I am sure this is a better choice than my balancing the camera on top of a lampshade when taking group pictures. But it does not compare to what I had expected. Perhaps I was spoiled, my father had this old tripod from the seventies that was all metal, very solid and smooth. One year we got tired of seeing it sitting in the corner of the closet and got rid of it. Bad decision, because they don't seem to make them like that anymore.

Had to replace the first one as the legs broke apart after using it for 1 hour on a golf course filming some different shots around the course with friends. 2nd one seems to be fine but still tough to pop back up after filming, the brackets seem to stick so I am afraid after a while this one will give way as well. Otherwise it is a decent tripod with its height and functionality.  Return of the first one was easy, right to a kohls dept store they have an amazon counter and they sent me a new one right away.

Upon receipt it "appeared" to be good enough quality for the price, but while using the tripod for only the second time to take video of my child's basketball game, the pre-assembled swivel handle came off in my hand without any warning or discernible cause.  Some other small pieces or hardware fell from either the handle or the space where the handle inserts rendering the tripod useless ever since.  I was sitting in open bleachers and couldn't find what fell since I didn't even have time to see what fell.  The handle can't simply be screwed back into the insert without the other little pieces.  The handle must have had a function relating to the vertical control of the plate on which the camera rests, in addition to allow the user to swivel the camera horizontally, because now the camera flips/tilts backward as soon as I let it go.  I don't live near a tripod repair location and can't find the tripod's assembly instructions anywhere online to at least figure out what little pieces fell out.  No manual came with the tripod so this is very disappointing.  I've never had a problem I've purchased using Amazon Prime.  I hope the seller will see this and offer a helpful resolution.  I would be willing to change my rating if this is resolved appropriately.

I have to say, I was very surprised when my daughter opened this package.  For the price we paid, I expected a tripod that was "good enough."  Not so.  The quality and construction of this tripod is far and above anything we hoped for.  She loves it, and, because she does a lot of outdoor photography, the bag makes it easy to carry with her on rough terrain where she needs to walk in to sites.  It also has far more features than either of us expected.  Good job, Amazon.  We couldn't be happier with this purchase.

It feels solid enough, but the parts are made of weak plastic. The part that supports the base broke. Amazon offered a refund or exchange and I took the refund so I can just buy a better quality tripod

I am not a photographer by any means but wanted this so me and my family could take some pictures together without having to rely on someone else. We have used this stand and put our camera on timer and have taken great family pictures with this without having to spend any money for a photographer. We haven't yet but want to use this when we surf too. It's sturdy and easy to use. Can go pretty low and high.

This thing is light, yet rock solid. Lots of features for a low cost. The truth is I use this to hold my GoPro in the garage for my youtube channel. This thing lives in the garage and gets knocked around quite a bit. It hold up to the abuse quite well. It has all the good features - lots of adjust ability, everything locks down, ect. The swivel feet also work great on hard surfaces, however struggle a bit on thick grass.It works wonders for my setting, but a professional photographer with heavier gear may have some issue with it.
Overall it is a good product. But the quality is my concern. The side handle is very easy to drop because the skrew distinction. Once the side handle drops out there is no way you can install back.

I loved how lightweight this tripod was and the handy carrying case, however, I was using it for the first time to film a wedding (NOT the time to run into any issue) and one of the leg extensions broke off and won't adjust anymore. It's obviously unusable now that one leg doesn't extend beyond a certain point.I'm extremely disappointed and wish I hadn't waited to use it a few months after purchasing it, because unfortunately I don't think I'm able to return it at this point.

Super value for the amateur photographer. I don’t think the professional photographer that wants a heavy duty, durable every day professional tripod would find this acceptable, BUT, I am exceptionally pleased with the tripod. It is a very suitable piece of equipment for my Nikon D-3500 at an excellent price.

I really like this tripod, it's lightweight, stable and affordable.Why the 2 stars then? The screwing mechanism for the adjustable piece on top broke literally on its first use, and without much force either. The rest of the tripod is in perfect shape but I just lost a big part of its functionality in a second.

I have bought 2 of these tripods from Amazon and both unfortunately have broken within a couple months of using them and I have not been abusive to these tripods at all. On the plus side they are light weight, fairly study and are overall a descent tripod. But in the end they just don't last. If you're looking for a cheap and quick option for a tripod I would defiantly consider this item. If you're looking to use it for more than a few months I would shell out the extra cash and go with a little nicer tripod.

I use this often to video my sons sports.  I'm not looking for much but this doesn't turn well.  When I need to turn the top so the camera moves, it sticks and I get jumpy videos.  And now I'm off to buy a new one.  I love everything else about this tripod except that.

Video was poor, grainy, stabilization poor, no software to download videos from camera and Windows media player couldn't decode the file.  I have no idea what type of video camera the reviewers had before this camera?  B&W from 1970?  You get what you pay for.  I returned.

This is the perfect product photography tripod. It's lightweight yet sturdy and is super easy to adjust. It even has a couple of levels on it to make sure you have every straight. You can beat it for the price.

Good tripod, but it does have its faults. Build quality isnt that great and a little bit on the bulkier side (not that heavy though). You cant really expect much with the price you're paying so i guess these aren't really complaints as much as they are observations.

I recently ordered this tripod for my Nikon D3300. From my personal experience, it is sturdy and holds well against the wind on those windy days. It is light enough to carry. I like that a bag came with it. Very easy to use. I accidentally removed the annoying silver thingy next to the screw and to be honest, that was the best thing that I could have done. It made getting my camera onto the tripod a whole lot easier.

Works well for my Canon Point and Shoot, if you own a thousand-dollar+ DSLR I think you should probably buy something more serious than the $24 "AmazonBasics" tripod. For us plebs, it works just fine. It's plenty tall, lightweight, and has all the different axis adjustments you would expect.

Works perfectly, easy to use and set up and it's pretty lightweight. I haven't used it with a proper camera, but my phone stand screws properly in so no problems there yet. Surprisingly good quality for the price! Would recommend.

Super disappointed with this product. I've used it a total of 4 times since I purchased it a few months ago and it already has a piece that broke. I was trying to fold it back up and the center pole that stabilizes the legs popped out of the socket and now it won't go back to normal. It still works (kinda) but I have no way of really adjusting it now. It's super cheaply made. It also came with no instructions which is incredibly frustrating. It's not a highly technical piece of equipment, but it's also not entirely intuitive when setting it up. The middle piece that ended up breaking on my tripod was incredibly confusing to work. It would have been nice to have had a guide of some sort to help with the process. Oh well, guess you get what you pay for.

These are extremely similar to other off-brand tripods I have used in the past but for a much lower price. Extremely light weight and easy to setup and operate. Quick detach mounts are nice and tight and you're not worried about your device falling off. Definitely recommend this product.
OK so when it arrived I thought, Why is this box so heavy? Turns out it was a 2 pack. What a pleasant surprise since both my kids needed one. Very happy with this purchase.

I know it is only like $25, however, this product is cheap. It's 100% aluminum and plastic, and I had it for a year with nothing broken. However, the pan and tilt are really cheap. On the lowest setting, one moves more freely than the other, so you can forget any diagonal movements. And every time I try to do only one of the two, I struggle to try to make it look smooth. Unless you're looking for something to be completely still (then it would be great), I advise spending a little more money on a better tripod.

If you're looking for an affordable tripod to keep your camera steady... then this is it! When they say lightweight, they mean it. This tripod is very light and the legs are pretty skinny... however, it's not flimsy by any means and holds up strong. The latches to extend the legs seem very durable and are very easy to open/close without them feeling loose or like they're going to fail on you (I've had some tripods like that and it was always a guessing game as if the legs would suddenly collapse or not). Great affordable tripod.

Do not be fooled with this lower-than-average priced basic tripod. It is a better choice than the typical walmart cheap-o tripod. After reading the countless positive reviews on Amazon, I decided to purchase one. I was impressed that it came with a nice carrying bag that makes it a lot more convenient to carry around than just by itself. The overall construction seem to support and hold my dslr without any problems. there is also a level that is built in that can aide during set up. I have had it for about 6 months now and it is still holding strong. I was expecting this tripod to simply break or fall apart a couple months after I bought it but it still stands. Very good product especially coming from Amazon themselves, I would like to see other products that are made as well as this tripod on the website.

5 star rating just for the price. Obviously not as well build as a high name brand but will deliver close results. I was reluctant to buy this as I need to be able to pan for video but the head is sturdy, locks or pans(turns camera) smoothly. I have read reviews saying the angle adjustment wasn't tight enough. But mine works great. I am satisfied and am glad I didn't spend 25 dollars more for a name brand. Amazon basics did this one right.

It's perfect and get's the job done. It is lightweight so sometimes it feels like the tripod is going to tip over and my camera might break  if you are having it stand above three feet. So I suggest hooking a bag that is heavy to help add some support and hold the tripod down.

This may be an Amazon Basics product, but it is not lacking in quality. It is versatile and easy to use. When I was researching tripods I saw the review by the guy with no arms. I figured if he could use this I could to. I love this tripod! I wanted something easy to use, but would not cost me a small fortune. I am not a professional photographer so I was not looking to pay for a professional tripod. This does everything I want it to and then some. I would recommend to any amateur photographer like me.
This had everything I was looking for in a tripod at a really great price. very good quality and lots of features. highly recommend for whatever you use, Phone or Camera!

Purchased this due to the price point and needing a tripod quickly.  Unfortunately one of the legs securing points separated almost immediately from the assembly, I have been using it gently in hopes that it wouldn't separate again, but alas she is done.  Got almost a year out of it.  Next time I would pay a little bit more for something that is a bit more sturdy.

It works good but when we see the lightweight metal connected to the cheap looking plastic it just takes the fun away. It works tho. It is a good product and it not bad. It does the job just not pretty as one would like.

I’m a singer and actor and bought this to record auditions for submissions. This tripod is PERFECT. The height when extended fully is just at eye level for me and I am 6’1”. All of the moving parts function flawlessly and it looks sleek. So easy to use. The carrying case is useful as well for hauling it around to different locations for recording! Would highly recommend this.

I haven't bought a tri-pod in 20 years or so.... that said, I was thrilled to see multiple built in levels and plenty of options to create ANY angle needed. This is a great lil' tripod that exceeded my expectations.

Thus far the tripod is very light and works well with my Nikon D3100. I love that it fits my camera well and is very sturdy. Will be trying it out tomorrow at my Super Bowl Party and then in June for my Alaskan Cruise.

The tripod is pretty stable, but on uneven terrain, the legs and be finicky. The rubber feet on the legs sometimes allow it to rock slightly. The construction is overall very nice. It is very lightweight and can be brought almost anywhere with ease due to the bag it comes with.

Wasn't expecting much from this tripod due to the price but there are so many adjustment knobs that you can't say it lacks features. My only complaint is that I actually needed something heavier and sturdy because I do more videography than photography. There is a slight play at the mounting point at the top of the tripod but thats what to be expected with a plastic build so can't really complain
This is a very good tripod for the price. Additionally, the storage bag is handy when traveling. Both the tripod and storage bag appear to be well made enough to hold up to consistent use.

It's compact and easy to transport. Great storage/travel bag. A little confusing on how to hook iPhone in it, but it probably helps to read instructions first and not try to set it up 3 minutes before the game starts and I need to be filming. :)
Very Nice Product.  HIGHLY Recommend this, very much well worth it.  Thank you seller for bringing such a Nice product to the Market, and at such a great price too.  Enjoy all ;-)

Good build quality with extra features I didn't expect like detachable base plate, for taking the camera off quickly, a crank operated center post,  and two different bubble levels. I haven't done any shooting with this yet but my initial impression is that it'll work wonderfully.

Very simple tripod, but great! When I purchased this tripod, I spent days beforehand searching through a sea of tripods, because I didn't know anything about them. I was knew to photography and filming, that I just wanted to find the right tripod for my camera. I had read about a lot of really cheap ones that bent and broke, so I was afraid of buying one that would be complete crap. I noticed this in the suggested area when I was flipping through pages of tripods here on amazon. The reviews were pretty good and the price was decent. I'm so happy with how tall the tripod grows, as well as how small it can shrink. It's very lightweight like the title says. Easy to move around. You can adjust different portions of it in different areas. (If that makes sense) And there's a nice handle so you can move just your camera as well, and it locks in place so you can keep the camera right where it's looking. I have a Nikon D3300, which isn't the heaviest, but isn't the lightest camera either. It works well with my camera, but like I said, I do need to lock it in place or it just falls. But great tripod! Highly recommended to anyone!

It’s a pretty good tripod but very lightweight and flimsy, the plastic bits all feel about a good dropping away from breaking apart. Definitely not ideal if you have to move it around much like on rough terrain. I’m not trusting this thing to hold my nice camera without me being less than a foot away because a stiff breeze is likely to knock it over.

I have now used this product a number of times and I appreciated the build and quality for the price. The tripod is made of lightweight Aluminum which makes it easier to carry on hikes. Each leg can be set at a customize height to work around uneven surfaces or around objects to get that beautiful vista and perfect shot. The tripod has other customizable benefits such as to allow additional height as well as adjusting angles in landscape or portrait view. I feel this tripod will last me a long time and will continue to get a lot more use.
This is a great stand for a beginner but if you are wanting to move the camera around I would recommend one that is a little more sturdy and has a more easily movable head

It is very lightweight as stated, but unfortunately, bends. We bought it to use with binoculars. The binoculars do not fit right on the tripod, falling and bending the aluminum. Not work the price. Its chintzy and doesn’t do the job

This works great for me - I set it up to tape a few different sporting events and used the phone adapter holder bought separately and feel like a professional cameraman.  It is steady, the legs were adjustable to keep things level and i could also keep the top loose to rotate the camera side to side to follow action while still keeping level and steady.  Lightweight with a nice a carrying case, I find I am just leaving it in my trunk for any kid's sport games we attend if we ever want to tape them.  Recommend and a no-brainer at the price..

Gave this product 5 stars because it's absolutely great for the price. I've been trying to get into photography after using a Lumia 1020 in 11/2013, and because it came with a camera grip with universal tripod mount, thought I would give this a shot. it's tall, lightweight and comes with a carrying bag. Perfect for when I want to go for a long bike ride or even take a car to a shooting location.It does feel like it's not the sturdiest thing in the world, but with the right care, I expect it will last a long time. Recommend for any amateur photographer or someone on a budget.

This is a great tripod for the price. I looked up many other tripods and read their reviews, a lot of the other brands will sell you low quality products that are not able to hold up DSLR's and can cause damage. This one is perfect for the price. I did not want anything too expensive as this is just a hobby of mine. It comes with the release plate which is so convenient as many tripods do not come with it. A release plate is attached to your camera so you can quickly and easily attach and remove it from the tripod without having to screw/unscrew your camera every time. It is sturdy and easy to use, it did not come with directions but fiddling with it for about 5 minutes, I was able to use and adjust it easily. This is perfect for those not looking to spend too much money.
Great product at a great price. Surprised there were no instructions, but this tripod was so simple to use there were no need for instructions! Worth the money for sure

I am a hobby photographer.  I have had my first DSLR for about 2 years.  I finally realized I would benefit from the use of a tripod so I started on Amazon.  I didn't wnat to spend a lot because I'm still pretty new at this.  I purchased this product because of the reviews on Amazon, which said, even though it's cheap, it works well for the cost.  I got it home, opened up the box and set it up.  I attached my camera and while locking it into place, a piece of the plastic snapped and broke off.  I didn't even get a chance to take a picture with it.  It went back the next day.  Unfortunately, this product was a little too cheap for me and didn't work out.

This TriPod was MUCH better than I expected it to be. It is extremely durable, and feels extremely sturdy. I haven’t been able to use it much yet, but it seems like it will last for a long time as well. The case it comes in is of high quality as well.Extremely happy with this purchase

I am an amateur when it comes to video recording but I really like this tripod.  It is very easy to use, very sturdy and lightweight.  It has multiple lengths which is great.  I definitely recommend this tripod.

Not to say that Amazon Basics products aren't top notch, but I was really surprised for the price how nice this Tripod is!  I use it with my GoPro and the videos turn out smooth panning across scenery.  Well worth it!  Glad I bought it!

I have to admit I am a bit shocked that this tripod is less than $25. I recently purchased a different tripod for $25 that had telescoping legs and only expanded to 41 inches, which at the time I thought would be tall enough but it's not.This tripod not only expands to 60 inches but also smoothly pans for video (which it what I use it for), has 2 different built in levels, and a detachable quick release plate so I am not screwing my camera on and off every time I use it. The aluminum legs are strong and sturdy, the swivel feet flatten to any surface, I also love that it not only comes with a shoulder bag for easy travel, but also a built-in handle so I am not fumbling with it.

This tripod seems very advanced for the price.  It can be manipulated in multiple directions, includes levels to ensure alignment and extends to the full 60" height.  I'm using it with the cell phone attachment and therefore at its highest, it is sturdy enough.  It feels sturdy enough to also use with my Cannon if I wanted.  There is a nice carrying bag but no instruction manual.

Need an inexpensive tripod for your smaller camera? Then this is a great value. Need to tilt up-down or  perform a lot of panning side-to-side live video? Look elsewhere as the friction, even on its lowest adjustment, is really "sticky" which makes smooth panning impossible and causes audible groaning and creaking noises to be picked up by the onboard camera mic. Otherwise it's a perfectly usable tripod with plenty of adjustments, a carry bag, etc.

Perfect for a beginner but broke after a few uses and no longer slides open and closed at the triangle base. I do recommend this only to beginners and someone who doesn’t want to spent a ton of money...I only used a handful of times. Cheaply made.

It's cheap, but less than a year later it's already falling apart on me. I suppose you get what you pay for?I don't hate it, but I would have liked it to last a little longer. It gets the job done, but only just.

very helpful tripod for beginners like myself. I have been using cameras on and off for 30 years now, not professionally, so I didn't really think about buying a tripod. Until recently. It's been a year now, it makes a huge difference. Images are way sharper. Not that I have shaky hands, but when it comes to holding a camera perfectly still, we all do!
I expected a very simple tripod when I made this purchase, but it exceeded my expectations. It has so many features to help get a level picture and for ease of use. Totally worth it.

Product is definitely as described and pictured! Very light-weight, durable and affordable.Best part - It comes with its own bag included! Thank you, Amazon for being so thoughtful in providing a complete package.
After very little uses the plastic piece that holds camera in place snap and broke off and is very poorly made . I don't no if I can return this for a new one but I hope so .

For a basic tripod, this is worth it. I'm not a pro photographer, but for what I want, this is more than adequate. I like to take pictures of the sky, Moon and Milky Way. Also closeups of insects on flowers. This works great.
Its lightweight. Easy to fold and carry. Downfall is it's cheap material. Parts have broke off even though I baby this thing. Invest in a better tripod if you're planning on using it semi-often.
Got this from the warehouse. Great legs and body. Sturdy. But the platform wobbles LIKE CRAZY. Absolutely useless. Do not buy this used.

I really like this idea. for as cheap as I got it, it is comparable to much much more expensive ones. Infinitely adjustable. Mine did break within 1 day but that was constant use and I think it's a fluke. The lock on one of the legs came apart. Good part is that it's Amazon so returning it was a non issue.

Bought the cheapest option knowing I'd get what I paid for. Relatively well constructed (have had no issues), gave me what I expected. 3 stars is not for dissatisfaction, just for the fact that if you want a bells and whistles, super durable, or super lightweight tripod this isn't for you. If you're looking for bare bones that gets the job done for occasional non-professional photography, then go for it as this is what you want.

I purchased this for a college digital camera class to stabilize my pictures and am quite surprised by all the things it can do. It has the stabilizing bubbles on the frame and on the part the camera goes onto. It raises by 2 sets of pop open locks and has a fold out turn knob for raising it to full height and everything locks to secure the shot. It can also be titled to 90 degrees for those sideways shots. It comes with a nice case and is very lightweight and easy to use. The top pops out to attach the camera

It's a nice tripod for what you pay. It's definitely not a $200 product. But I think it's great for someone who is just learning. It has bubble levels on it and it's lightweight. Very easy to pack around. Might be a little too light in windy conditions but there is a hook on the bottom where you can attach something to help weigh it down. It has a decent bit of mobility as far as what you can do with the camera. The legs can extend up to the 60 inch height or you can make it very small and compact at about a foot 1/2 or so. If you don't want to pay top dollar for a tripod, this is a good choice.

I thought since this is AmazonBasics, it would be cheap quality.It is actually pretty durable. For the price, you get everything you need and more. It has all the basic tools you need for balance built in, and doesn't stick when extending.

So glad I purchased this! I figured out how to take star shots with my camera and needed something to hold the camera completely steady and this works great! I was also able to use it to take a timed shot of my family of about 50 people.

Performs as expected.  For the price it is a great deal. 1 issue, apparently it is Missing a hook on it for adding additional weighfor stability.  Mine did not come with one.  Trying to reach seller if this is just a part they can ship to me or if it is indeed "broken".  I have not received a response as of yet and will adjust my rating once I find this out.Update. The seller contacted me and has sent me a replacement unit since they do not offer replacement hooks.  The replacement was fast and I am very satisfied.  Again, for the money this is an excellent buy.
It’s pretty good for the price. It’s obviously not going to be a super high quality tripod, but as long as it’s not super windy or anything, it should work just fine outdoors.
Actually modified this into a shooting tripod for a heavy .308 rifle. After minor retrofitting, the tripod worked amazing and rotates smoothly.
As advertised , really nice stand , I like that its adjustable , easy set up , definitely worth the money , one of the knobs is flimsy but its getting the job done.

Obviously not top notch materials or craftsmanship, but it functions quite well, it's easy to use, and as long as I don't abuse it, I don't think I'll need to replace it anytime soon as my occasional use travel tripod, and I may get another one or two to use for off camera flash in my studio, and for that use I have no reservations at all.

Impressive Very Impressive Tripod in every way. Light weight, sturdy and excellent for photography or, as I bought it, to hold the iPad using the ChargerCity® HDX-2 Tablet Tripod Adapter which is also available on Amazon. I have Manfrotto and Gitzo, very high-end and heavy tripods for my photography work, so I know what a tripod needs to be, quick to set up, strong and sturdy with accessible controls and this one even has an included quick-release plate. It gets 5 stars because at this price, it knocks anything else out of the park.

This is a great tripod!  You can adjust the height easily as needed.  I gave it as a gift to one of my pastor's to be able to broadcast his Sunday lifegroup on facebook live and he loves it.  I recommend you buy the cell phone tripod adapter separately because it does not come with it.  It does not come with instructions, so I recommend you get familiar with it before actually using it for what you need.  I definitely recommend this product. :)

I use this to take pictures of homes so there is a lot of readjusting needed throughout the shoot. A piece broke off of the part that holds the camera and the whole thing is a little wobbly. Probably good buy for the money but I should have bought a sturdier one for what I do.

Works well for what I used it for. The only complaint I have is the mount has to be screwed into the camera first and THEN linked into the tripod. The camera has to carry that mount at all times, otherwise you have to unscrew it every time.

I wasn't expecting much for the price, but color me impressed! I have a more expensive tripod and bought this as a back-up - figured I'd end up using it more for lights, mics - but after testing it out on my Canon T7i and 80mm lens, I think she's found a new home. Very smooth panning and tilt. No issue with the quick release plate. The middle column cranks-up/down, which I love. Solid build. Nice bag. What more could you ask for.

This is a nice tripod.  I had bought an eleven dollar or so on sale tripod and it worked, it was uneven, no quick release, cat kept knocking it over with camera on it.  This one the cat can't knock over, it's got a nice spread on when legs are open, I guess twenty four inches or so.  It's a medium weight compared to my old on, super light weight, and this one has a spot to hang your camera bag or camera weight on it's hook for extra stablility.  it's got a nice aluminum construction, quick release plate which my old one didn't have which is a true necesity if you want to jump between tripod and hand pictures.  I shot a few pics with this and it really makes a world of defference.  I have it set up so it's just loose enough to move around, take a shot without tightening and then move to next position with a smooth movement, which my old one couldn't do, Not sure what else to add but, I definitely feel like this tripod will work nicely with my new sony rx100 for quite a while and is a real tripod to be used unlike my old one which was complete junk.  Try this is your not happy return it.  I'm enclosing a couple of photo's, one is this tripod taken freehand in almost no light with the sony rx 100, two is the junk tri pod in low low light freehand with sony rx 100, third is of my kitty taken mounted on this tripod with medium light to low loght with sony rx100, fourth is this tripod used low to medium light with sony rx 100.  Hope this helps, the two with the tripod came out wonderfully I couldn't get this clarity without the tripod and then bam quick release for just snapping a few free style.

Great value! Have used this a few times and really enjoy it. Very light and a quick setup and take-down. It is so light however you might want to make use of the bag hook on the bottom. On the top of a mountain, a breeze almost knocked over the tripod and my camera. Easy adjustments and the head will pan for video. Comes with a carry bag also.
Does the job, but it’s a little flimsy. I get nervous putting my nice camera on it Without some standing there and will probably Get a new one but if you’re shooting without a timer it works fine!

Purchased this so I’d finally be able to snag family photos. Works great. The lightweight frame makes it portable. Took it on an hr long train ride to Tokyo to see the Imperial Gardens, easy peasy with moving around.
Arrived with a broken leg, which I repaired with superglue since I did not have time to return and reorder. Despite the repair, it worked well! Lightweight and sturdy!

I love this tripod. It is SUCH a great tripod for the money. I could not find anything even nearly as good for anywhere near the price of this tripod. Definitely the best you can get at this pricepoint, at least on Amazon when I got it (a year+ ago).Worth the purchase. I'd recommend

I just received the tripod in the mail today and I tried it out, I was surprised at how well I liked it. For the money, is a nice little tripod. It's lightweight, it's easy to adjust and it collapses down to a small size that fits into a carry bag. I'm excited to be able to use it to take photos of my toddler while I can try to get him to smile. I bought a remote for my DSLR as well, so the combo is really going to help out in getting the shots I want!
I use this tripod for a spotting scope in my office. Works great for a light weight tripod.

Heavy duty stand!! Use it with my Nikon. There’s 2 levels one near the camera and one on the stand to make sure the legs are straight. I’m not disappointed in this purchase at all!! Comes with a carrying case, too.
If you are looking for a study, relatively inexpensive tripod look no further. I've had this one for two years now and it still works great! Buy with confidence.
I bought this to steady my night vision monocular and it works better than I imagined. Easy to mount and control vertically,horizontally, and height. Also easy to level on an incline.
This thing can be used for so many purposes! I'm in love with it.Sturdy and takes fantastic photos for me. Easy to mount anything on from my digital camera to phone!

Just received this tripod - wow - I am truly impressed.  I love the locking levers on the legs (much better in my view than the twist variety, I wasn't even aware of this feature ). My main reason for this purchase was because of the bubble levelers, my first consideration and second was the great price! I hope to have many years of use as I will be using it in my foray into online selling.

This tripod was very clunky and awkward to use. I took it on a trip with me to get some wildlife and landscape photos. It is difficult to use if you need to change angles and locations quickly. It is awkward to fold up when no longer needed. If you don't plan to be nimble and only need this for static shots, it is fine. But if you need to change it quickly to get the shot, plan to be disappointed with it lack of flexibility.
As a utility tool it does exactly what it is meant to do: hold a camera steady. I have had no problems with it since purchasing it.
Especially considering the cost!  I got a two-pack and am utilizing both at the same time; spotting scope and camera.  Quick and easy to set up, surprisingly stable considering light weight and cost.

You get what you pay for, but it was still overpriced for what you get.  One of the plastic pieces arrived broken.  The plastic is brittle and cheap.  The metal is aluminum and VERY flimsy.  Just spend the extra money for a legit tripod.

I played with this thing for a little with my go pro. So far so good. The panning from left to right and up and down is pretty smooth. That was a big one for me. Glad that's set. Once you extend the legs it does seem to get a little fragile. Luckily the tripod has a hook to hang a weight for better support. I would not trust this with heavier, more expensive cameras. For the price I think this is definitely worth it.
Sturdy and lightweight. Price reasonable and quality is very good. Found easy to assemble. I utilize my tripod for binoculars some heavyweight and some lightweight. Tripod holds well.

Works great for still shots but for video, the pan and tilt is a little tight and jerky. Can’t loosen anymore to make it smoother. It’s plastic against plastic. I would suggest a better tripod for video. I do like it for the price.
Pros: It has 3 legs; it's a tripod.Cons: Extremely flimsy.  Can be torqued with 2 fingers. Stiction to the point of unusability.

I took this tripod with me on so many outings and I barely realized I was carrying it! I went to Manhattan to the NewLife expo, I took it to film a live reading in forest park, and even us it on a day to day to do readings for my YouTube and clients! I love it, it’s easy to set up , to adjust, and to put away.

I purchased this for my canon T3i and while I was hesitant at this price range that it would be able to handle the cameras weight especially with a lens on it this thing is awesome and can take it. I love that it has every angle adjustment I could ask for and that it keeps my camera safe. It even has two levels on it so that I know my camera is level and ready to use. I am so glad I purchased this one on Amazon as opposed to one that cost more at the store like I was going to. I saved a ton of money and got a superb product. Very happy!

I am new to the photography world and this is my first tripod. My first impression is that it seems like a well built product. For my casual usage I think it will hold up fine. I might be concerned about durability if I was taking it out into nature and banging it around. For the money, this thing is worth giving it a shot.

Great product for the money. I like that I could get this so quickly and a lot cheaper than the $65 one at Best Buy! Sturdy. Stable. Lightweight. Easy to carry and get in and out of its carrying bag. Highly recommend!

Nice and light and fairly sturdy, but has a narrow foot radius so can easily topple -- as I learned one windy day.  I had my Sony F6000 mounted on it and a gust knocked it over.  Fortunately I got away with nothing more than a bit of cosmetic damage on the lens housing -- everything still working fine.  I DID have the neck cranked up to maximum height, but still, just not solid enough to trust to an expensive camera -- I have learned my lesson!  Better to shell out some bucks for a sturdy tripod!
This is a nicer tripod than I expected to the price. I use it with a spotting scope to take cell phone pictures of deer at my farm.  No complaints at all!

This tripod was a very pleasant surprise. The price is incredible and it's lightweight yet sturdy. My wife is a photographer and she has already gotten some great use out of it with family pictures, portraits, and scenic pictures. AmazonBasics is a solid brand and this product is excellent, especially for the low price (at the time we paid just over $23).
I use mine to mount a small dobsonian telescope.  For that purpose, it's sturdy enough and works well.  I can't imagine it having trouble with a camera.

I am very disappointed in this tripod. I am a fine art photographer, but only use this tripod for my family photos once or twice a year. One leg fell apart while trying to get Easter photos this year. I was able to temporarily fix it and then it fell totally apart while attempting Christmas photos. In the trash it went!
Such a good buy! I cannot emphasize this enough. This is light weight, adjust to be small or really tall and holds a camera, camcorder or bag sooooo easy

I bought this for my 90 year old father who loves watching barges through his spotting scope. He wouldn't believe me when I told him what it cost. He said. "How is that even possible they can make something of this great quality for so little money?"  I'm thrilled beyond words. For those who said don't waste your money, I say don't waste your time reading those reviews. This product is amazing. I would have paid double.

This is the easiest tripod to use. When it says lightweight that is not an exaggeration. It fits in a small carrier bag and feels so light. It's simple to set up and take down (like seconds). I really like this for family pictures when I have to set a timer. It extends to 60 inches which is fine for most pictures.

My height is 5.9 and I was worried that it would be short. This is not true. It is a good height and excellent quality. this is a very easy sturdy and a light tripod. I can recommend it to my friends.

I got this tripod for my camera and it broke the 2nd day I used it. There are 3 legs and each leg has 2 clamps and extends out. One of the 2 clamps on 1 leg slid down all the way to the bottom and will not go back in place. I was being so gentle with it too. The lowest clamp can't clamp the leg in place so I have to tape it to keep it there. I would be careful if you are using an expensive camera, its possible the thing could collapse by the 5th use. Not very good quality.

I've only used this a couple times so far...  and works as advertised...  build quality seems mediocre, and pretty much the whole thing is plastic...  but it is lightweight and functions...  supports my camera fine ( which is fairly heavy as cameras go / especially with telephoto lenses )...I'm certainly not in "awe" with this tripod, but, for the price, it works just fine...

Quickly shipped by Amazon, nicely packaged in a nylon bag, this is a lightweight tripod that extends to about 6' total.As lightweight suggests, it won't be supporting heavy weights. If you are planning to use it with something above 5 Lbs, search elsewhere.

One of the legs became unstable after three weeks.  I wouldn't trust this thing to hold anything more than a GoPro.  More Chinese-made garbage dumped on gullible, powerless American consumers.  You get what you pay for.

Does everything I need it to do. It comes with a carrying case that is simple and works great. I found it easy to attach a mobile phone to it in addition to my camera after buying an adapter (found here:

This Tripod is extremely sturdy. Adding some weight will allow you to adjust freely without to much jumping. The left/right panning is not very good. It sticks when trying to pan slowly causing the picture to jerk. I would not recommend you purchasing unless you are just recording in a single position and not moving.
We bought this based on the stellar ratings but ours came missing parts/pieces and broke after just a handful of uses. Had to return.

I'm not a professional photographer, but I think I take pretty good shots.  Because of the amateur status, It can be hard to justify spending on high end gear.  So when I needed a tripod for a "photo shoot" for the youth group I run, I was looking for cheap but not terrible.  This was a surprise.  I really like this tripod, and will continue to use it without looking for a replacement.Pros:

I had this for 1 day. I ordered it new and when it arrived it had scratches from to me what looked like normal wear on it. I thought maybe I accidentally ordered it used but nope I paid full price. The panning was not smooth if I wanted to move the camera it would stop and go like it needs wd40 or something. I'm not sure if that's because the item was used or just poorly made. I can credit that it is lightweight.

I don't use this because its more heavier then the one I purchased a while back. It was advertised as a very light Tripod. Its not that light and more bulkier then I was looking forward to. Don't buy if you want a super light Tripod.

The Good: Lightweight, but sturdy enough to hold a camera with a 150-600mm lens. Stable on uneven surfaces.The Bad: Cheap aluminum & plastic construction.  Rivets on support braces have broken & one of the arms won't stay attached to frame.

This thing is perfect! Well built, even has two bubble levels on it so you know your camera is in perfect position. The handles are easy to adjust for the camera base as well. Also, since its an amazon branded tripod (Amazon Basics) I'm sure their customer support is better should you have a problem with it. Price is great too! Perfect for beginners and more experienced photographers alike. I also really like that the tripod folds up into a nice compact size and that it has a handle near the top, perfect for getting extra stability for shooting video or something like that. I use it to hold my camera steady while I make video blogs (vlogs) and it works great.

Just received this tripod today.  After removing it from the shipping box (undamaged), product box (undamaged), tripod bag (undamaged) and finally the sealed plastic bag (again undamaged), I noticed one of the leg bracing is scratched.I guess this is a case of "you get what you pay for".  I'll try it out to see how durable it is.

Assuming you purchase this tripod with the understanding that it's 'basic' (i.e. non-professional; casual; etc.), you'll be hard-pressed to find a better value for a similarly priced tripod with the features this one offers. I was looking for a versatile, easily portable tripod for under $30 and this fit the bill perfectly. I use it with my digital SLR (which weighs about 20 oz) and I'm totally comfortable that my camera is safe when it's on the tripod.The tripod itself is lightweight, versatile when it comes to height and angle adjustments, and has a useful carrying handle. The two bubble levels can be very handy, although one of them is obscured with the camera attached, rendering it mostly useless. The biggest issue I've run into (and the main reason I'm giving 4 instead of 5 stars) is getting a secure lock when tilting. The included bag won't hold up to wear as the material is flimsy, but it is a nice bonus simply as a storage cover/carrying case.
Cheap because it is cheap. The legs easily broke. The legs wouldn’t collapse and after some gentle wiggling the pin popped out and now it’s useless. Used it 2 times and now being recycled. Stay away
GARBAGE. Don’t waste you’re money. Purchased this for an easy “cheap” option for vacation. Yah it’s worthless. One the third use the legs started falling out on their own and it flat out sucks.

Bought as a gift for a 10 yr old film enthusiast, awesome value and very easy to use! It's very lightweight and comes with a travel bag. The plate that comes off is easy to attach to a camera and clip back on to the tripod. I'm contemplating ordering one for myself as well! The only con I saw was the width of the legs, I wish the legs would go a bit wider when the tripod is at it's shortest length.

Where was this all my life!  It's perfect for beginners and it did fit my Nikon D3300 well.Easy to use and it didn't take me much time to maneuver and get it into use.Felt difficult at first.Searched online a bit and I was on !
I was worried about the quality since this is a “Basics” Item, but was very pleased with the Tripod!  It’s sturdy, lightweight and easy to use.  It holds our bird spotting scope with ease.
I bought this to film my daughter’s soccer games and it works great. I use a cell phone adapter on top, so it doesn’t fit in the case, but it has a nice handle on the side so it doesn’t bother me.

Haven't really used it to tell you anything about it. This is my 1st tripod and all I can say is that it is stable, sturdy and if you take care of your products, this will last a long time. I like it as of right now. It does what I need it to do.
This was a present for my 15 year old granddaughter to go with the 35mm camera we bought her. She put it to use immediately and seems very proud of her new photography equipment!!
Amazon product, the first was defective, this one works ok. Like the title says light weight, I wouldn’t walk away from this with my camera was attached.
I bought this since it was amazon choice, but it got broken after the second use. Hopefully the new one I received will last longer.
This tripod is really sturdy and holds my camera nicely.  I like the travel bag that it comes with, which made it easy for transporting and traveling.
So far the tripod has held up well. I have used it many times indoor and outdoors during trips. Very sturdy, easy to use, and high quality. I would highly recommend this
