I use this for my laser level, it has a 1/4" tvread and adjusts side to side and up and down. Its pretty tall too. I would trust it with a camera on it
This Tripod is a great bang for the buck.  It does everything that I need it to do, it is very light and comes with a carry bag.  No issues to report.

This would be a great tripod and excellent value if it wasn't for the quick release plate on the head. The insert is too small for the tripod head, so it rattles around. The camera won't fall off, but there's no way to tighten it up in the head. This is serious enough that I recommend looking at something else. Too bad, because as I said, other than that serious, glaring defect, the rest of the tripod and head are O.K.

Most parts are plastic. One set of the screws/nuts was worn out after one month of the purchase due to the fact the nut thread is plastic. It is a hidden one and not repairable/replaceable. I knew such kind of cheap made stuff is not durable. I didn't know it only lasted for one month about 4 times use.
Excellent tripod!  I love it!  What a bargain!Este es un excelente trípode, se los recomiendo. Tiene hasta estuche para llevarlo donde uno quiera. ¡5 estrellas!
Feels cheap, I guess you get what you pay for, I use it once in a while so I’m fine with it and I will probably not return it, but I wouldn’t give it 5 stars
Slightly bigger than I expected. I needed to attach this to the outside of my camera bag, but it’s too big. But it does easily handle my Nikon Coolpix 1000 with the lense fully extended

Works well. Question it's long time durability.. the handle that twists to lock it in place was broken after light use. I have own this for around 9 months and use it on sparingly. After reporting the issue, Amazon issue me a refund. I will probably buy this again.. hopefully this one is more sturdy.

It’s a great Tripod! It has a leveling gauge so you can make sure your video or photo isn’t tilted when camera is mounted. Legs can extend quite a bit so it is perfect height no matter what. Overall, it’s a very good product.

This tripod is a great product for a great price. Sturdy, easy to manipulate, and comes with all the things my old tripod (and the more expensive ones) did not. It has a carrying case, a hook for hanging, a handle for carrying, a level, and a quick release plate. I use it all the time, and it has yet to fail me.

Ordered this tripod for my daughter who is a 12 years old professional makeup artist (@londondanell on all social media platforms), to hold her Canon Rebel T7i camera she uses for recording. We were a little scared that the tripod would be to Flimsy for the larger camera with added lenses, we quickly found out that we were worried for nothing. This tripod does its job, we love everything about it from the look of it to the great features on it. It’s also very easy to ensemble.
It seems pretty flimzy.  I have used it for one job so far.  It did what I needed it to do but it doesn't seem like it is going to last long.  A lot of plastic parts.

This is not a heavy duty tripod by any stretch. Don't order it expecting it to be one. I'm pretty certain I could break it in half without too much effort.What it is, is  a very cool light duty tripod that's perfect for a mobile phone or lighter camera. I'm happy with the purchase.

Great price. Was originally shopping for a tripod for my self leveling laser. Got this Instead so my daughter could use it with her dslr as well. Works great with both. Love the feature where you can adjust the height with just a couple of turns on the base.

In spite of its price, light weight, and simplicity, this tripod actually worked well for my heavy Nikon P1000. Just use a timed shutter or a remote; particularly on telephoto zoomed shots. Panning, tilting and pedestal moves are smooth except for extra-tele shoots. I recommend this one.
Solidly built and lightweight, this tripod is an excellent choice for the price. Easy to use and setup is a snap. Perfect for small digital video cameras, as movement is smooth.

I absolutely  love this product! It was supposed to come tomorrow but came a day early! I definitly love how you can play with the tripod and adjust on how you want the height, angle, etc. I got the 60 inch which was just PERFECTION. I make YouTube videos and I love how it gets a wide shot and how steady it is! Not only was it awesome and perfect, but the packaging was 10/10.  There was box inside a box then a plastic seal then the bag and finally there was the tripod!  I definitly think that it is really important having amazing packaging because, in the UPS truck or FedEx they might be tossing it around and you dont want it to break. Buy this product! <3
I got this as a Christmas gift for my wife - and she LOVES it!  We have a Canon SLR camera and it fits perfectly on it.  Very sturdy when all the legs are extended.
The bag will break faster than the tripod itself. The strap on it will most probably break after a hundred uses. Otherwise for the price, it is another amazing item that Amazon Basics has to offer.
Works amazing
I have found this product to be perfect for what i needed it for and found the quality to be good for the price . Would buy again or recommend for beginner youtubers

I'm 5''3 it can go a bit past me which is amazing for full body filming. very sturdy even when fully extended. Has all the bells and whistles. love the leveler. This this is amazing. Only hing is its kind big and heavy ( not really) but compared to my other tiny cheap one.

I bought this back in May but finally took with out of country.  I think I might have gotten a lemon as this only lasted about 5 different shoots (waterfalls). What has failed is one of the leg clips came apart so there is a leg that is always extended (non locking) and wobbly. I might see if I can get a replacement on this, or a refund. Would be ok to retry another in case this one had a bad clip. edit:: I gave this 3 stars for now, will do more testing with a new product, and go to 4 if so desired.

This is a really nice tripod, its amazing something with this many features can be made for such a low price.  Highly recommended for the casual user, maybe not for a professional who uses a tripod every day, then again, a professional would probably want to invest in a $100 tripod that could withstand that kind of beating.

Good stable tripod, I use mine for hiking and taking long exposure night shots. It's light, which cuts both ways, so I usually carry a water bottle or something to hang beneath it to keep it from shaking when fully extended.

This has worked well so far.I would say that there are some places that could use some extra material, such as the joints of the bars connecting the center post to the outer legs. Those tiny thin flaps are likely what is going to fail long before anything else, and buffing them a bit wouldn't add appreciable weight.
This item is great, as long as you do not need to adjust the aim.The horizontal pan has too much resistance.; not smooth at all. The verticle pan is not bad.
Used this with my Nicon camera.  I'm really impressed with all the features and the sturdiness of it.  I think it's an amazing value for the money.

After a fresh coat of paint and 8 dollar modification this thing holds my 10/22 riffle nicely for night hunts. I like the handle on it which allows for easy carrying on a quick take down and relocation. For the money this works great. I can not justify the 200+ for the high speed riffle tripods. I will update as I challenge the tripod on more and more challenging terrain
Light.Sturdy. Amazing for Home Filming.I bought this after reading several reviews on here and decided to take a chance.

This tripod is absolutely the best for video taping basketball games. It is very light weight and compact. Its easy to carry with you in and out of gyms. If you are going to take the time to video tape your child's game then go ahead and take the time to make your life easier and have a better quality video by having a smooth video to watch.  I have had absolutely no problems with this at all and we have had this one for a while now.
very easy to use, very light weight, gets to a really good working height. it is very inexpensive so it shows on some parts but this is a great tripod for its price.

Works great for our home studio. Love the two levels on the tripod. Wish the camera positioning could be locked in place a bit better. Our camera doesn’t weigh it down and put it out of place but if you try to move the whole tripod, it’s easy to accidentally change the angle on the camera. Great for the price though!

First tripod I've purchase. The price is good for everything the product offers. The tripod has a great level of adjustment. I'm 5'9 and when raised to its max it's well my size. There is 2 levels to check balance. The level locks secure pretty well. I wish the tripod came with a users manual. I also wish the case it came with was just a little bit bigger. I think over time the case won't last. The tripod along with a separately sold attachment can work with a phone.

Somewhat disappointed in the sturdiness of the tripod.  Very light... plastic seems to be of fair quality.  I know it is for a light camcorder, but overall it seems quite flimsy compared to other, but much more expensive tripods I have purchased.  That is the point... price is very low so I think it is another case of you get what you pay for.

Best tripod for the money. Similar ones sell for many times this much. I bought an adapter on Amazon for about $10-$15 to screw on the top so I could use this with a smartphone.Lightweight, versatile, tall, has a built-in level, so many great features. For this price it is a ridiculously good bargain.

The first shoot I used it, this tripod broke. It's is cheaply manufactured. Two pins fell out and were lost so one of the legs came apart. I ended up having to use a toothpick to re-create the lost pin and get to the end of the shoot. It's cheap and cheaply made.. I would've gotten a nicer tripod, but this came with the camera I ordered and seemed such a good price that I decided it was worth it. Oh well. I should have known that you get what you pay for.

So far everything fine; nothing broken yet after 4 weeks of permanent outdoor use; more sturdy than my former one which costed twice. I use the tripod with a Sony DSLR + a 300mm telelens for still photography (mainly night shots, long exposures and close-ups). Would not recommend it for movies, as the handle is a bit too stiff for smooth panning. The hook at the bottom of the center column allows to add an extra weight for stabilization in windy conditions.

Bought two of these for some Celestron 15x70 Skymaster binoculars and was very happy.  The tripod is an inexpensive way to get a job done for a whole lot less than your would normally pay and it does it's job well.  All knobs, levers and adjustments are solid a little shaky but once you have your view in place it stops shaking and voila, mission accomplished.  I recommend for any budget conscious shopper who doesn't need something top of the line but serves it purpose.  Thanks Amazon!!!

Seemed well built but after very few uses it can no longer be tightened down to hold position. The camera immediately falls forward. Might be great for a light weight camera but for a larger dslr it is a waste.

This tripod is sturdy, even though it is relatively light.  The legs have quick releases, which I love - making it very quick to setup and fold back again.  I also like the fact that it can be extended to a height of 5 feet and  it comes with 2 spirit levels and also a carrying bag.  I'm glad I bought it.  Would highly recommend it.  In fact, I am buying a second one right now for my girlfriend, after using mine for over a year.

Hey a heads up to anyone thinking about buying this, I strongly recommend against it. While this tripod has a nice lightweight feel and a nice lightweight feeling on your wallet it falls apart quickly. The cheap plastic knobs just come off with no effort and some of them cant be put back on. This product is not even worth returning. I thought with the AmazonBasics branding there would be some quality with this but there is none.
I use this as part of a complete equipment set to record and live stream our church service each week.  It is very durable, and a great product for the money.
WOW AMAZING PRODUCT!! I RECORD 3 TIMES A DAY AT MY CHURCH USING THIS TRIPOD AND ITS JUST AWESOMEVERY STURDY, STRONG, GREAT QUALITY!!! MOVE SMOOTHLY.. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!
What a great design!! This tripod is so light and easy to carry but provides a stable and study base for the cameras and binoculars. Great price too!
Pretty good little rig! For the price you can’t beat it. Does its job. Is very lightweight so a gust of wind might blow it over lol but otherwise it’s great.

Great for 20 bucks. Light, compact. It looks nicer than 20 bucks. Works great. Does what I bought it for. I put my laser level on it. Used it for setting up kitchen counters.  Old house, kinda crooked.  This did it. I've used it for shelves too. The center cranks up another foot or so. I set it on a table or something and crank it up where I need it. Make my marks and done.

Great tripod for the price I returned an 80$ manfrotto because this one  is better with the raising center post and 2 levels  also only 3 leg pieces instead of the 5 on the manfrotto. It's not as compact as it could be but I'm more than happy with this 25$ tripod  easily fits into bag and the strap is long enough to fit across my chest instead of just hanging off my shoulder.All the moveable poings have twist locks so once you are. Done adjusting you can make sure it doesn't move .
It seems o.k. for the price, but this isn't saying much. Still deciding whether to keep it.Looks of plastic and poorly designed components.
I had one of these for a long time and liked it. I eventually needed a replacement and was pleased to find it was still made (not exactly the same but 95%) so I bought one again.
I use this for filming pickleball games. It is easy to use. For outdoor use I will just add a dumbell weight in the bag and hang that from the center so it doesn't tip over!

I purchased this tripod after the one that came with my kit unexpectedly broke... But, as the title states, so far this tripod is great!!! I have a Nikon D3300 and it holds it up just fine. Although It's pretty lightweight, you can tell it won't bend or break anytime soon. I had my other tripod for about a year before it broke so I'm hoping that this one will last a lot longer than that. It doesn't come with an instruction manual but if you play around with it, you'll get the gist of everything pretty quickly. The one thing that I can say is a bit of a flaw with this tripod is that it doesn't pan fluidly. When you're panning, there's some stops along the way. Bottom line however, it's inexpensive, lightweight, and durable and well, that's good enough for me.P.S. if you're worried about it being too short, just crank the handle at the top. :)
It was lightweight.  VERY lightweight.  I would have been nervous attaching my camera to it and walking away.  I felt like a stiff, breeze would topple it.
Works Great! I love taking pictures of myself by myself with this tripod. The only problem is when I try to mirror the tripod I can only remain a bi-pod.
Awful. I bought 2 of these. They both lost this kind of plastic ring and I wasn't able to understand from where exactly. After that, they just started falling to pieces.

This is a better tripod than I expected. It's light and easy to use and comes with a quick release plate, including a plate that fits on any camera with a standard tripod socket. It is also stable, which is the primary purpose for using a tripod.

I purchased two. I bought one and thought the problem was unique and Amazon replaced it and I had the same problem. Basically, the knob/crank that holds the head plate on which your camera sits cannot be tightened down to be stable. Your camera will flop forward or backward unless you steady it with your hand at all times. Kinda defeats the purpose of a tripod. I needed an inexpensive, lightweight tripod for a basic purpose but this will not do the job at all.

Love it, I have 2 other tripod but this is the best. Others keep failing - one buy from Frys and the other was bundle of my camera.I didn't buy expensive tripod and tried to find a cheap one, but my last try was failed.
With all the sports shots I take over the year,  this has been the perfect companion, Lightweight and compact and always ready a good shot since it helps you stabilize and balance

I got this today and am happy with it as it has a couple of features built into it that my old one did not have bubble levels on the tripod and the camera mount should make it easy to level. I did not like the gear mechanism as it is made of plastic but for the price I would buy again and the gear was very well cast. Looks good to and comes with the bag.

Found this and bought based on the reviews. This is a nice sturdy budget friendly tripod. it has metal gears to raise / lower the upper pedestal assembly (directly under the plate the camera sits on). There are plastic parts at the joints, but they seem more stout than others I've looked at or owned in the past (this is where others break typically). Thank you!
I purchased three of these for our paranormal investigations. They are awesome - sturdy, easy to attach equipment to, light-weight, and they come with a bag. Highly recommend.

Decent unit for the price. More sturdy than some of the other $20 tripods I have used. I’m rough on equipment and this is used in my metal shop to video cnc equipment. We’ll see how long it lasts. Does not include attachments FYI.
It was light weight and easily adjustable. After 1 year  the plasticsupport bracket broke and it is just past the return eligible date. I can no longer use it.

I got this for my dslr (I'm a newbie and this is my first one) as far as I can tell with my limited experience this this is a great tripod for the price. I have used it a couple of times and had no issues. It's also very light weight and comes with a carrying bag so it's easy to travel with.

Sturdy, convenient, affordable. This is my swamp tripod when I don't want to bring a more expensive one out to get muddy and wet. The extra supports on the bottom of the legs are a great addition to a tripod and help maintain support in muddier conditions that I deal with.

Awesome beginners tripod! I use this for my fujifulm instant camera! It is a bit hard to change the settings on, and mine came with a broken handle, but I didn't care much for it. Definitely go for this if you need a cheap easy to travel with tripod!

Honestly this tripod is really great. It's lightweight, convenient, compact, and for an amazon basic tripod it has pretty decent material. I also like the way it worked, I didn't even  know twisting the handle tightens the head tilt, I actually got really excited about it because I felt like I discovered something new that no one knew about. All in all, a really great product, highly recommend it for a cheap start out for a pretty decent and durable tripod.
The tripod is lightweight, easy to carry, and would be sufficient for a cell phone.  When used for Canon 6D Mark 2, the holder is not secure. It cannot support an attached lens.

I use this tripod for my chronograph.  It's a good height and plenty sturdy.  It also has a nice hook if you need to hang something and levels.  It comes with a good bag and you can compact it like most tripods.  Good price as well.
After reviewing the proper use instructions, I found this product to be excellent. I trust my most valuable camera equipment attached to it.

I use this Tripod to mount my C922x camera for twitch. I play music on twitch, and my old one broke. This extends in two sections, and has a turning handle to make the camera go up or down. Great product for the price !!
I use this for recording my Cheer practices, it is so nice! Love how it can be fully adjusted to whatever you like! So nice and great deal!

I was neglectful to get this product because it's cheap, but no regrets now after receiving it. It comes with many features that can be found in more expensive tripods, and I was very surprised it came with a handle at the base to hold the tripod like a steady cam.

For the price and design, this is a good tripod. I bought it for my Canon Rebel t7i and it holds the camera securely. I can twist and rotate it with ease - most of the time - and I don't feel like my camera is just going to pop off. I especially like that I can screw in the adapter so I can take off the camera when I need to, and then just put it right back the tripod.
This product is amazing! I love everything about it. For the price, it is easily one of the best cheap tripods. It's sturdy, good looking, and has a whole bunch of features!Pros:
I have bought it cause it was recommended for x25 binoculars, but the tripod absolutely failed. It's very shaky, just slightly better than holding the binoculars in hands
Multiple adjustment options, sturdy lightweight portable design with carry bag, excellent product for use with iPhone. Also buy Vastar universal smartphone tripod adaptor to secure iPhone.

Great value and great product. Nice, sturdy tripod...you can feel the quality. Works well.  Don't waste your money on a cheaper, lighter tripod like we did previously--just buy this one instead! Would have been 5 stars if a manual or tip sheet was included; it took a little time to figure out a few things. Recommend. I would greatly appreciate it if you could mark my review as helpful--thank you! :-)
Seriously great product.  Its every bit as good in every way as most tripods costing twice as much.  Very sturdy, lightweight, and easy to use.

My wife had to have this. And then it didnt lock properly and her $750 4K camera fell and broke. Do yourself a favor: buy a tripod that your camera attaches to directly not one (like this) where a plate mounts to the camera and then locks into the tripod.
These tripods are great, I love that I was a bit to get two of them for $40! They are ideal for multiple uses, in my case several multiple uses!

I got this to use with a light weight video camera.  I found that panning was jerky and is not good for videotaping.I bought the same tripod previously but thought I must have had a defective tripod because of the good reviews.  I had the same problems with the replacement.
Broke after I used it the second time.

I, like many others, received one where the panning handle didn't attach. It was missing the nut! Went to local hardware store (one that has multiple bins of screws/nuts/bolts to choose from) found a 1/4-20 SQUARE nut that was just a little too big, couldn't find the exact fit, ended up having to grind 3 sides to get it to fit in the slot, but after that, tripod works without issue. Also dropped a dab of silicone on the top of the nut to prevent it from falling out if I decide to remove the lever, included pics to show removal/nut placement ----- Overall seems like a good tripod for people on a budget that dont want to spend $100-$400, sturdy enough for my needs and very light weight

This tripod is great! For the amateur photographer this is what you need, not a 200 tripod from best buy, order this one now! You can literally manipulate the camera to any position you want. The only thing I am weary of is the plastic components used in the locking mechanism. Over time I'm sure this will wear and Ill make sure to keep an eye on it. Great product, thanks amazon basics.

Quite pleasantly surprised that this tripod is remarkably useful especially for what I paid for.  I'm not 100% sure about how durable this tripod is but all I can say is that I have already used this tripod multiple times.  I'm please that it is fairly easy to used and the built it leveler is quite accurate.
Amazing for the price and you really can't complain. Haven't had many issues with it and have used it dozens of times.If you're trying to save money on a tripod go for this one.

I bought this because I was in a pinch for a tripod.  I cant believe how complete this little tripod is. There is an adjustment for everything and it doesnt feel cheap at all. I wish I had a super cool camera to put on it instead of a webcam, but that will come.
Happy with my purchase. I don’t know if it’s user error or the product but there is one piece I cannot keep from pivoting and get right enough for it to stay in place.

I had high hopes considering Amazon Basics Items tend to be rather nice, but this tripod really was not the case. The whole unit is very flimsy and not smooth at all in operation. The quick release mount has a ton of movement and has an incredibly flimsy plastic catch. I tried using it with a not-too-heavy 40" slide and it wobbled horribly, and when my camera got to either end of the slide, the quick release would just pop right and and send all my equipment tumbling to the ground.If you need a cheap tripod for holding a relatively light camera, this will work. If you want a tripod that will last and has a modicum of usability with other equipment, I'd look elsewhere.
I didn't even know plastic could be made this thin and cheap.  I mean, I didn't expect professional grade quality for that price but I didn't think it would break the first time out either.
I amNOT a professional photographer.  For my purposes it is more than adequate.  Very sturdy legs that are easy to agjust.  Tilt and pan work well.  I like the quick mount and release system.
Very lightweight. Lots of points of articulation. Smooth side to side motion. Easy to collapse and adjust. The up-down movement is a little jerky. Good buy.
Product is easy to use, turns properly, is exactly what my daughter, who is a senior in college was looking for to practice photography.

Cheaply made tripod for the money. This tripod came as a package with my new full-frame DSLR order. I use a SLIK tripod on a daily basis and thought this can be a backup. Well, the legs are not exactly the same length, short by a bit over an inch on one leg... Good thing is this tripod has a level, you just have to spend a minute every time to level it if you are already on level grounds. Not a big deal, but it is a waste of time especially indoors. I will keep it in storage, and it may stay that way forever...

Amazon though of everything with this tripod! It is excellent. It adjusts to different heights, you can use your camera landscape or portrait, and it can be used on uneven terrain. My fiancé and I used this tripod to take our own engagement photos. We set up the tripod on a stream bank, on muddy ground, and on uneven terrain and I didn’t feel worried about my camera at all.

Great tripod.  I love all the different options you have with viewing angles using your cell phone.  The legs also adjust to different lengths and there is a lever in the middle which allows your camera to rise up even higher.  I paired this with the cell phone adapter here.Ulanzi ST-01

I was looking for a cheap tripod that is sturdy and won't break easily and I can safely assure you that this is it and it's super easy to mount my M50 on it and you can even shoot some smooth b-rolls!!

I got a tripod that came in the kit with my camera but I never felt safe putting my precious camera on it.  This one was suggested by a dear friend who has the same camera - canon t5i.  I love my camera and I love this tripod.  It does all I'd like it to do.  Including vertical and horizontal shots.  Has the levels on it.  Comes in a carry bag for convenience.  YAY!
I received this and put it to use right away.  I was amazed by the sturdiness and light weight, and even more so by the price.  It works like a charm & is cheap to boot!
Like the size and light weight frame, but plastic materials were brittle and broke on first use. Will recommend buying a better quality tripod and don’t waste your money.
There's a little play where it should be snug, but it's a nice tripod and I'm overall pleased with the purchase.Works for my purposes. Great for the money you pay.
Great for the price, but wouldn’t trust it for heavy camera and lens. But for lighter gear it’s a nice tripod and you can’t beat the price
This is a very cool and easy Tripod. super lightweight and it's very tall once you set it up it really stays in the same position with many ways to adjust. Great buy, you will not be sorry.

Lightweight is a good word to use.  And the fact it's mostly plastic means some of the motions of the tilt head aren't as smooth as I'd like.  If I'm careful and let things settle down before taking a picture, it works fine.

The price is nice but if you need a smooth swivel feature, look elsewhere. I used it to record some equestrian events and the swivel stuttered terribly causing the video to not have a smooth motion quality. I tried everything to get it to rotate better but no such luck. Unfortunately was past the return window or I would send it back.

This tripod is very lightweight, sturdy, and very stable. A great value for the price. I used both my 35mm & iPad with this tripod. There is a lever extend the tripod up and down. Easy carrying bag is also included.
Works as advertised. I use this as a tripod for a spotting scope.  Works well

I honestly spent hours looking at tripod reviews to figure out which one I should buy. I got this one because of the features and the price. It was lower priced than many of the tripods that I looked at but I'm not fancy. Just wanted a tripod. Well, this thing IS fancy! It has a removable foot that attaches to your camera so you can quickly remove your camera from the tripod if you want to switch between tripod and handheld shooting! It is heavy duty and I can't imagine it tearing up in my lifetime. I love the bag too! Thank you so much, Amazon, for making a super nice tripod affordable and such great quality at the same time!!!

This tripod works much better than the ratty old thing I had been using, an old cast-off from somewhere.  This one is light and handy, adjusts easily, and works smoothly.The attachment for the camera has it's own thumb-screw, no more fishing for a coin to tighten.  The tightening levers for the legs work to the side, which is much handier than the vertical levers I had on the old one.  And, a nice little carrying case.  Hard to go wrong.

Great for the price! Has all the bells and whistles of any tripod and comes in a nice little carrying bag. I have purchased again for my job and everyone that's used them like them. I've used for taking pictures and videos. My only qualm is that when taping video, even with it as loose as it will go, the head does not turn quite as smoothly as I would like but in the end the video is not that bad. Seemed worse when I was taping. The up and down motion is great.

This is just what I needed! I don't use a tripod with my work all that often, so I didn't need anything too fancy, but this is perfect for what I need it for. I love that you can hook your camera onto the top and then if you need to take it off quickly, there is a quick release lever so I can take it off quickly during a session....I just need to remember to put that piece back on the tripod for the next time I use it! Great buy at a great price. I've had no problems with it so far.

There is no shortage of $20 lightweight tripods available - most feel cheap and break easily with heavy usage. This Amazon Basics lightweight tripod is the most well built, highest quality lightweight tripod I have purchased. I continue to be impressed with the quality of Amazon Basics products - they are always good to great.

Offers a lot for the money. That's the key here. Much of the controls and levers look plasticy and cheaply made. For instance, the legs on the bottom of each pod rotates loosely on a plastic hinge. Doesn't look substantial. Previous tripod I had came with bigger tips that screwed out more than an inch to give it more stability especially on uneven ground.I intend to use this mainly indoors on level floors. Wouldn't take this on a field trip. Wouldn't trust its durability. But like I said for indoor shots it should work just fine.

great for the price. If you are however a professional Id invest in a better one. My only complaint about these less expensive tripods is the swivel at the top. It doesn't adjust easily enough. Very jerky and juttery to try and adjust it. I know some of the more high-end tripods are fluid when adjusting which makes it much easier.

I don't normally write reviews, but I just had to throw in a big "thumbs up" for this tripod.  For the price, I wasn't really expecting much.  But this thing is amazingly sturdy!  From the moment I first pulled it out of the included carrying bag, I could just feel the quality of of it.But the biggest surprise was yet to come!  This tripod contains features I didn't even know you could get on a tripod!  For example, the attachment base (or "foot" or whatever it's called) completely detaches from the rest of the tripod!  Since I pretty much use only my video camera on the tripod, I can just detach the base from the tripod and leave it attached to the video camera.  Then, whenever I want to re-attach the camera to the tripod, I can just pop the base back on in a second and I'm ready to go!

I waited too long to open this to be able to return it.  The screw in handle that lets you tighten the tilting joint wont engage the thread.  The other parts work fine but without being able to tighten the tilt joint the product is useless.  Materials look good and seem durable, but the product came in nonfunctional.  Will adjust the rating if I get a working replacement.

I had a tripod that was more than twice as expensive as this one and it totally fell apart.  This tripod has been sturdy and functional.  It's been a breeze to use and I love the little hook at the bottom of the main piece.  I use it to hang my camera bag on, though I see how it can also be used to hang weights from to add stability.  Overall, a great value.

Got my tripod today and so far it’s exactly as described on Amazon! Can’t wait to use it tonight with HD video camera so I can film football practice! Will revisit once I actually use it. For now it’s 5 stars!
Absolutely fantastic. Couldn’t ask for a better tripod. I love the levels that it has built in, as well as the quick release function.
I just received my tri[pd and am very surprised t how solid it is built. Everything works smooth and is easy to reach. I can't hardly wait for a clear night to use it!

This product was amazing till i lost my quick detach piece. Im very distraught about it because photography is a big coping skill for me. This product is a big necessity with nature and wildlife photography.  It is very durable, helpful and easy to use.

Really liked this tripod when I pulled it out of the bag. It felt nice and sturdy and looked well built. I used it once, stored it for a couple of months, pulled it out, and about the fourth time using it one of the clamps came loose on one of the legs. It still works but I have to rig it to get it to work. I may have simply gotten a lemon of a tripod.
Great tripod for easy and quick set - up. Worked like a charm for a school project and for our HUGE family Christmas photo session.

I absolutely love this tripod. This is my first tripod so I don't have anytjing to compare it to, but it is lightweight & sturdy. You can adjust it anyway you want to, and I love the two levels built into the tripod.It is a great value for the price. I highy recommend this tripod, especially for those such as myself who are new to serious photography.
Love it!Had to purchase this a 2nd time. I had bent the legs of the first one when I put the seat down in our truck which pinched it between 2 things.

This tripod is light weight and comes with a bag for storage. So far it has work well for me. I feel like the light weight of the tripod makes it feel cheaply made. I would recommend it for someone like me who would only use it occasionally and not for someone looking for professional grade product. It has all the standard features of a tripod.

Guess if you want a PRO tripod you have to pay a PRO price. This one is very nice and very versatile, but there are huge gaps even after securing all screws. I'm using it on a daily base and it's OK ... or a good OK ... but I have also one for $150 and that's a total different world.
This tripod is great for the price!!! I'm 6ft and it extends perfectly to my height when needed. Very easy to adjust, set up, and move. Also comes with a carrying case which was a nice surprise.

I use this Tripod frequently.. if buying it for your phone you may want to also purchase the extra connector piece. I did and I love it. I can use it for my camera and phone. Perfect for what I needed

Product was delivered as expected. Decent shipping time and packaged well. Good for the price. Not heavy duty but gets the job done. Compatible with both my Sony Cybershot (my kids use) as well as my Nikon DSLR. It's easy to store when not in use. It's kind of difficult to fit back in the carrying pouch but that's not a deal breaker for me. It gets quite a bit of use at my house so it pretty much just stays set up.
Really like the quick release feature . Easy set up , great tripod for the price will get many years of use . Plus has a carry handle too.

This tripod is fantastic. The level works just fine, the legs extend and lock like you'd want them to, when you lock the legs, the locks aren't too stiff or too weak.In short, (or long, since you can raise this up pretty high as well), this is a great buy for the money!  I'd buy this again In a heartbeat - and may do so for gifts this year.
Quite sturdy and easy to set up---an amazing value.  Thank you Amazon.  BTW--the first one received was damaged--they sent me a replacement next day--amazing!

This is a lifesaver tripod for me! It's lightweight, height adjustable, stable, professional looking, it comes with a bag and it is very handy and useful ever! I use this to mount my DSLR camera for pictures or taking videos.I even made a detailed VIDEO review of this in YouTube. Check it out, just copy and paste this link in youtube:
Just wanted a simple, sturdy, easy to use, reliable tripod to use for my c920 webcam. This is perfect, solidly works, and didn't cost an arm and a leg. So, can solidly recommend. 👊

This thing is fantastic for mounting smartphone and taking videos for youtube etc.  It is packed with useful parts - like the leg adjustments and easy clips, bag for storage and hanging, infinite adjustments for height.  I was pleasantly surprised! - You will need to buy a separate smartphone clip - and this thing is lightweight, so don't expect it to be pro grade, ... perfect and super handy for documenting movies with smart phone.  I LOVE IT!!

It’s a good cheap tripod but go ahead and save up the extra money and get a tripod with the 360 degree ball on top so you can move your camera easily and fast. I bought this one and regret it and never it now that I have one with the ball.

For the price, you can't beat it. As I get more involved in the world of photography, the need for a solid tripod becomes more and more apparent. Without wanting to drop $500+ on an expensive tripod, I thought I would try this one first and see if it met my needs. I couldn't be happier with the purchase.

It's too loud for hunting, but it's an excellent tripod for anything where stealth isnt a necessity. I had my spotting scope on it, no trouble. I also bought the binocular adapter, worked perfect for all my glass.
Excellent product to hold your camera tablet or phone I do lives on a daily basis and it’s help me a lot is very light weight and very easy to maneuver.
Works so well and very cheap. I bring it everywhere! (Don’t take it on a beach or you’ll get sand in  it oh no! Perfect for my camera (Nikon 3300)
WORKS GOOD, BUT LIKE A LOT OF AMAZON ITEMS, IT HAS AMAZON ON IT.  CUSTOMERS DON'T WANT THAT!  SHOW CUSTOMERS HOW TO TAKE YOUR NAME OFF!!
My son seemed pleased with this gift.  However I have not heard any further comments from  him so there's not much for me to review.
This item is perfect. I use it to hold my digital camera to film YouTube videos. Works perfectly. Perfect height. Very sturdy. Holds my camera in place.

Used this for a recent trip to Yosemite.  Used it to support my Nikon D300s.  The tripod was lightweight but sturdy.  I never felt that my camera was too heavy for the tripod.  I ended up losing a spring in the camera mount area on the trip, and it no longer snaps into place, but can still be put together by manually pushing and pulling the mount release lever.  Overall it is a great value for the price.
My absolute favorite tripod. I own 5 of these tripods and they are great. They hold up very well. I love how adjustable they are.
For the price you can't beat it but don't expect much more than cheap plastic. I had to reassemble the latching assembly at the top because it just popped out.
works well with light duty camera or camcorder, a little play in the movements, but  otherwise OK....not bad for the price point

Can't really beat the price. It's sturdy and does the job. Two oft repeated comments which I will re-emphasize: 1. It does not swivel or pan well, and therefore is not your first choice for video cameras, and 2. It is not a "travel" type tripod in that it doesn't collapse to a tiny size. That being said, it's a great tripod with a small footprint, works well, is lightweight yet stable... It is a nice all around inexpensive choice.
Cinderella story. Outta nowhere. A former greenskeeper, now, about to become the Masters champion. It looks like a mirac...It's in the hole! It's in the hole! It's in the hole!
it is not smooth in rotating left or right .. it jerks .. giving the camcorder recording a jumping view
Very nice to have a tripod for any type of cameracomes in 3 levels of height, very easy to work with.
Excelente artículoActualizacion luego de una semana:

This material feels a little weak, but I haven't had any concerns with its structural integrity in keeping my camera mounted safely. Compared to the other $200 tripod I had like this a few years back, there isn't a huge difference in quality (especially when you consider you're only paying 10% of the normal price for this tripod).  Great tripod for the money.

I am not a camera fanatic so I can say it does what it says and is easy to operate. I saw some bad reviews, but if you are not abusing this tripod, it is lightweight and even has a bubble level if you need the tripod level. Good buy.

Affordable tripod that does everything I'd expect from a more expensive one. Double-telescoping legs, removable clip-in mount, with a built-in level and tightening knobs to make for an easy use. Collapsing the whole thing to use the carrying handle or included travel bag just make it that much sweeter. Looking for an inexpensive but functional tripod, look no further.

Very lightweight, feels pretty flimsy -- don't know how durable it will be -- but then it's a $20 tripod.  It should probably receive 5 stars in it's class.  It's probably as good as any of the other cheap bottom tier tripods.  Just don't think you are getting $150 quality for $20 bucks.  If you just want something for indoor or occasional use, this will probably do the trick.  If your going to be dragging in into the woods and mountains, you may want to go with something a bit more rugged -- or you could buy 4 or 5 of these and just throw them away as they break.

Great tripod with lots of variety & options available. It's very sturdy & will be used a lot to hold our portable projector. Does exactly what's needed & more than expected. Glad I went with the 60 inch because it has more options.
Inexpensive means cheap here. Light-weight and not durable. Too much slop in gears, adjustments, fittings. Cannot recommend for binoculars or spotting scope.

Low cost basic tripod.  Have to treat it very delicately since it has plastic parts - no throwing things on top of it.  If you do that it should last.  I bought a $70 tripod and it broke in less than six months so I bought this cheaper one since they all seem to break unless you pay more than $300.
Very Great To Get This Awesome Tripod; It Is Super Nice For Anybody Usefulness. It Was A Great Buy; You Have To Get This Item With Fast Prime!!

This doesn’t come with any instructions, so I bought it and thought it was broken because the top piece (where the camera is mounted) was very loose and the wheel on the side wasn’t tightening it. Turns out to tighten the top, you have to turn the bottom of the long HANDLE. I’m sure this is obvious to some- but I definitely did not put that together. Great tripod after I figured that out!

Extremely versatile, contains all the functionality to take shots at varying heights and angles, and accommodate most cameras including smartphones.No real cons besides being fairly complicated to adjust and you need to buy a separate addon to attach smartphones.
It's a simple but good tripod. You can adjust the height, tilt, and direction. It can be locked into place and loosened to re-set.
Love it. I needed a tripod for light box photography as well as some outdoor shooting. Perfect. Inexpensive but decently made.
Wow what a handy device this has been. Its by far one of the easiest tripods I've used in some time and can be adapted to almost any situation.
For those who barely use a tripod, this one attends my need. It is my first one and bought not much because of a daily necessity but because it is better to have a tripod around in case of a need.

This tripod works just fine with my Kodak Z series camera and my Square Jellyfish universal cell phone holder. It comes in a basic carry case and has a hook on the bottom of the trip for the carry case and your camera bag. It adjusts all the way up so even someone as tall as myself at 6'6" can use it comfortably.Make sure you take time to see what adjusts what, then make it comfortable for you to use.
Bought this for my wife.  She photographs birds and has found this tripod to be easy to use and helpful.  Nothing but good things to say about it.

Love the product, It's light weight and easy to carry around. Not as sturdy as I would want it to be but it doesn't break the bank. This is my first tripod I have ever purchased, the only negative the way the locking mechanisms are setup is just awkward when your trying to setup on uneven ground, I don't know if this is for all tripods so take my review with a grain of salt.

Decent Tripod for the price, will hold a digital camera nicely.  I bought this for a large set of binoculars, should have got a heavier duty tripod as it is kind of wobbly with more weight.  Still...not a bad tripod.

I am so pleased with this purchase. I dont think you can get any better quality than with this tripod. It is perfect in everyway! Comes with its own carrying case. Its very versitile, you can adjust this thing a dozen ways!
I'm newbie learner and just started using it but I'm loving it already.  thanks amazon for bringing out a product like this. nothing can beat quality and price of amazonbasics.

Not so lightweight. About 3 pounds. Pretty good, but not as lightweight and durable as the one I had before that was lost and still miss. It's basic. Works well. Have added a carabiner and a cloth bag to weight it down while shooting or will just use my camera bag. Probably would have a stability problem in high winds.

This is a nice, inexpensive tripod for anyone who needs a basic tripod but doesn't want to spend to much.  I've used this with my Nikon D3200 for family portraits, landscape and wildlife shots.  The levels really help when using the tripod outdoors on uneven ground.  I haven't used a long telephoto lens with tripod so not too sure if it would tilt over or not.  I don't feel it would.  The legs are steady and sturdy when standing.

First time using the tripod it got stuck to my camera because the hot shoe pin kept jamming somehow. Terrible waste of money and it ruined the bottom of my camera! It looked used also, seems like someone returned it and they just shipped it to me as if it was new.

Simple and basic tripod. It works as expected and came in a nice carrying case. A suggestion I would say, is if this is a basic product, it will probably be used by a beginner. I would love to see markings on the legs for lining up the length for different heights. I can't attest to the durability of it, however, it doesn't seem to be overly impressive.
I am very happy with this tripod so far.  It's not super-dooper sturdy for professional use, but for my uses, it is great for the price point.

Bought this for Hawaii for all the hikes because my original tripod was too big to fit in my backpack. So I decided to get this in a smaller size. I ended up not using it during my Hawaii trip, however it'll be great for other adventures. So far loving it. Color looks great and height was just perfect

Great value - it's a sturdy, easy to use tripod.  For the price, I am quite happy.  It's light and the case to carry it is great, works fine with my Canon Rebel 3.  The 4 star is because I find it hard to level the three legs.  There are these plastic clamps that hold each leg and you have to really fuss with it to get each leg level, plus the levels on the tripod are. pretty small, but for the price, it's a small nuisance, you can get it right after a few minutes of fussing.

Sturdier than my other low-end tripod but has the typical problem of it being very sticky, so don't expect to ever do a smooth camera pan with this tripod! If you need a tripod just to hold your camera still than this will do the trick. If you're looking to use it for camera movement I would go with something else. Have a found a low-end tripod that I can do a clean pan with? No not yet and I may never find one! Might just have to invest in a high quality one.

Lightweight, Full control, Full-of-Features. Great for hiking and home use. Worst feature is how light it is. high wind and vibration will affect this tripod's performance. The included hook at the bottom for this purpose works great to ameliorate this negative.

Really a great deal.  light weight yet sturdy  3 expansion point on all the legs  plus a crank up center  great for shooting over a crowd.easy off and on camera mount,  nice long tilt and swing handle come with a carrying / storage  case for under $20  best  deal I could  find
Perfect! Everything I would expect including tilt and swivel. Great Price too!

I absolutely LOVE this product. It's very lightweight, so I wouldn't use it for professional grade photos; just something for my selfies and pictures with family and friends.  I wouldn't say it's professional grade because it feels a little flimsy, but for the price, it's everything I wanted and expect it to be. It doesn't have a phone holder, but the one on my selfie stick fits on this stand just fine.
Pros:Cheap

I bought this for a spotting scope that my kids use.  Somehow they broke their old tripod that came with their scope so I had to do something.  Knowing that my kids can be destructive I was not going to invest a lot of money and this device seemed to be a cheap quick fix.The tripod is robust in design. All moving parts move easily and lock soundly.  It is stable with a heavy scope in 20 plus MPH winds.  For the money this is a great piece of gear that I believe will last.

What a great product.  I liked the weight of the tripod, light but durable.  I would have like instruction on how to operate all the features, but I think I figured it out.  Love the height and the telescoping neck that extends the holder.  The bag fit snugly, but it's a nice feature and makes the tripod easy to transport.
I really like this tripod, like all Amazon essentials stuff it’s well made and it does what is supposed to do well. Good quality. Well made, I use it to hold an iPad Pro and it works well for that.

This tripod is working really well for me. It makes sense and is uncomplicated to use.There are two issues. First, there is a small plastic piece that fell off of the tripod that I can't figure out where it goes. It hasn't seemed to affect the performance of the tripod so I haven't removed any stars.
Lesson learned. When the price seems to good to be true, it probably is. Tripod fell apart after less that two months of light and careful use.

You get what you pay for. Still a pretty good tripod overall, although it's not perfect. I've been using this tripod for whenever I'm going to the beach to avoid dirtying my expensive tripods. Like I said, you get what you pay for & I think overall it's pretty good.

Oh the modifications to this tripod!!! I am in HEAVEN!! It has many different adjustments that you can make, not just the standard tilt and spin. I would repurchase this tripod and have already recommended this to friends. The black parts are all plastic, so I am not certain how many years it will last, but for less than $30 it is still very much worth the purchase.

Functionality seems fine, but it arrived dirty and scratched up. Super annoying to receive a "new" item in this condition. It's unclear if it's a return and repackage or if it was stored in a dirty warehouse, but it's just at the price point where returning for a replacement would be an even bigger hassle.

Pretty good quality. A bit heavier and larger than expected when shrunk to its smallest size, hence the 4/5 stars. Otherwise I would have given 5 stars. Not really a portable tripod. Worth it in function and quality though. The shoulder strap bag is handy when traveling. The snap legs are very good quality and hold the tripod steady. The feet are good and adapt to surface. Works really well on uneven ground. Also the handle is good if you wanna lug it around instead of putting it back in the bag.
If you're not a pro, this tripod will make you a pro.One of the best deals from Amazon ever!!

This was my first tripod. Not the smoothest pan, but reliable and affordable. The pan actually got smoother after lots of use. Used to use it for my camera, now it holds my audio recorder and wireless receiver.

Simple tripod, not weighted.  The detach shoe fits the standard threaded socket on the bottom of any camera that is so equipped.  The leg brakes - those that hold the extendible legs in place when extended - don't slip.  If that's what you need, buy this and don't spend the extra money on brand names.

This is a good product for beginning photographer. It is portable and easy to carry and position because of the handle in the back. It also has a stabilizer indicator which makes it easy to tell if everything is set up straight.

The tripod works exactly as it should, and is very stable in terms of the legs and the extension neck at the top. The axis motions are smooth and are easily locked. However, the clamp that fastens the camera in place is not particularly tight. There is a sort of spring-loaded tab that holds the clamp open when there is no camera, and that tab keeps the camera in place against the clamp, but there is a few millimeters of give. I don't know if that is a particularly clear explanation, but the result is that there is some springiness between the camera and the tripod.

the 1st time used this inexpensive tripod failed - the leg extended and the clear plastic "compression sleeve" fell out of the clamp area rendering the extension useless. lucky to have had gaffers tape to keep the extended leg... well extended. ha

I dont know much about tripods but this one seems to have it all.  For the money i'd say it's a heck of a deal.  If you have a 4 pound $10,000 camera, then spend a couple hundred more and buy a professional grade tripod.  This one works beyond my expectations.
Amazon does it again, making a quality item for a great price. Keep it up - great tripod.  Love your line of products.
I use to have the original from 2 years ago and it just broke and was madd flimsy. But this version is wayyyyy better!

The quality for the price is amazing! This is a very good starter tripod... It is lightweight but sturdy not lightweight in a way that makes you think it's going to bend and break. It has all kinds of features like the camera quick release, the telescoping crank up center adjustment to get just the perfect camera hight, the 3 different leg heights that lock in, the smooth moving camera arm that allows you to move from side to side or in a complete circle! I'm very happy with this tripod!!!

Great deal for two tripods.  I'm not a pro, and didn't want to spend an arm and a leg on a super expensive tripod.  These seem very well made and sturdy.  I was honestly surprised at how well they are made for the low price.

Considering the price it's a good tripod for small cameras. So far I've used it with my phone only. The only thing that I don't like is the pan.  Its not smooth at all, I can still pan but it requires some effort and it looks kind of choppy. The tilt works great and smooth. So if you're planning to use it for static shots it's great, but  it might be hard to follow a moving object.

I purchased my Amazon Basics 60-Inch Lightweight Tripod because I needed to use it with my Ipad mini 3 to take pictures.  It is very easy to work with it is light and easy to carry with the included bag.  The only thing I needed to do is pull down the legs and attache the cradle for my Ipad mini then start taking pictures.  I would recommend this tripod for anyone whose looking for a tripod for their camera, ipad, or etc.
Love, love love this. Dont buy name brand as this amazon product is wonderful. It is just as good as name brand for lower price. Bought this to hold up my camera for my wedding.
Perfect tripod for iPad video shooting. Lightweight and easy to set up.  I bought an iPad holder attachment as well. Pair works well together.

Great for the price - but as should probably be expected not well put together.Don't try to do long exposure stuff with it as the smallest movement can mess up your shot but for a cheap tripod, it did well.
Pairs well with my Nikon D5600 and is very stable i mean it has to be to put a 600 dollar camera on it. This is a definite great buy.

This tripod is great for someone who is just starting out.  I bought one of these back in 2012 and I haven't had a single issue with it in terms of breaking or just wear and tear.  I've tested it's durability too by taking it out in the woods multiple times, using it in water, using it in snow, and just typical dropping/bumping it against stuff.  At the time, I was just looking for a tripod for my Canon T3i and didn't want to spend a lot of money.  This one has really impressed me and the only reason I don't use it now is because I need one that is sturdier and can hold more weight.  As I said though, this is a great option for anyone who's just starting out in photography or video.  I never had a problem with it when I was using my T3i, however I've since acquired a Black Magic Cinema Camera and it is pretty heavy.  This tripod wobbles too much when using it, but it wasn't built for that type of use.  If you're looking for a simple tripod that'll get the job done, I would recommend this one.

You get what you pay for. This tripod gets the job done just fine but is definitely not as stable or as sturdy as a more expensive one. The metal parts are fine but the plastic feels a little cheap. Not bad for the price though.
This is the nicest tripod for the price I’ve seen on Amazon!! Extremely light aluminum, after fully extended way taller than I thought. Exactly what I wanted!!
I LOVE this tripod! Very sturdy! Easily adjusted! Heavy-duty! I wish I had found this 5 years ago when I bought a super flimsy one. This one will last me forever!
I seen other bad reviews about it not staying in place and falling over. I've had this for a couple months and have not had any problems. The the price it's a great deal.
I broke off the little metal button screwing on my camera, i know i should have looked at the paperwork.. still works for my needs lol.
I bought this to replace the cheap tripod that came with my cheap spotting scope. It feels sturdy and will do the job.

This tripod was purchased ro replace my previous tripod that came up missing after an oil change. This is a bit more flimsy than I expected, but it does the job. The aluminum legs are a thin gauge aluminum, and the arm movement on the mount is choppy, not a good bet if you plan to use it for smooth video capture.
I could set up my projector for the holidays and this was just what I needed. It assembles easily and is adjustable.
Nothing complicated with this tripod, decently built, fairly sturdy. Not pro by any stretch but will do in most cases.
For the price this is great. Ibuse it to hold a spotting scope. Easy to set up and adjust.
It is sturdy and easy to open up. The only issue I have is with panning vertically or horizontally, it can be choppy even when loose.

Great Tripod for a Great price! I would recommend this tripod to anyone looking for a nice, not over-priced camera tripod. The unit is quite sturdy and is equipped with two levels to help ensure your camera is level (if necessary to check). The movement for side-to-side and up/down is smooth, and everything easily locks in place if you do not want movement. The tripod easily sets up and breaks down and has a convenient storage tote bag.

I am so happy with this tripod - i have never owned one and when i decided i need one - to record my family for christmas, nothing major - i started researching and reading all the reviews and stats of each tripod and the cost of them all is really time consuming and frustrating - i couldnt figure out what i needed...but for 20 dollars - this one is AWESOME - it is sturdy - has GREAT features and if you are not a professional - if this if for your family - this is the one for you!!  and im pretty sure - even if i was professional - this thing would still be amazing!!!!

Very functional and will last longer with very light use. However, I've had it for 2 months and a rivet came out of the leg-spreading mechanism (no pun intended).  One leg of the tripod is just free dangling now. I have it tied with string until I can order one of better quality. It only cost $20 so that's a plus.

I am not a photographer. Just a regular guy. I recently purchased a device that allows me to control the camera from a smart phone. This tripod works great for me. Decent carry bag with shoulder strap. Light weight.😁
I am a beginning photographer.  I use the tripod with a medium-sized super-zoom camera.  I shoot outdoors in wilderness settings.PROS:
very reasonably priced - bought an additional attachment for my cell phone and it's a little flimsy but it works okay
Better than expectedEasy setup, lightweight, decent quality, extremely portable.

I've used this tripod occasionally over the last year or so.  Every time I use it I'm impressed with the quality of the tripod for the price.  Again, I've probably only used it 4-5 times over the past year, but whenever I do I'm pleased by both the operation and how easily the tripod folds down for storage.
All hold downs remain useable.  No screws have stripped and all adjustments continue to hold true with no movement once set.  2 years of average use and no issues.  Recommend a BUY.

Just received the tripod.  There are no instructions but tutorial on Amazon if you need instruction.  I am an amateur so I needed instruction.  Easy to operate.  Love it.  Price is right for my need.  You must Buy!!!!
Perfect for holding a fairly heavy spotting scope. Great stability but still light weight for transporting easily.

Product is great. Stands taller than me at its max! And im 5'6". For the price of $31, its a decent tripod. Plastic material its made from does the job. Id be scared tho to see this thing fall on its own; seems not too durable if had a fall/drop.Mayb my specific order, but i bought it labelled NEW. When opened product, there were several scratches already on it (see pics). It also looked like a camera was mounted on it before!!!!!

This is a very nice reasonably priced tripod. I have had no issues with it and would recommend it to anyone. It functions well and all of the adjustment points are very secure feeling. It is stable and also lightweight. This is great for video and still pictures. We have used this both inside and outside with great results

Good tripod overall but I was disappointed with the fact that there was no proper threaded tract created for the threaded end of the angle adjusting tripod handle to go into. Instead there's just an empty space within. Had to use plumbing tape on the threaded end of the handle but still worried my camera might fall and break.

This is as good as any tripod I've seen for 4 times the price.  Don't mess around if you need one.  This is perfect.  It's light, sturdy, well built, and a great design.  Hand crank up to go higher and flip on its side for long ways video chat.  I love it.  Just be sure to buy a selfie stick if you need some phone holders.

I love it - I was surprised to find levels on it so that was a bonus - maybe I just didn't notice it in the product description but it helps to make sure I'm level when I'm out in fields and whatnot.Very easy to set up, lightweight and honestly my favorite christmas gift (I received it from one of my kids - it was on my amazon wishlist).

I bought this Amazon tripod for a trip to Montana and Yellowstone Park.  It worked flawlessly!  It was light enough to carry around all day and strong enough to handle many different setups.  The aluminium is sturdy and solid!  I didn't worry about it collapsing.  Of course you may want a standard tripod if you have large telephoto lenses.  All moving parts worked well.  For what I paid for it ($25) I was a little unsure of it's quality, but it performed way above expectations!  What a deal!  Keep up the good work Amazon!
Luv this tripod !!! It’s a great value for the money . I’ve just stared taking pics so this is my first but it has done great so far.
Excellent product, BUT if you don't know how to use it, don't expect a manual.  There are implements on it that I cannot figure out how to use.

We finally used this after buying it and we LOVE it! The height is amazing & we love the handle, it was pretty awesome to have when taking back to school photos of our kids, carrying it around to and from each shot! It worked awesome!

The tripod comes with alot of nice feathers. I mounted a spotting scope on it which weighs 2.9 Lbs. (It's rated for 6 Lbs.) The tripod is too whobbly, and the legs bow slightly when fully extended. As long as you don't touch any part of the scope or tripod, and there isn't a breeze, it functions

This product is amazing! It is very easy to use and built to last.  Takes seconds to setup. It has a built in balance bubble, so you can adjust the legs to make it stand straight.  You can easily attach and detach your camera.  I was able to use my canon rebel t5i and go pro hero (you need an adapter attachment for the go pro, cost around $3-$5 on amazon).  Its very light and comes a bag for easy travel access.  The only downside to this is that the wind can easily knock it down when it is at full height.  Although there is a hook at the bottom which you can attach something heavy to keep it in place.

We started with the 50" AmazonBasics model.  It was more for cell phones and tiny point and shoot cameras.  A bit too flimsy for the daughter's new DSLR.  This 60" tripod is solid and well built.  Definitely a better match for a bit bigger camera.  Still light weight and folds up very small.  Too bad it's not that cool bronze color but this is a very decent tripod.
Every time I take this tripod outside , to the beach, park , pool etc .. People always wonder how much it cost .. they can not believed the price is so low. Best for its price by far !!!!

This is a must have tripod for anyone! Very simple to use, great price and great quality! This tripod expands up to 60 inches, provides great stability and quick latch for removing/placing your camera on the tripod. I would recommend to beginners or experienced photographers! Great for traveling!
Works really well. Has been very sturdy and is convenient to transport. The bag has a shoulder strap and it is fairly good size to carry.
I am happy with the purchase. The item is very easy to use and is flexible to hold my WebCam. In addition, the price is quite reasonable.

I loved this when it first came. It was affordable and got the job done. But with 2 weeks of LIGHT USE, one of the legs fell off. That was almost 2 years ago, and the tripod has been sitting in a closet ever since. I saw it this morning and got frustrated all over again, hence this review. I like AmazonBasics products, but NOT this one.
alot of cool features but execution on product quality is bad. lasted 1 weekend shooting a music festival before it started to fall to pieces. but really what do u expect. get what you pay for

Easy to work with and the bag strap is just large enough to use across body comfortably (granted I am on the smaller side at 5'5"). Works well with any DSLR, I use a canon rebel t5i and have had no problems with a multitude of ground types.
Loved this stand. I have had it for over a year and it works well. It is sturdy and gets the job done! I use it for my phone as well.

I used this once and then it wouldn't fold back up. I tried, my parents tried, to no avail. Recently I tried again and with a very light pull a piece snapped off. Save yourself the trouble and get a well made product.

I got the 2-pack of this tripod and, I must say, I was quite pleased! Everything moves smoothly and it is EXTREMELY lightweight. I bought this because I needed another tripod but I also needed it for a Santa set my family put together over the winter months and it did the job well. I would definitely purchase this set, again!

I am absolutely impressed with this product. I will be buying another one for my other camera.It is sturdy, functional, lightweight, and very easy to use. If you are in the market for a tripod I would highly recommend this one
if you're on budget, this is the perfect tripod to buy. the build quality is good but not perfect, but over all i like it a lot specially the balance bubble. i recommend it

Perfect for my needs! It's light weight, durable (at least so far- I have been using it for a month) and compact.  I am a dog trainer and bring this around to record my training sessions and it works great.  I'd buy it again in a second.

This camera has been nothing but trouble.  The video image is terrible, the user interface is terrible and now that I am out of my return window, I see that my iMac doesn't recognize the device.  Now that I actually need it, I can't use it.  I am beyond disappointed.

Does the job, about as well as you could expect for the price. I shoot with the D3300 which is a pretty lightweight camera, with just the kit lens, but it felt like the tripod couldn't really support the weight. Luckily it didn't fall over, but I would not recommend this tripod. It's not worth the risk of it falling over and busting your camera. Spend more to get something nicer.
Works fine on solid surface with no wind. Drawbacks are the up and down adjustment is cheap plastic and not the best for adjusting up and Dow quickly. For the price it’s hard to beat.
works great! very sturdy. Took it to the beach and took great pics with it! Very happy with this purchase! Highly recommended it!

Awesome! don't have a ton of experience with tripods for cameras, but honestly couldn't imagine what else you would want. Tons of adjustments, built in level and weight hook. This even comes with a carry bag!
This was good for the price. It's not as sturdy as i would like it to be but you get what you pay for. I use it often for small family events and amateur photoshoots.
Tripod itself is great. But a part is broken after about 3 uses with no reason. I haven't used it a while and took it out and came like the picture and I couldn't return it.

I purchased this tripod for use with my Cannon 70D.  I am photographing a large house both interior and exterior.  I am very happy with this tripod.  It is easy to adjust to the perfect height and level.  I purchased a different tripod for my husband on Amazon 2 yrs ago and a similar price but this one is the better.  It comes with a nice carrying bag as well.

This tripod works very well. The settings that it has are easy to use and are easily adjustable. My only concern is with the lightweight aspect. Like any other tripod, you risk tipping on uneven surfaces. This tripod has very sturdy legs, but an uneven ground and a heavy camera could use some adjusting. Still, amazing results and great stability.

This is a very basic, beginners tripod. It has a decent tilt/swivel head and telescoping riser for the camera, and the legs extend back and forth with ease.What kills the quality on this tripod are the completely flimsy, loose-fitting rivets on the metal bars that connect the lower legs to the center column. I don't know how else to describe them. They are completely flimsy, and I wouldn't be surprised if they didn't fall apart after even moderate use.

Overkill for what I was going to use it for, simple point and shoot camera and cell phone camera. This product was made so well that I decided to keep it anyway. I was originally looking for something small and lightweight that I could carry on vacation like to Disney. Though this stand is lightweight, it's a little large even when folded up. So I plan on keeping it around for the occasional big family photo and bringing it along on road trips where I can just pull it out from the car.

This product is pretty great! It's very light weight and easy to carry around. The handle on the tripod is really quite nice! Not only that, but it has all of the functions I need right now. I was a little afraid it wouldn't be sturdy enough to hold me Canon Rebel T3i, but it works perfectly. It's also super nice that the base that attaches to the camera can stay attached to the camera so mounting takes only a few seconds. I'm only a student right now, and I needed it for class. It did exactly what I needed it to. I've used it a lot and it still works like it's brand new! I highly suggest this product if you are looking for a basic tripod!
Love this tripod. I wasn't expecting the great quality for the price. It has all the cool additions of one of those pricey branded one. Very sturdy & lightweight easy to carry around.

We purchased this tripod to replace our old Ambico with a missing quick release pad. Since that company no longer exists, parts are hard to find or pricey. The Amazon Basics 60 inch is identical to our Ambico and seems to be well made. Maybe not the best in the eye of a hardcore photographer but suits our need for family portraits at gatherings a few times a year. The price point for what you are getting, in today's terms is awesome! "Nonna and Pappa", give it two thumbs up!

This tripod was exactly what I was needing for you tube videos. It adjusts just about everywhere. It also has a bubble leveler. I love that it comes with a case to carry it. It is well constructed and sturdy.
This trip is fantastic and a great price point. Easy to use and set up. Does have a level on the side so you can make sure you’re straight on. Very light weight and comes with a carry case.
Very happy with this as someone that has been shooting a while this is great quality for the price love it. If your afraid to buy because it’s just too affordable here’s a sign now to just buy it.
Great product. I do not know how they can build such a incredible tripod like this for $21.07. I do not know what else you could ask for in a tripod.
I like how the legs can be adjusted.  It's replacing my older tripod that served it's purpose for over 15 yrs.

Wow! I must say I'm really impressed with this tripod! I just bought a Nikon Coolpix b500 and I needed a tripod too this met all my needs. It's not thin an it's super cool with the bag! I would advice anyone to get this

It's simply fit to work perfectly. This is very light, very easy to use and can be raised up as much as you want (of course upto 60 inch, I will hardly use anything taller for a great shot). You just have to rotate the small handle on the top in order to increase the height. You can also give it more height by lengthening the three legs. It is easily portable and came in a package with a carrying case. There is a 'level' on the top which allows you to verify a balanced frame. I was able to make a nice video without much hassle, thanks to this. Really impressed with the product.
Good basic tripod. Works for my canon. Easy to fold but it's hard to get back into the bag. Would recommend for beginners getting into photography.
This tripod is nice and sturdy. It was a little heavier than I expected but that's my own fault for not reading the description. It's made very well and sturdy.
I like it because its lightweight and the price was pretty good. Easy to set up and use. Unfortunately because it is lightweight, it's difficult to use to windy conditions.

This tripod offers excellent value for the money. it is just what I was looking for when I needed to replace a similar one that finally broke after about 10 years. With telescoping legs, a level, and multiple options to fit in your camera you really can't go wrong with tripod. It's light enough to carry easily (and comes with a carry case!) and yet not too heavy that it's a burden.Bottom line: I would buy it again.
Love this item. It is very compact and light and at full extension it is almost as tall as me around 6ft. It is an awesome starting stand if you are looking for a cheaper option.

Ive used this for about 10 hours, in unchallenging conditions.  I mounted my Iphone on a separate mount, and am measuring tree heights.  The bullseye level on the legs is off.  It does not rotate easily.  Using the Theodolite App, my IPhone skews 10 degrees rotating upward 50 degrees, and rarely stays level.  It works for my purposes.
Better than i expected. Nothing to brag about, but if your not serious about having a tripod than it will do.
Works great one of the legs keeps getting stuck but I may have been the cause of it but so far still kinda works

Nice tripod for those just starting photography. The Amazon basic tripod is very affordable, lightweight, and can be adjusted to any height up tp 60 inches. Convenient for family photos, and outdoor photography. A MUST for the beginner, and well worth the price!

The tripod seems great at first but the second time i mounted my camera, it will not unscrew from my camera!Also reached out to Amazon Requesting a replacement for the battery grip that it cracked as i tried removing the mount, no help! 6-7 people switched in between helping and not one said anything helpful or tried to resolve the issue by replacing the items THEIR LRODUCT DESTROYED.
There is a small plate which screws into the camera bottom, then snaps into the tripod AND, I lost that plate- can I order a couple extra plates?

this camera stand is a terribly poor quality - cheap plastic. mine arrived already broken, which i had read about from another review but figured it was just bad luck for that buyer... i was wrong.  unfortunately i opened the box past the return date so am stuck using duck tape to try to make it work. will be ordering a new one from a more reputable seller with better reviews and a more sturdy piece of equipment.
