It's a good tripod, as long as you are careful with it.  If you break it, it is at a disposable cost for easy replacement.
Great tripod and it comes with a carrying bag! We love it and it adjusts very easily and in many different ways.
This rubber gasket/ring fell off as soon as i tried setting it up on it's legs. I'm not sure where it was supposed to be. Other than that, the tripod seems to be ok for light amateur photography.

This tripod is lightweight, which is its best feature. It doesn't feel as sturdy as some more expensive models, but it is certainly holding up well and far cheaper than most tripods on the market of this quality.
Legs broke after a couple of uses, would recommend spending a little bit more to get something that will last.
Great quality! Very lightweight and stable. Easy to use.
Didn’t need anything fancy and this worked perfectly!

This is a very versatile stand for a very affordable price. It is right about the money you pay when it comes to durability. The structure is kind of not sturdy to be your tripod forever. Parts are a little bit not the best but very good looking.
This seriously needs like a million stars!! I am an amateur photographer and this works perfectly for what I need. It wasn't too costly and allows for multiple angles to get that perfect picture!!

At first this tripod seems difficult to use. How to manipulate each of the axis' isn't as straight forward as one would think, but with trial and error it becomes easier to use. It's very light and very sturdy. I now take it every where.

you pretty much get what you pay for this. It's not terrible, but it's sturdy and stability are great. When I first opened it up a small plastic piece popped off and went into the middle of nowhere. I don't know what happened to it. It didn't really affect the utility of the thing though. If you need to do is take a couple of pictures standing still this will do the job.

You have to buy a separate thing to attach your phone. Setup is not user friendly. If you want something for a camera that you're not going to be moving or putting up and down, it would be fine. Returning.

Love the tripod. Works great, very economical and works better than some nicer tripods I've owned. Would really love if they made additional quick release plates so I can add this to other items to truly make it a quick release option for multiple items.

So far it's awesome. Held my camera perfectly and gets very tall which is good for me being about 6'. Has levels on it to make sure everything is well... Level. Pretty much does exactly what I need it to do.
Pretty sturdy for a basic tripod.  Have used it with still, video and trail cams as well as a Med size telescope.  Adjustments are not very precise, but everything is smooth & firm.
I throw this in the back of my pickup and use it mostly outdoors. It hasn't rusted or shown any sign of where so far, so I'm pretty happy with it!

I absolutely love this tripod! It’s so lightweight, and surprisingly sturdy. When I first pulled it out of the box, I sort of thought, “well, this is too light to be quality.” Wrong. Way wrong. This was just such a great purchase— I have yet to purchase anything from the amazon basics line that I didn’t like.
Does the job with most small cameras and lighting fixtures, but I wouldn't hang a Hasselblad on it....LOL

Nice light weight tripod.  If I was a pro photographer I would has bought another heavier duty tripod.  I am an occasional recreational photographer and this will do the job.  I like the light weight and the nylon carry/storage bag.  I wish the camera mount was more stout, but you get what you pay for.  I think this tripod was a good buy because of the features and the price.

Very sturdy tripod. .Bought to replace old tripod that broke  Easily adjusts leg positions.. I like the fact that it came with a carry bag and is collapsible when not in use. Price was very reasonable.
Overall nice, but top flexes a bit so if you need 100% stillness you will need a sturdier product

This is an excellent tripod. We used it on our trip to Iceland and couldn't be happier with the results!Only thing that I was not fully happy with was the crank to move the camera vertically, it is a little bit flimsy. Otherwise this is a great purchase!
Very basic, but for its price its good and does the job.

Love it. I have nothing to compare it to but... this is exactly what I needed and the price was right.  It's sturdy, looks and feels quality for the price.  All legs telescope and are adjustable so height is never an issue.  Camera stand has the quick mount which I love.  Even a little tote bag to carry it to my son's soccer games.  Definitely recommended for a casual cameraman such as myself.

Got a chance to try and use this this past weekend as a storm was rolling in.  It was lightweight, set up was quick, but a strong wind blew it over.  Thankfully I hadn't synced the remote shutter yet and was able to catch it before it fell completely over.  Other than that this seems like a good, cheap investment.
I mean for the price, you can't beat it. It is sturdy and most definitely does the job.
It did great with a sony a6000. It's light and easy to set up, move around, level, set up again for a better shot, and its pretty compact when it's time to go
Great product for the cost. So much adjustment. One of the rivets broke when traveling but I replaced it.
Very happy with this tripod. Adjustable and inexpensive!
Lightweight and sturdy. Perfect for photography and easy to set up and adjust. Definitely worth the price.
This is a great value. It’s pretty well constructed for being so affordable. I love that you can pop off the camera platform for easy adding/removal of your camera or tripod head extension.
I used this for my projector. It holds the projector well. Looks sturdy and does the job.
Great ! Very good for plein air painting.
Works perfect for holding my camcorder

I have my doubts about this tripod. The levers used to clamp the legs in place are VERY flimsy. That's what broke on my old tripod which had much higher quality clamps. Don't much care for the way the camera attaches compared to my old pod either. I suppose only time will tell.
Mine broke after a few days of having it and now my camera has dropped twice because of it
Works great. Product is as advertised.

Works great for my public presentations. Nice and sturdy. Easy to set up and take down. Be care to make sure your phone is screwed tightly in place or it might fall out the grip. This equipment is a nice compliment for a freelance photographer or videographer.
It's collapsible. Multiple areas of adjustments for perfectionist. A must own for anyone with a Digital Camera.
Ideal for all my widelife needs and for a spotting scope for shooting at 100-300yards!

Totally serves my purchases and the price was great. I was considering much more expensive tripods and am glad I saw this one. I don't need it for heavy duty work so more demanding shoots may not work with this. But it's stable, light weight can be adjusted to a to an pretty good range of heights and does exactly what it should. I'm very pleased with the purchase.

The first time I opened it and set it up the black column holder where the hood is came apart with a black ring loose. I have no idea how to put it back together. Nothing seems to make sense in how that goes.However, I was able to use the tripod even tho it is difficult to close it
Overall it’s pretty nice but it came missing a piece that doesn’t allow handle to lock in place.

Super light weight, very easy and quick setup. I am clumpsy and dropped it a few times from my height of approximately from my hands at 5 ft (I am 6ft). Bought this along with a cellphone mount for my Pixel to take astrophotography shots.  Works PERFECTLY
Works well with and fits a sony A68.
Easy assembly, light weight, perfect
Inside thisbfornan out door record with my zoom H6 it was fantastic.
I love this thing! It's lightweight and perfect for my needs.

This tripod is amazing for the price.  It is very lightweight and the build quality seems very good too.  It is very easy to adjust and is a nice simple tripod.  I like that it has a built in level so you can keep you camera level and straight.  Comes with a nice carrying bag and for the price I don't think it can be beat.

I was skeptical to purchase because of some of the negative reviews but I AM SO GLAD IT DID!! This is really nice qualify. It is very sturdy and great for the YouTube videos that I make. It is 1000x better than the one that I had previously but I would highly recommend it!
Good tripod for the cost. Light weight. Using this for recreational use.

for the price this is great. Sturdier than i had expected and works well so far.
It was a great product,  but not very strong. It took one minor bump and the leg completely snapped off. I was a bit disappointed that it broke so easily.
Soo much better than my 35 year old pod. Well thought out and light weight. Really happy with it. Probably would get the 50" for overseas travel though.
Good quality for price and need. Very lightweight so will be easy to carry around with. Easy to extend and put away.

I love this tripod. It works great with my camera and is very easy to use. The handle is perfect for those times when you need to move the tripod short (or long) distances without having to put the whole thing away. Good quality. Very happy.

Okay tripod not durable and wont last . Mine wouldn’t close and than one of the legs broke
I've owned this tripod now for just about year.I use it for digital photography with a compact digital and video recording and FaceTime using an iPad.
i’ve used it so many times already. it is by far one of my best purchases. it is such great quality for the price.

The screw that you place the camera on is too little to securely hold the camera. The camera should not be able to wobble while on the stand. The legs are secure and just fine but the screw, which holds the camera in place is not sufficient.
Simple use and lightweight yet stable.
Very sturdy both the  tripod and carrying case.
Buena calidad para el precio que tiene, multiusos y solo no seas rudo para que te dure yo ya llevo 3 semanas con el o más no recuerdo... y aún funciona perfectamente.
one of the lock mechanisms broke so I can't clamp the leg in position to stay in place.
I love this so much. The carrying case is super convenient. The quick release tab screwed into my camera fine and is sooooo convenient. Makes me want to use my camera more. Really love it.
Very cheap and not stable at all. You get what you pay for!

Fantastic! This tripod is WAY better than I thought it would be! Very light weight, sturdy, simple to adjust, not a scratch. Very satisfied. Will recommend this exact product to everyone! I will definitely be buying again and also purchasing some for my family memebers.
Seems to work well and is durable.
the latch that locks the camera to the stand broke and I have no way to reorder the latch. note photo attached. Other wise a good value
Very nice unit for the price.  Compares to higher price units in terms of function and quality.
Bought mainly for video camera. A little hard to pan camera otherwise quality is very good for the price.

It’s amazing. It not too light, which is good cause it’s mostly wind resistant and it’s really big. I’m 5’4 and it’s perfect if I had to record while standing. I’m super excited to use it. I had to play with it a little to figure out what everything does.
Amazing quality, even more amazing price! Although I am not a professional photographer, this tripod exceeds my expectations for the price. Comes with nice case for easy carry. Highly recommended.

I love the removable head. I also find that this is just as study as a $100 tripod. The feet are adjustable, there is a hook, which I hang a small light from while doing night photography. The case is very nice. All in all, I really like it. Money very well spent.
For the price better than expected! Used it with a spotting scope, too heavy for this tripod. Must be delicate with hands on scope, light touch or it's to shaky.
Exactly what I expected. Did the job I wanted it to do.  NIce stand.
Absolutely fantastic! I can't imagine finding one that's better, especially for this price.

I honestly believe that you should shell out a little bit more money and get the next step up from this one. Amazon offers many great products but personally, I believe this one is just a little rickety. If you do a lot of video work, CONSIDER another one, possibly with a ball movement head to provide a smooth transition and no jittering. Nice, but not that nice.
It was very easy to figure out. The legs extend twice and can become very tall. It does take a while to get the hang of, but there are lots of options.

This tripod is great for the price. I have a Canon 80D (it’s a heavy DSLR) and that it safely holds the weight of my camera but the tripod is so light I don’t feel safe using it outdoors. I use it in my home studio for portraits and haven’t had any problems so far.

I wasn't expecting much out of this tripod - as I was purchasing it for the weight to carry on a 3 week road trip. For $20 (or less) you can't beat this. It's a great deal, and a great tripod. Make sure you inspect yours upon delivery! Mine arrived slightly damaged.
Love my tripod. So durable and easy to use. Very lightweight and love all the adjusting features. Very professional looking and comes at a reasonable cost. Definitely recommend.
I like this tripod. I haven't had any problems with it. I use it with my video recorder, Canon camera or my iPad. All fit well and the tripod has been stable.

I bought this tripod to replaced my previous one that I gave to my younger son. This tripod is just perfect because have so many features and is lightweight. It is extraordinary. I'm so glad I choose this one.

This product got great reviews, but most of them must be fake. It is anything with dturdy. It’s knobs are flimsy and do not tighten enough for a camera. Nut broke almost immediately on it. Piece of junk. Would not recommend.

This is a great, low-cost tripod. I use it for moderate home use and it does the job very well. It's very lightweight and comes with a nice carrying bag. It may break in a few years -- but they all do, so for this price, it's okay to buy another one at that point.
This is by far one of the best items I ordered. The price is wonderful and its very easy to use
nice stand for the money, they work perfect
Absolutely love this. Great quality especially for the price

Perfect for the price and weight.  The mount so far has been very durable and snaps on well (very little wiggling). The leg releases have held up well too. I recommend this for SLRs with medium to light lenses. I did use it with my 5d mark ii (28.8oz) and a Canon 100-400 f/4.5-5.6 (3.04lbs) and the tripod did alright, but I wouldn't put any more weight on it then that.

This tripod is probably the best you can get for the price. For amateur photography, I find it very sturdy but lightweight enough to carry around when shooting. When i first purchased it, I made the mistake of not locking the quick release plate when I mounted my camera. The plate cracked, and I emailed Amazon to see how much it would cost to replace. within 24 hours they shipped me an entirely new tripod! Great customer service and a product I would probably buy again if I damaged this one.  (the photo attached doesn’t show the tripod fully extended. it’s 60 inched when fully extended)
It’s a regular Tripod, I’ve used it to take pictures inside of my place and it looks nice and stable

But still sturdy.  Ive used this probably 10 times in the last year or so, and its lasted just fine.  My youtube channel is JerryRigEverything, so I make videos on a regular basis where i need a sturdy place to mount my camera.This stand has enough clamps and holds to keep my camera in any position that i need to have it.  It works well enough for an amateur camera guy like myself.

This was a perfect addition to the new dslr camera.  It's lightweight and easy to carry, but also easy to use for group photos or when you need a steady hand.  I love the built in level to make sure the camera is straight.

For around 20 dollars I really couldn't expect a tripod any different. Functioned well for around 2 weeks but after some heavy use for a film i was shooting, the rods that attach to the center came undone which was quite annoying because every 10-15 minutes i would need to put the nail back in. But for the price, not too bad you cant really expect more from an amazon tripod. Would recommend for timelapses and and a little photograpy it cant really hold my 15lbs rigs and other things with out flexing which makes me pretty worried that it would snap. But over all decent piece for the price

This is pretty well thought out for a lightweight tripod, and my intent was to take this for trekking because it is so lightweight. However, what I found was that the quick-disconnect plate that attaches to the bottom of one's camera does not fit precisely in the tripod assembly base plate and has some slight "wiggle" room. So even with just a not-so-large telephoto lens (200 mm) and low-light conditions or max zoom where one is manually and precise focusing; I found this 2-3 degrees of play to be very annoying as one would experience a lot of camera shake attempting to do so--which sucked up some time. Then it was also difficult to keep the subject focused in the center of the camera without trying to ratchet down super-tight, the vertical pan. (In this specific instance I was shooting longer-exposure shots of a partial moon rising in the morning with a 70-200 mm lens.) If one only is interested in daytime, non-extreme telephoto and non-precise or auto-focus shots, then it should work out great, because it is light-weight and otherwise smartly designed. Next iteration should have a more precise fitting of the quick-disconnect and tripod base plate.
I have bought a lot less for a lot more over the years. This does what it needs for most photography. Amateurishly speaking!🤗

This tripod is just OK.  It's lightweight, but not as sturdy as I would like. For still photos, it's not an issue.  I don't recommend buying this tripod for videos or panning.

This is a nice stand! It is fully adjustable and very easy to use. It has 2 easy to read bubble levels to get you leveled out after adjusting the height and angle. This was well worth the money and  a must have for amateur photography.

I'm very new to photography, so from a newbie perspective, this tripod totally satisfies my needs. I own a Sony alpha 77 and the tripod holds my camera really well. I like how I can extend the legs easily and it also has 2 levels attached. It is very light to carry, the quality is very decent considering its price. I'm VERY satisfied.

Don't buy this one. We purchased another brand before this and it worked perfect and then needed a second one so we purchased this one and was very disappointed. We will be going back to the other brand for any future purchases.

Just got it today and fooled around with it for awhile and was quite impressed. Read other reviews that said it was "sticky" when you swiveled it, mine turned just as smooth as could be. Great price for a good product.

I use this tripod for my bridge camera (Canon SX50) and my dSLR (Pentax K30). It holds both securely, even with a 70-300 zoom on the Pentax. I like the handle on the side. You can lift the tripod with the camera attached and move it easily. It is lightweight but also sturdy. Has a bubble level too.

I'm the furthest thing from a photography professional, so maybe my tastes aren't that refined, but I think this tripod is everything you'd need to take your photography to the next step, or even to grab some nicely staged shots.  It's cheap, stable, intuitive and moves and twists in every way you'd want.  It's very light in weight, but built solidly.  Overall, I wish I'd have bought it sooner.

I'm a photography newbie, just started learning it. So I'll give little different POV. This is supposed to be an affordable and basic tripod. Nothing wrong with the concept. But I didn't like it. One of the reason was weight, it's 2.7 lb, I have heavier, more sturdy tripod but wanted another much lighter tripod to carry it everywhere, so I thought it'd be good fit for that purpose. Unfortunately, I felt it's not really comfortable to be with all the time. Probably it was made from plastic and very bulky, so carrying it was little trouble to me.Also, "basic" doesn't mean it's for DSLR newbies. After learning basic photo shooting techniques, I quickly get annoyed its limited shooting positions. I shoot variety of projects from night sky, portrait, landscape, or macro. Sometime I put tripod on sandy beach or rocky surface. In that situations, connectors of legs and center pole prevent flexible positioning. This tripod might be great for certain type of photography, like cityscape, or anything you could expect flat and solid surface shooting. But other than that, I'd recommend to invest little more expensive, flexible tripod, like ball head ones for photography newbies.
Great tripod

This is an Amazon Basics item that does what I expected it to do and then some.  It had so many knobs to get that perfect angle, I was impressed.  I currently use it to hold my ProChrono Chronometer, but I can see it holding anything steady and at whatever angle you need it held.  The legs are double telescopic too, and everything folds up so easy, you can't go wrong.
Have not used in the field but will use this spring

An upgrade from free tripod that came with my camera. Lightweight, but has a hook for hanging a weight on. Feels sturdy, and has a handle. Packed with features I hadn't seen in my basic tripod: telescoping neck, removable camera dock and flexible feet. Great value!

After opening the tripod, I noticed immediately that I did not receive the black handle which is used to constrain the forward tilt. I am returning it..!
Works great! The little clip that goes on the bottom of the camera is cool! Seems to be very sturdy does exactly what j needed it to to for a great price
delivered as promised

This is a great light tripod! It comes with all the bells and whistles you could want in a tripod, levels, hook to attach weight, a quick release plate and more! For the price it is amazing, however keep in mind it is a lightweight tripod made out of thin aluminum so if your set up is pretty hefty or even if you want to use this outdoors I would say be careful!

The first couple of uses I did not have a problem. The third time I used this product a plastic piece securing my binoculars broke off and my binoculars feel onto the concrete causing them to break. Very disappointed with this product.
Amazing value. This tripod is stable, except in wind, and has all the adjustments you could want. It appears to be well made and I look forward to using it on my next road trip.
Impressed! New to photography but I love this! Easy to carry and love how you can adjust to where you need it.
Very basic tripod. Cheap construction. Clasp broke with minimal use. It works but not built for the long run.
Bought this to use for the total eclipse, worked great!

For around 20$ you can't go wrong with this. It is able to be adjusted in so many different ways and it's pretty smooth. Once you get used to pulling this thing out it's really quick to setup and it collapses down and is easy to carry. Love it.
This stand is very durable for my canon rebel t5i. It is a great deal and quality is way better than I expected for the price I paid!

I was extremely impressed with this tripod.  I was not expecting the quality that I got for the price.  If you are hesitant in purchasing this because the price is low, don't be!  It's very easy to use, well constructed, and the ability it gives me to use in pretty much every environment and any position I need makes this a tripod I will buy again when I need to.

Tripod has been great.  I fully trust the amazon basics brand now.  I take the tripod with me to rugged places for pictures when I go hiking/camping and also to sandy beaches.  It works great.  I've had zero issues with it.  And the price can't be beat for that level of quality.
Great tripod! It locks in place easy and the handle makes it a breeze to use! I use it for my Hero4. Be warned it doesn't come with the mount to attach the Hero4. But I knew that before buying.

I was initially a bit skeptical on this product based on the price alone but it has worked out great for what I need. The tripod itself is very light weight and compact. I've been bringing it with me while I hike and forget I'm even carrying it. It's made sturdy enough to hold my larger lens on my camera (which was an initial fear).
I have used this tripod few times and the one of the leg broke.  This tripod looks good but the quality is really bad. I do not recommend to buy this cheap tripod. Look for something else.
Holding up nicely to multiple 6th grade classes.

Light weight and easy to place. Great addition to my photography!
2nd product tried. Should have been the first. So much sturdier and not at all flimsy. Works great.

I bought this tripod for landscape photography and this was a perfect purchase. It is lightweight and gets tall (as the product name says with 60 inches as its max height). I am also a beginning photographer so I can't say anything about comparing it to thousand dollar tripods but it is an amazing product, sturdy, lightweight and does not feel cheap. It also comes with a quick release and the head of the tripod allows it to move up and down and side to side smoothly. Overall this can not get better for the price so buy it.
Was definitely sturdier than I had thought it would be.  And at a great  price. Could have paid  more and received less . But this was the choice for me.
A little bulky but I expected this from a $30 tripod, was pretty easy to setup and use.

Sturdy, adjustable, lightweight, and affordable.  Great value!

I can't believe how much tripod you get for so little money. Even for 50% more this would still be a good value. All of the joints are quite stable and there are a lot of small details that add quite a bit to the overall functionality. I'm very happy with this tripod.
Great product and very cost efficient!  Would highly recommend!

great product for the price.

excellent tripod for my camera and for on my hikes.  nice and sturdy, it is great for the price and while I know this is not a super high end setup, I know it does well for your average photographer on hikes.

this tripod is alright theres nothing to it its just a basic tripod but the spinning thing that makes the tripod taller popped off so im going to have to glue gun that back on cause its hard to turn it without it but anyways its pretty good totally recommend this tripod for youtube if your just begging

...with all the pros and cons of both qualities. It hasn't busted yet (that's a pro), but it isn't at all easy to position or manuever (that's a con). Gets the job done, just so long as the job doesn't require smooth movement of the camera or speedy setup/takedown.

I don't believe that tripods should be "lightweight." Yes, they shouldnt be 30lbs, But its extremely light. so light that I feel a heavy camera would be very risky to attach this too, such as a DSLR or bigger! My Samsung Camera isn't bulky or heavy so I'm not afraid at all to trust this Tripod with it. It twists into the tripod very easily and has a very secure grip on it. ALL THE BLACK MATERIAL YOU SEE IS PLASTIC. THE ONLY METAL IS THE SILVER POLES and Screw that lets you screw the camera onto the tripod. Definitely has that "cheap feel" but hey what did you expect?ITS 20 BUCKS! You honestly cant go wrong with this product if youre a beginner and/or have a lighter camera than a DSLR. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS TRIPOD, IF SO. 60 inches is the perfect height. Any smaller i'd be upset and disappointed. if you plan on using it to record things in motion, like moving the tripod from left to right, keep looking for a different tripod. I say this because, it can be stiff sometimes and this would make the video NOT have that smooth look when taping something in motion.

Honestly this tripod exceeded my expectations a bit. Quite durable and very easy to use. And it's light which is important when hiking ! Of course this is not a professional stand but I use it with not professional Nikon D5300 camera so win-win :)
Great product just as described good price point.

It also has the adapter. It doesn't fit my Vivitar, but it's similar for 1/3 the price of my Vivitar, and better quality.  Great deal.
An excellent product. Light weight and easy to carry. Very adjustable. Very good quality for the price. It's definitely worth it.

This is the worst thing I've seen with the Amazon Basics name attached.  This is absolute crap.  The mechanism that does the tilt/swivel is laughably nasty to use, and the latch that is meant to hold the part that you'd affix to your camera is so badly designed it causes harm.  I'm not kidding.  I destroyed a lovely pair of binoculars (https://smile.amazon.com/gp/product/B003AM87Q4/ref=oh_aui_search_detailpage?ie=UTF8&th=1) that are meant to be tripod mounted, because with the slightest pressure the latch holding your gear on the tripod with just give out.  My binoculars no longer point in the same direction, courtesy of this pitiful junk.  A decent tripod is not necessarily a big investment, but in this case, Amazon really came up short.

I use this tripod about 3 times a week, and I'll never go to another tripod, The fact that it's lightweight makes it easy to bring with me and make me not feel like I'm being dragged down with this and all of the other stuff I carry in my bag. No bargain here. It's not uncommon for me to find what I believe to be a real bargain on amazon warehouse deals but that is not the case with this tripod. Make no mistake, this is a very cheaply built tripod that is wobbly and loose. The center plastic nut that locks it in the open position fell off the very first time i opened it in my family room, not a good start. The rubber feet just press on and swivel, they fall off very easily apparently because  I walked about a half a mile away from my truck to try and spot some deer in a canyon. I mounted my lupould binoculars on it and couldn't make out anything worth viewing. There was a slight breeze about 5mph and it would shake the tripod enough that the I couldn't focus on anything. When I returned to the truck I noticed one of the feet had fallen off. I wasn't about to walk back looking for a 3/4 inch round piece of rubber so now after the first use its already missing pieces.  I think this would be a good tripod to have in a closet to mount a camera on and take family pictures a few times a year. If you are careful with it.

Never having used a tripod before, I didn't know quite what to expect, so I relied on the Amazon Basics brand, and the buyer ratings. I can see why they like this tripod! Light weight, but still so sturdy. It is NOT creaky or flimsy. The joints are tight. No wobble at all. There is even a handle to carry the tripod around after you get the camera positioned just right. I don't know who designed this tripod, but I'd like to thank him/her for thinking of everything!There are several height adjustments, starting at about 25" from the floor. The telescoping legs adjust with a flip of your thumb on the generously sized clamps, which hold the sections tightly. You can level each leg independently of the other two, in case you're shooting on a hill.
Great quality tripod with more than enough features at a great price.

I'm so glad I got it anyway, and here's why:For the price, you get far more quality than you'd expect. Yes, the materials are lightweight (aluminum and plastic) but when you're lugging around other equipment (e.g., a camera or camcorder) isn't that what you want? That said, I anticipate this tripod will see its share of scrapes and dings, but frankly, it's superficial and should not impact product performance. For context I am a hobbyist who hadn't bought a new tripod in something like 15 years. I was very impressed with this tripod. It has a solid and stable feel to it. It adjusts, easily, smoothly, and intuitively. It is reasonably light, though not light enough for hiking. It is also quite bulky, even when collapsed. The reason for the bulk is that this is the larger version of this tripod--they make a smaller version that might be of more practical use to many. For those who care about such things, the legs are constrained in how far they can swing out and cannot swing out independently of each other. It has a large handle for ease of moving around that can be a minor obstacle when setting up.

I was actually impressed with this tripod, as it is my 1st, and it got the job done. However, after one year of moderate use the thing LITERALLY started falling apart! I am anal with all my camera equipment and like to keep it in good shape. I never dropped the product, or anything crazy just regular "tripod use." Two of the aluminum bars that are attached to the tripod lost a screw and magically fell and now the tripod cannoit balance properly without it. Despite this deficiency, I still went along and used it because, hey the tripid is cheap in price. The last straw was when one of the tripod legs literally snapped off while I was capturing a long exposure. Luckily, I caught my D750 before it fell face 1st , my 24-70mm would have likely shattered! This is unacceptable quality. Anytime a product literally breaks apart through light use is a huge red flag for me, as it should for anyone. I am a loyal Amazon customer and RARELY write reviews, but after my camera almost broke because of this cheap quality product I felt obligated to write a review.. Amazon if you are reading this I demand a product replacement.Buyers beware of possible tripod leg snapping, it could cost you alot if your camera or expensive lens breaks!

Adding a superb to what everyone else here has written, adding a caution. When unloading from an SUV I stood the tripod, re-packed in its case, up against the outside of the van.  VERY bad move. It's unstable like this, toppled over, hit the pavement. Of course it had to be the locking handle that got pranged, deep inside the inner part of the handle is a washer, the rim of that washer got sheared off from its mount --- now the locking handle won't. I can do a workaround b/c the shoe still fits securely on three of the four sides of its mounting ridges, and I can make it work by firmly holding the cam in place.... losing the use of one hand.  This all happened after a night shoot with an intact tripod, gave me no problems at all, a great value for the low price.  Going out again today (Wed Sept 7) to the Pacific seacoast for another shoot in twilight, early darkness, so we will see.  A little surprised that this damage was inflicted so easily, prob either have to replace the whole turret or the whole tripod itself, my hunch is that it will be much less expensive to buy a new tripod.  A stitch in time saves nine!

Great for the free item that comes with the camera. Holds up my Canon 6d just fine but it's still nothing like an expensive tripod.
Great tripod for the price.  Wife loves it!
Setting up was super easy! Held my camera- have yet to test it on the beach
cool item I use it with my cell phone (Samsung 6 edge, the universal smartphone tripod adapter, and the Fintie Bluetooth Wireless Multimedia Remote...

I purchased it because it is light weight, with a carry-handle, right height, and the price was right.  I only used it twice. Then the elevation handle knob broke and the knob falls off. I guess you get what you pay for. Bummer.
This is a great tripod for the price.  I use it often with my camera and my GoPro.  They sell an attachment for the GoPro that will hook onto this tripod.  I use this thing all the time!
I got this for a Simmons spotting scope that came with a very small stand.  This is easy to use, easy to set up, and easy to store.
Excellent product!
Perfect tripod for our kids to use on our deck with binoculars. A little small for me. (I'm 6 ft tall for reference)
Perfect for what I needed. Great tripod that has many different options for sizing.
This is so easy to use! I love the way the legs go up and down with a flip of the lock.
Buy it, without a doubt!  Lots of handy neat features too!  Well built and light, yet strong.  I love it!
I am very happy with this tripod. As it is said in its name, it is lightweight, but it is also sturdy. It seems to be made well and came with a bag that is nice as well. I would buy it again.
I WAS SCAMMED!!!!! I received a box that looked like it would hold a tripod, but instead was given an empty golf ball carrier. Total SCAM. I would like my money back
First the price I was very pleased with the quality of this.
Worked for my son to take our family pics while on vacation!
It’s nice and you can do a lot with it. I like it very much.
Well built and very stable. Will work great for my projects.

Affordable. Basic. Functional. I am pleased. Not a pro stand, but all I need as a casual user. Great for Gymnastic meets and school assembly. I added an attachment to hold my iPhone 5S and get great videos. AIso use it with my Nikon D90. Holds it perfect.
Great product for the price.
